story:
Corelli [and band] project

Hi there, friends!

I'm Catherine Corelli, a singer/songwriter, composer, arranger, guitarist, lyricist, actress, painter from Moscow, Russia, half-Italian, quarter-Polish, quarter-Russian. I've been making music for a long time, actually most of my life, but the first instrumental album I made was finished in 2003. I started publishing my self-produced albums for free on Jamendo.com [http://www.jamendo.com/en/artist/360816/catherine-corelli] in 2010. All these years I've been looking for a band, for soul-mates, for someone with whom I could form a real project, the one I would be able to bring to live shows to Europe, Canada, USA, England etc.

And at last it happened! Right now I got the entire crew, a band that is able to perform a brilliant record and also bring the album to live shows with all the passion, masterpiece and expression possible directly to where you live.


CORELLI band is:

Alex Alexandrov - drums, percussions
Alfred Norton - bass, techs
Alan Matthews - keyboards, trumpet
Cat Corelli - vocals, guitar


What do we have for you?

For the last two months I'm working on a re-make of my old 2010 album 'Through The Gehenna' [http://www.jamendo.com/en/list/a73014/through-the-gehenna]. The re-make already has it's first single, 'Snow' that is published and available for free streaming and downloading here: 

https://artistsignal.com/corelli



Outta Gehenna [Demo Preview]

As you may get it from a simple compare, the re-make [Outta Gehenna] is not only a re-record, a re-arrangement, but in a huge part a whole one big re-concept, a new experience, and the new shape and sound of the album rather tends to alternative/rock/sky-fi/rapping. Contrary to the 2010 version these old songs have a more solid, rocking and up-tempo beat. And the sweetest part of it all is the live performance. Back in 2010 I had no drummer, no bass-player, no guitarist, and I was just making the whole thing on my PC in Reason 4.0, but times change. 


We have a nice studio in Kiev, Ukraine and all the necessary stuff there to do a real, rich, rocky hell of a sound for you, guys. I've been to that studio with another project and was really impressed with it's quality together with the exclusive charisma of it's owner. I'll upload a video on YouTube about our record session there with L Angels so that you could see what's up! 


Here is the Outta Gehenna track-list, that will include a couple of re-makes from the Reborn Heart album [http://www.jamendo.com/en/list/a116153/reborn-heart]

  1. Soarcry
  2. Dark Singer
  3. Don't Ask
  4. Private
  5. Snow
  6. Bitch
  7. No Love For Tomorrow
  8. Outta Gehenna
  9. It Comes From Nowhere
  10. Deserve
  11. Lucky Trickster [Reborn Heart re-make]
  12. Lost Secrets [Reborn Heart re-make]

Actually we need 6.000$ to record this 12-track album and also handle the trip to Kiev from Moscow. As a result we'll give you a full-length head-bang-rocking-the-very-soul album that will give us a real chance to come with live shows to your country and bring you the passion and spirit of true rock'n'roll!


And do you know what are we fighting for here? Our music is a stand-up against the so-called fake-plastic-soulless-crap culture, against the dead-born modern mass-media. Our music is born in freedom, it comes from our hearts with sincerity and drive and we're here to bring it to you, to lit your hearts up, to make your eyes shine, to fill you with the true spirit of rock, with the spirit of life and love and freedom!

After the album is recorded and mixed we'll publish it on CDBaby.com and also order CD manufacturing so that you'd be able to get a hard firm disk in your hands with all the creative art-work and inside-bonuses!

Now lets get further to what you really get helping us on this album. Aside of the perks you see listed there we give you:

  1.  the chance to party with us when we get to your town, city, wherever we get with our live shows.
  2. your names listed on our page on CDBaby.com (or wherever we have our pages) with our sincere thanks for your support and help.
  3. a limited amount of 'pluses' or free tickets to our shows
  4. if you want we can give you T-shirts, magnets, badges with our logos, photos etc.
  5. special offer for few people: you'll have a chance to join us on tour!
  6. special offer from Cat Corelli: 'I can provide on-line Skype lessons on composing, music theory, form, structure, arrangement, etc.'
  7. we'll be recording a video footage of our studio record in Kiev, so you may have the chance to be the owner of some exclusive movies about us.
  8. Aside of all the written inside-CD thanks we also give our special thanx on our YouTube chanel and of course bring it to all of our friends and fans and family.
  9. The author of the best cover-version on any of these 12 songs will be featured with his work on our next album and also will have the chance to sing and/or play with us live when we come to his/her country!

for any suggestions contact Cat Corelli either on https://www.facebook.com/catherine.corelli

either on ladycatherinecorelli@gmail.com


P.S.: I mentioned the mirrors and paintings in the Perks, so here are some photos of this art-stuff.

story:
Disheveled Tour 2013, with no tires.

It is time for us to venture out across the country to bring you high energy, emotional live shows. While getting things ready for our upcoming tour with Die Sektor, the new tires we had purchased to put on our car, were stolen. We are left with old tires that will not get us across the country (some 1600 miles). 

Every contribution that is made goes directly to getting these for our vehicle. Anything over will go to our tour fund. Let's face it, in this day - touring is pretty expensive and quite the challenge. We are stoping at nothing to overcome this and bring you the shows that you want to see! 

 

This is a very short bit of information. We don't run campaigns, but we leave for our tour July 4th, and are unable to come up with an unexpected $800 for new tires, after already having bought new ones. This campaign is set to 7 days, because of the little time we have before leaving.

story:
Listen to 5 extracts from "Bélanger Pure Cello"!!!

Elite-Etüden N°6 - Friedrich Grützmacher (teaser) **
Elite-Etüden N°5 - Friedrich Grützmacher (teaser) **
Elite-Etüden N°4 - Friedrich Grützmacher (teaser) **
Intermezzo e danza finale - Gaspar Cassado (teaser)
Andante con variazioni - Max Reger (teaser)

** World Premiere Recording

_____________________________________________________________________________

"Vincent Belanger is a young cellist with great depth, passion, and a phenomenal technique!"

#DavidChesky Multi-Grammy nominated, composer and co-founder of Chesky Records and HDtracks

_____________________________________________________________________________

"RockyFest Award Alert!
Best Sound: Vincent Bélanger 
Best-Sounding Component: Monsieur Bélanger's 200-year old cello
Most Impressive Audio Demonstration: Audio Note UK"

#HerbReichert , Stereophile, Oct 6, 2015

_____________________________________________________________________________

The Ultimate Listening Experience !

   
 

Studies

Vincent Bélanger studied at the Québec Conservatory and moved on to the Montpellier National Conservatory in France where he graduated with the highest honors. He furthered his studies two additional years with renowned French cellist, Yvan Chiffoleau. Followed by a master class with Yo-Yo Ma.

Professional Experience

Vincent particularly enjoys playing rare and unique works. Some were composed for him, as in the case of a Chinese work with which he toured Canada for the month-long Chinese New Year Celebration shows. In 2011, he was the featured cellist in an extensive tour of China and Vietnam. He is also credited with several original scores for theater and film, the latest being the critically acclaimed “Ce qu’il ne faut pas dire”, released in Montreal in May 2015.

His album “LÀ”,released in Spring 2011 on Fidelio, received unanimous critical and public praise both in North America and overseas, including China. It was ranked a best seller for several week on the US site HDTracks.com.

https://vincentbelanger.bandcamp.com

The Current Project

His first solo album of rare and never-before-recorded music for solo cello reflects perfectly Vincent’s desire to reach out to a large public. He hopes to simultaneously touch everyone with the sheer beauty of the music while impressing them with the very high level of virtuosity it requires.

Why Your Support Matters

Supporting Vincent’s unique project makes you a participant in a state-of-the-art musical product giving you a new and exciting listening experience. You will be the First to listen to a First. In today’s global recording world, supporting such an innovative professional project also means you believe in supporting the very finest talents.

What We Need to Complete the Project

The works have been recorded in an historical church near Boston which boasts perfect acoustics. The project’s total cost is evaluated at $30,000. We need a minimum of $10,000 from supporters to see it through. The balance will be financed  by special events we will be holding.

The funds we garner will serve to pay for a new bow, better suited for the repertoire, recording costs – equipment, rental of facility - technical team, artwork for the manufacturing of the cd, vinyl and their promotion.

This project is unique in its musical content, the excellence of the interpretation  and the use of the most sophisticated recording techniques and  the best recording engineers working to produce the very best sound.  In short, we are aiming for a listening experience that will blow you out of your seat !

In such a competitive, crowded recording world, THE ONLY way to stand out is by originality and excellence and this is what we ask you to support.



What they have to say:

Peter Qvortrup, Audio Note UK

"It pleases me greatly to have the opportunity to support a fine musician such as yourself in your efforts to communicate the beauty, hope, power an passion of music to your audience. 
Thus, it is with great pleasure that I have fully sponsor your new bow. I look forwarde to hearing your newest recording, Bélanger - Pure Cello to hear the result!"

Scott Hull, Part Time Audiophile
"That was the best thing I heard, hands down and game over. Of course, that was live. Hardly fair. That said, a nod is due — it was a marvelous demo.
After hearing Bélanger play, I was done. Show was over. I went home and cried like a lost little baby (well, no, not quite, but I was teary for an hour, which is almost the same thing)." September 2015

Jeremy Bryan, MBL North America

"MBL North America has worked with Vincent Belanger on several occasions. He is a musician of the highest order; one whose love for his instrument is only superseded by his love for music. This virtuosity oozes from Vincent's very pores. You feel this whether you are experiencing his playing live or recorded."

Keith Pray,  publisher of Stereophile Magazine 


"Playing the Cello with Vincent was an experience that I will never forget... The connection between instrument and Vincent was captivating and the sound produced was intoxicating."

Robert Deutsch, Stereophile Magazine

“Vincent Bélanger is a gifted cellist…always impressing with his  musicianship.”  March 2015

François Dompierre, composer

Mon cher Vincent,
Ces deux pièces de Reger sont magnifiquement interprétées. BRAVO!!!
Je suis vraiment très impressionné.
J’ai bien hâte d’avoir le temps de t’écrire les œuvres dont je t’ai parlées.
Salutations amicales!


What is on the disc:

Gaspar Cassadó (1897-1966): Suite for solo cello
  • Preludio - Fantasia
  • Sardana (danza)
  • Intermezzo e danza finale
Frederich Grützmacher (1832-1903): Elite-Etüden*
First recording!
  • No 3: Johann-Baptist Baumg

    ärtner : 

    Fuga 

  • No 4: 

    Luigi Boccherini : 

    Allegro - Moderato 

  • No 5: 

    Jean-Louis Duport : 

    Allegro (non- troppo) 

  • No 6: 

    Jean-Baptiste Bréval : 

    Aria (Andante & Allegro)

*These 12 etudes were based on the works of former old masters of cello, with Grützmacher's personal touch, making them worthy of encores, and recital pieces. 

Johann-Sebastian Bach (1685-1750): 5th suite for solo cello (exerpt):

  • Prelude
Max Reger (1873-1916): Suite No 3
  • Präludium (Sostenuto)
  • Scherzo (Vivace)
  • Andante con variationi
____________________________________________________________________________

Breakdown of costs...

  • Studio (The Church): $1000
  • Sound Engineer: $4000
  • Music Director: $3000
  • Mastering: $2000
  • Sound technician: $800
  • Photographer: $500
  • Film maker: $500
  • Recording equipments rental: $5000
  • Artwork: $1000
  • Music Licensing: $500
  • Bow:$4500

  • Press agent: $500

  • CD manufacturing: $1,500
  • Vinyl 180g manufacturing: $3,200
  • Travel expenses: $2000

Et Voilà!  We plan to raise two third of that budget with different home concerts, a silent auction, and the support of few private sponsors, as of today we already have raised enough money to pay for the bow "thanks to Audio Note UK" and we completed the recording session.

_____________________________________________________________________________

Thank you for visiting my project. I sincerely hope that we have been successful in making you part of this exciting and unique adventure and that you will see it appropriate to share this with your friends and acquaintances. If their are not all that familiar with classical music, this is the perfect time to introduce them to this wonderful wold.

With my best regards

Vincent

story:
Who are you, and why do you want my money?

Here's a quick summary: i'm caleb mueller, a Canadian artist and musician, and i've been releasing music as Decomposure since 2002. In summer 2010, i embarked on a project creatively titled 'the podcast project', wherein i wrote and recorded a completely new song every week (or at least tried to) and posted it up as a podcast online. Now i'm over here in fall 2011, sitting on a stack of songs that i'm pretty pleased with, and i'd love to polish my favourites into a digestible album and release them into the great wide ocean out there.


But beyond that, i'm at the point right now where it isn't good enough to just put it up on iTunes, or have a pressing plant spit out a few shrinkwrapped plastic things. As a graphic artist by day, i send booklets and posters and brochures to printers all the time, and they handle it all perfectly, filling box after box with sharp, precise, color-matched copies. But i don't want that for my music. i don't want to stand off to the side while other people carry out my orders, i want to be in it, putting my imperfect self into each scrappy copy. Maybe i'm just in denial or deluded, but if i'm going to approach this album as a serious checkpoint, i want it to be handmade, tactile, personal, unique. And i want that DIY experience to be available to everyone, not just people who can afford the deluxe edition.


So, i have some big ideas for this album, and in order to make them work, i need your help.


Where does the money go?

First and foremost, your money will go directly toward paying down the album's engineering, pressing and packaging costs. That's the basic amount i need to fully develop the album as i envision it - if i reach that, i'll be ecstatic. Here's a rough estimate of the cost breakdown:

  • $500.00 - Engineering and post-production
  • $500.00 - Pressing the physical CDs
  • $1500.00 - Materials for building the album art and packaging
  • $3000.00 - Promotion

You'll notice that last number is bigger than the first three combined, and has nothing to do with the album itself. (Most labels spend a lot more.) This is one of those unavoidable realities about music, one i honestly hate thinking about. But for the vast overwhelming majority of us musicians, the 'viral hit' fairy doesn't swoop down and save us - the interweb is dense with forgotten albums played once for single-digit audiences. Practically speaking, in order to be heard, someone with smarts and connections and tenacity needs to get on the phone and tell people over and over and over that i exist and that i'm worth listening to. Some people are good at this. i'm not. Demonstrably so. i suck at it, frankly.


So, the inclusion of this (pretty minimal) amount of promotion is just me dreaming a little bigger, setting a good ambitious goal - having a finished album is great, but it'd also be nice if people, you know, wanted it. Sure, it's just icing, but then, not many people like cake without icing. Chances are, you heard about me through some radio station or reviewer (or a friend who heard it from them, etc.), and you would have missed out on this album if it weren't for that. Helping me tackle this means that you'll be one of those special seed-people responsible for a harvesting a brand new crop of Decomposure fans. And that would be pretty cool, right? Right?


What do i get for being awesome?

Details are a still a little sketchy at the moment, as some things are reliant on funding - i'll update as things progress. So, depending on your level of support, you can get:

  1. Your name in the album's 'thank you' credits and listed on the Blank Squirrel website.
  2. The album - As yet untitled (though i'm really really close to picking one), it will be 50-60 minutes of finely engineered music packaged in colorful handmade album art, complete with lyrics of course.
  3. Digital copy - There's always a large gap between the date the album is engineered and the date it's actually released, but you'll get a secret link that lets you access a digital copy much sooner.
  4. 'Complete' CD full of extra songs - Containing the remaining songs from the Podcast Project that didn't make it to the album for reasons of time and flow.
  5. 'Special Features' bonus disc - A DVD-ROM loaded up with even more bonus stuff, including videos, sound sources, images, instrumentals and acappellas, all the original podcasts, and more!
  6. Decomposure T-Shirt - Available exclusively to people who donate here. They'll be limited-run screenprints on shirts made in either Canada or the US.
  7. Decomposure's discography - Everything Decomposure has ever released on one snappy little USB drive or memory stick, including bonus stuff!
  8. A lyric book - Again, completely exclusive. Made and bound by hand, containing the words to every song Decomposure's released up 'til now. Limited quantities available.
  9. One totally exclusive song - Donors who hit this level will get access to a completely new song that i will never release outside of this offer.
  10. 'Producer' credit - in a giant font.


Above all that, you'll be investing in me - i can't tell you how wonderful it is to have the music i create actively supported by people. Most of the time, i am quite sure i'm all alone in this, dropping another stillborn into the vast silent pit of time. i'm getting better at being okay with that, but i'd be lying if i said i didn't well up with joy whenever i'm proven wrong, even slightly.


So prove me wrong, please! Thank you in advance.
story_txt:
Who are you, and why do you want my money?

Here's a quick summary: i'm caleb mueller, a Canadian artist and musician, and i've been releasing music as Decomposure since 2002. In summer 2010, i embarked on a project creatively titled 'the podcast project', wherein i wrote and recorded a completely new song every week (or at least tried to) and posted it up as a podcast online. Now i'm over here in fall 2011, sitting on a stack of songs that i'm pretty pleased with, and i'd love to polish my favourites into a digestible album and release them into the great wide ocean out there.


But beyond that, i'm at the point right now where it isn't good enough to just put it up on iTunes, or have a pressing plant spit out a few shrinkwrapped plastic things. As a graphic artist by day, i send booklets and posters and brochures to printers all the time, and they handle it all perfectly, filling box after box with sharp, precise, color-matched copies. But i don't want that for my music. i don't want to stand off to the side while other people carry out my orders, i want to be in it, putting my imperfect self into each scrappy copy. Maybe i'm just in denial or deluded, but if i'm going to approach this album as a serious checkpoint, i want it to be handmade, tactile, personal, unique. And i want that DIY experience to be available to everyone, not just people who can afford the deluxe edition.


So, i have some big ideas for this album, and in order to make them work, i need your help.


Where does the money go?
First and foremost, your money will go directly toward paying down the album's engineering, pressing and packaging costs. That's the basic amount i need to fully develop the album as i envision it - if i reach that, i'll be ecstatic. Here's a rough estimate of the cost breakdown:




$500.00 - Engineering and post-production


$500.00 - Pressing the physical CDs


$1500.00 - Materials for building the album art and packaging


$3000.00 - Promotion




You'll notice that last number is bigger than the first three combined, and has nothing to do with the album itself. (Most labels spend a lot more.) This is one of those unavoidable realities about music, one i honestly hate thinking about. But for the vast overwhelming majority of us musicians, the 'viral hit' fairy doesn't swoop down and save us - the interweb is dense with forgotten albums played once for single-digit audiences. Practically speaking, in order to be heard, someone with smarts and connections and tenacity needs to get on the phone and tell people over and over and over that i exist and that i'm worth listening to. Some people are good at this. i'm not. Demonstrably so. i suck at it, frankly.


So, the inclusion of this (pretty minimal) amount of promotion is just me dreaming a little bigger, setting a good ambitious goal - having a finished album is great, but it'd also be nice if people, you know, wanted it. Sure, it's just icing, but then, not many people like cake without icing. Chances are, you heard about me through some radio station or reviewer (or a friend who heard it from them, etc.), and you would have missed out on this album if it weren't for that. Helping me tackle this means that you'll be one of those special seed-people responsible for a harvesting a brand new crop of Decomposure fans. And that would be pretty cool, right? Right?


What do i get for being awesome?
Details are a still a little sketchy at the moment, as some things are reliant on funding - i'll update as things progress. So, depending on your level of support, you can get:



Your name in the album's 'thank you' credits and listed on the Blank Squirrel website.


The album - As yet untitled (though i'm really really close to picking one), it will be 50-60 minutes of finely engineered music packaged in colorful handmade album art, complete with lyrics of course.


Digital copy - There's always a large gap between the date the album is engineered and the date it's actually released, but you'll get a secret link that lets you access a digital copy much sooner.


'Complete' CD full of extra songs - Containing the remaining songs from the Podcast Project that didn't make it to the album for reasons of time and flow.


'Special Features' bonus disc - A DVD-ROM loaded up with even more bonus stuff, including videos, sound sources, images, instrumentals and acappellas, all the original podcasts, and more!


Decomposure T-Shirt - Available exclusively to people who donate here. They'll be limited-run screenprints on shirts made in either Canada or the US.


Decomposure's discography - Everything Decomposure has ever released on one snappy little USB drive or memory stick, including bonus stuff!


A lyric book - Again, completely exclusive. Made and bound by hand, containing the words to every song Decomposure's released up 'til now. Limited quantities available.


One totally exclusive song - Donors who hit this level will get access to a completely new song that i will never release outside of this offer.


'Producer' credit - in a giant font.





Above all that, you'll be investing in me - i can't tell you how wonderful it is to have the music i create actively supported by people. Most of the time, i am quite sure i'm all alone in this, dropping another stillborn into the vast silent pit of time. i'm getting better at being okay with that, but i'd be lying if i said i didn't well up with joy whenever i'm proven wrong, even slightly.

So prove me wrong, please! Thank you in advance.

story:
The goal …"to challenge myself to take my music and playing to the next level. To create an album that is world class"

The first album I ever heard George Benson’s album "Breezin"made me want to play music as a career. My dream was that someone would one day feel the same way about my music and it would inspire them to want to do the same.

Music has definitely been the greatest gift in my life and has helped an otherwise very shy person express feelings and ideas through music. My childhood dream was to go to New York to play with world class musicians that I grew up listening to as a kid in the 70's like Miles Davis, Thelonius Monk, Charlie Parker, John Coltrane and be the best player I could be and write great music. For me New York represented the place you went to if you wanted to challenge yourself to be the best. I hope through this process that I'll get to experience that childhood dream.

This album is a dedication to all those great players that inspired me over the years. 

To friends, family and all those who have supported me all these years ….I hope you already know how much I appreciate the love and support you have shown to me, thank you for sharing this journey with me. thank you to artist/photographer Patricia Miller for creating the artwork for the album cover. 

http://www.stowersmusic.com

story:
If you believe in the redemptive power of music to make a difference during hard times, please consider helping us to make Mistress & Muse a reality. I have been writing and recording music for twenty years, having played with Dave Sharp & The Hard Travelers in New Orleans, with my own band Rise & Run, and as a solo act from Austin, TX to New Orleans and points in between. I've released CDs under my own name, as 2Take Tim, as Othy, and with the international band project Ramshackle Say Parade.

I have been concentrating on a ficiton writing career as of late, having published my first novel, Dutch Curridge, in 2010, Those Who Know Us Best Don't Know Us At All in 2011 and Keachi: A Faery Tale this year. I wasn't planning on recording new music right now, but something funny happened on a night in the early summer of 2012. 

Growing up and into adulthood, music had always been a refuge during troubled times. And so, caught once again during a really low moment, it wasn't unnatural for me to sit down at a piano, even if I hadn't done so in almost a year. What was completely unusual is that, when I stood up an hour or so later, I had an entire collection of new music and a heart-felt idea that this should be heard by more than me. 

I decided I needed to record this music. As a reminder to myself to never abandon its healing power. As a gift back to the source from which it sprang. As a gift to that one other person who, finding him or herself in a dark moment, might find hope enough to travel on til daybreak.

I believe the arts matter. I believe a world that turns its back on the arts turns against itself. I believe in this project. It is more personal and meaningful to me than almost anything I've created.

I moved forward and began putting the vision into effect, turning the music in my head into something that could be passed on, that could become something bigger. A couple of close friends took an interest and lent a hand. And we took it a little bit farther. Now we ask you to join.

There are only three main movements of music in this project, but they move like long and winding rivers. The water moves along at its own pace; the river steadfast and constant, deep and shallow and deep again. The complete collection is over 40 minutes. We have just a little more to go to complete the journey. It started with one voice, one upright piano, one hour of time. We would love for it to end in a parade. Please consider becoming a part. This is music about music, for the people who love it.

Cheers,

Tim Bryant

story:
Send Monique of the Satin Dollz to the UK!

Support the Dollz in our effort to go on a UK tour with our pals the Jive Aces 

Support me, Monique, in getting across the pond! Your funds will get me there so I can Sing and Swing this summer with the Jives.

The Satin Dollz will be performing at the War and Peace Revial and a number of other locations.

We're also recording a new single with the Jive Aces that you can receive, hot off the presses, for contributing to our travel fund!

Fund our flights!

Let's be honest, Air Travel is expensive these days! I need to raise $1500 for my ticket so I can charm audiences all over Great Britain!

Hey, What's in it for me?

See to the right for a range of perks! From our new EP to the Dollz performing at your next event any contribution will get you a piece of the Dollz! Don't let our options limit you though, click on through to contribute any denomination of your choosing!

xoxoxo

Monique Dubois

story:
Short Summary

Hello World, we are the Ohio Valley Pop/Punk-Core powerhouse We Must Save The Princess! This campaign is to help us fund our Debut Full-Length album, or in other words, to help us make our dreams come true. We are a group of musicians who do not come from money, and are playing in an area that is not known for money. We are just 6 extremely passionate young men who are trying to make great music for you all to hear. We are currently in need of $2500 in order to make this happen in the studio that we want, Studio 344. Being that we are 6 gentlemen who dont have much to offer, our Perks are unique. We are offering a copy of our two newest singles, a band sticker and wristband for anyone who donates $10 or more. Now what we do have to offer is the following; we currently play with two huge on-stage banners. If you donate $250 or more, you are going to get one of these banners, signed by the entire band, to display wherever you may want to.If we are to not reach our desired goal, do not worry, we will record what we are able to then keep trying to raise the money however we can. We are very dedictaed to our music, and we will not stop until we have an album that we can be proud of and you can fall in love with.

The Impact

The impact you will have on not only our music but our lives by contributing is a huge one. Its not everyday that you are able to help make someones dream come true by doing so little, but that is how much this means to us. Every donation, small or large, to us is a huge impact. Its another step to being able ot do what a lot of bands in the world are unable to do, and that is have their music heard. That is all we want, to be heard.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to contribute, simply checking us out on Facebook will be a huge help to us. Giving us a listen and telling someone about us. Talk to us about joining our street team. Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word. Anything you can do to help we will appreciate so much. This really does mean the world to us, and we thank you so much for whatever you are able to do, even if its just reading this and checking out our music.

story:
Help us raise $15,000 towards FM World Charities initiatives.

FM World Charities, a registered 501(c)(3) not-for-profit organization devoted to promoting public health and improving the quality of life in underserved communities throughout the world, is seeking to raise the remaining $15,000 of a $50,000 initiative so it can provide its legendary free skin cancer screening and awareness at this year's Gathering of the Vibes Music Festival in July 2013. FM has already broken records worldwide for mobile skin cancer screenings in North America and Europe, successfully screening over 10,000 concert attendees, in which over 1,500 needed follow-up. Help us continue to save lives in this much needed healthcare concern.

At FM we believe that part of providing adequate healthcare is to help screen for common illnesses before they become life threatening. One concept that we developed is to provide skin cancer screening sessions and awareness during concerts and other public events. Since FM is a music-based charity, having roots in an established record label, it is uniquely able to reach the youth demographic, mainly 16-25 year olds, who attend music concerts and festivals. This group is important to reach because they are at increasingly greater risk of skin cancer. In 2008 FM went on the Vans Warped Tour, the nation's longest running concert festival touring series, and conducted the largest mobile screening ever in 46 cities throughout the U.S. and Canada, screening over 6,500 concert attendees, in which over 700 needed follow-up. FM handed out 10,000 UV protective products and skin cancer awareness literature.

Following up on that success, FM has since provided these screenings at the 2009 Surf Expo, conducted a cancer awareness initiative and seminar at the 2009 Boston Music Conference, performed screenings at the 2010 UC MusicFest (Clark, NJ), and screened over 2200 concert attendees in France on the FM/NRJ/FDJ Music Tour in the summer of 2010. FM also ran successful screenings at the legendary Gathering of the Vibes Music Festival in 2011 and 2012.  

World Skin Cancer

In the US in 2008 alone, 59,695 people were diagnosed with melanoma, and 8,623 people died from it. In some parts of the world, such as Australia, people are four times more likely to develop skin cancer than any other form of cancer. Approximately 2 out of 3 Australians will be diagnosed with skin cancer before the age of 70. Melanoma has also become the most common cancer in women between the ages of 25 and 29. However, if detected early, the survival rate for patients with skin cancer is about 99%.

FM’s screenings at music concerts and festivals are crucial in that they not only increase the number of individuals being screened for these conditions but, given the age of the people usually attending these events, they introduce the idea of preventative health care to a young audience. For example, the incidence of skin cancers is increasing rapidly throughout the world. A small lesion that develops when a person is 20 years of age will often be ignored for years before it becomes symptomatic and life threatening. Early diagnosis and treatment is the key to avoiding these problems.

According to Eric Gast, CEO of FM World Charities, “The Warped Tour not only gave us an increase in the number of individuals being screened for these conditions, but given the age demographic of this US country wide and Canada tour, it introduced the idea of preventative health care to a young audience. Our hope is to increase awareness and provide rudimentary screenings particularly to this young age group, who seldom are concerned with health issues. This program is somewhat revolutionary for a charity to be administering an initiative across a tour of this magnitude.” 

How We Do It

The portable screening stations that FM uses in its mobile screenings utilize SIAscopy technology. SIAscopy makes use of the way light interacts with skin – the way it scatters or bounces and the amount absorbed by cells and other structures. These small handheld machines are becoming popular to evaluate questionable lesions and will make it easier to screen larger numbers of people. Photographs of the lesions are taken and later re-evaluated. If there is anything suspicious about the lesion, the patient will be contacted by mail or phone and directed to the appropriate medical facility for confirming diagnosis and follow up treatment.

The Gathering of the Vibes

The Gathering of the Vibes (GOTV) is one of the world's longest running music festivals going. GOTV is an annual four-day music, camping and arts festival that showcases a very diverse variety of music. In both 2011 and 2012 FM brought cancer awareness and ran successful screenings reaching thousands of festival attendees.

Help FM this year make a real difference in our public's health and awareness. If you or a loved one have been affected by cancer, we urge you to help us prevent and bring awareness to one of the most preventable cancers around the world. Check out below what we need and what we can offer to you.

Other FM Initiatives:  

Legacy of Hope: the Nelson Mandela Children's Hospital Concerts

In 2012, FM World Charities embarked on its "Legacy of Hope" initiative: an international multimedia concert in partnership with the Nelson Mandela Children's Hospital Trust (NMCH), in cooperation with Operation of Hope. Through this partnership, FM World Charities will produce a multi-media concert featuring major artists performing on two continents simultaneously. The goal of this event is to raise awareness and funds towards the establishment of the Nelson Mandela Children's Hospital in Johannesburg, South Africa. Unique and revolutionary to this event will be the delivery of a documentary, broken down into short vignettes, interspersed between artists' performances. This documentary will celebrate the life and living legacy of Nelson Mandela . This year long "Legacy of Hope" initiative will be an educational push through music, culminating in this momentous simulcast concert.

Nelson Mandela said "A dedicated children's hospital will be a credible demonstration of the commitment of African leaders to place the rights of children at the forefront. Nothing less would be enough."

 

Our Goal: 

What We Need & What You Get

FM needs to reach its goal of $15k towards its free skin cancer screenings at the Gathering of the Vibes Music Festival in July 2013. Funds will go towards such expenses as the SIAscopy equipment, cameras and laptops, food and lodging, printing for educational materials, medical scrubs, branded materials and give-aways (e.g., sunscreen) and production costs. Additional funds will also go towards all FM initiatives. 

For your kind support, FM is offering these wonderful benefits (more to be added):

Thank You 

$10 - We can't thank you enough for helping us out and saving lives. There are wonderful benefits below, but everything counts and smaller donations will add up to a huge difference. For your kind donation you will receive our humblest appreciation and gratitude on the FM website and Facebook page in the form of an official "Thank You" next to your name.

Friends of FM

$20 - An FM awarenesss bracelet or an FM “Legacy of Hope” bracelet – our unique awareness band commemorating our Legacy of Hope initiative in support of the Nelson Mandela Children’s Hospital, and a "Thank you" on the FM website and Facebook page.

VIP

$50 - All of the above, PLUS an FM guitar pick necklace, an FM magnet featuring the FM medical logo, AND an FM sticker featuring the FM Tour Bus logo.

All Access VIP

$100 - FM scrubs! Own your very own pair of our unique and stylish, black rock-n-roll FM medical scrubs, made specifically for our screening initiatives. Very comfortable and very cool. PLUS all of the above, an FM awareness bracelet or an FM “Legacy of Hope” bracelet, an FM guitar pick necklace, an FM magnet featuring the FM medical logo, AND an FM sticker featuring the FM Tour Bus logo. 

 

FM Honoree

$100 - "In Memory" Board. At our screening we will display the name of a loved one you lost to cancer on our Memoriam Sponsorship Board. A great way to honor a loved one and saying this screening was made possible thanks to you. You will also receive an original, signed certificate honoring your donation and sponsorship for your loved one. Included in your sponsorship is all of the FM special items listed above, and the name of your loved one will be featured on the screening event page on our FM website.

FM Rock Star Supporter

$200 - A copy of Guns N' Roses’ latest CD “Chinese Democracy” personally autographed by Axel Rose, and the band, along with a picture of the CD being signed. Plus an FM “Legacy of Hope” commemorative bracelet, and an FM sticker featuring the FM Tour Bus logo. (*** Limited 5)

FM Rock Star Supporter

$225 - An autographed copy of “The Road to Woodstock”, the best selling book by legendary music concert icon and creator of the Woodstock Music Festival, Michael Lang – signed personally by Michael Lang, co-producer of the Legacy of Hope Concerts in support of the Nelson Mandela Children's Hospital. Plus an FM “Legacy of Hope” commemorative bracelet, and an FM sticker featuring the FM Tour Bus logo. (*** Limited 5)

FM Rock Star Supporter

$400 - Own a unique and stylish OnePiece® jumpsuit, personally autographed by all of the Avett Brothers! The award winning, Grammy nominated Avett Brothers have been described as having the "heavy sadness of Townes Van Zandt, the light pop concision of Buddy Holly, the tuneful jangle of the Beatles, the raw energy of the Ramones." Watch them here. Included is an FM “Legacy of Hope” commemorative bracelet, and an FM sticker featuring the FM Tour Bus logo. (*** Limit 3)

 

FM Director - 3 Pack Supporter

$500 - An extra special 3-pack of items - own all three! 

(1) An autographed copy of the DVD "The Grateful Dead Movie", the definitive Grateful Dead documentary, complete with animation sequences and classic concert clips, signed personally by Academy Award winning director Leon Gast. (see trailer) 

(2) An autographed copy of the DVD "When We Were Kings", winner of the Academy Award for Best Documentary Feature, signed by the director himself, Leon Gast. This amazing documentary chronicles the famous "Rumble in the Jungle" heavyweight championship match between Muhammad Ali and George Foreman. (see trailer) 

(3) An autographed copy of the DVD "Smash His Camera", winner of the "Directing Award Documentary" at the 2010 Sundance Film Festival, signed personally by Academy Award winning director Leon Gast. Smash His Camera is about about the life and career of infamous paparazzi photographer Ron Galella. (see trailer)  

All of the above, plus an FM “Legacy of Hope” commemorative bracelet, and an FM sticker featuring the FM Tour Bus logo. (*** Limited 5)

FM Rock Star Musician Supporter

$1,200 - Two rock star items signed by Guns N' Roses! 

(1) a copy of Guns N' Roses’ latest CD “Chinese Democracy” personally autographed by Axel Rose, and the band, along with a picture of the CD being signed; and

(2) an authentic Gibson Guitar, personally autographed by Axel Rose, and Guns N' Roses, along with a picture of the guitar being signed.

Included FM “Legacy of Hope” commemorative bracelet, and an FM sticker featuring the FM Tour Bus logo. (*** Limit 1)

FM VIP Tour Supporter

$1,500 - Attend the Gathering of the Vibes Music Festival and get to hang with the FM team on FM’s legendary tour bus, along with noted producer and FM CEO Eric Gast, as he interviews bands appearing at G.O.T.V. 2013. Includes two (2) weekend-pass tickets to the G.O.T.V., in Bridgeport, Conn., with camping passes, July 25-28. (travel and camping gear not included). Includes lunch and beverages on our tour bus. Plus, pictures of you and some of the bands interviewed with Eric Gast. ***

PLUS, also includes our unique and stylish, black rock-n-roll FM medical scrubs, made specifically for our screening initiatives. Very comfortable and very cool.

Includes an FM guitar pick necklace, an FM magnet featuring the FM medical logo, and an FM sticker featuring the FM Tour Bus logo. (*** Limited 6)

FM Gold Supporter

$8,000 –- An autographed chainsaw signed by the legendary Joe Walsh (the Eagles) and music super mogul/manager Irving Azoff, in commemoration of their legendary rock star antics of wrecking hotel rooms while on tour. Displayed in lighted plexi-case. A rock-n-roll must have collector's item. (*** Limit 1)

Spread the Word!

If you are unable to contribute, please spread the word!

•   Post our Indiegogo campaign on your Facebook, Twitter or website.

•   Use the Indiegogo share tools! Easy peazy!

•   Volunteer at FM. Give us a call.

FM World Charities

FM World Charities is dedicated to promoting primary healthcare initiatives throughout the world. One of the goals of FM is to increase awareness of common, treatable illnesses among all populations. FM aims to increase awareness of issues pertaining to public health and wellness while also providing basic primary care to those without access to healthcare. 

FM is a dedicated group of physicians, media personalities and respected industry representatives, joined together to use their connections and resources to address the needs of a changing world. FM has garnered the respect of numerous celebrities, music icons, and industry leaders in all corners of the world.

Follow FM on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/fmworldcharities

 

If you can, please make a donation to FM. Your support is very much appreciated.

Please donate here: http://www.fmworldcharities.org/donate.html
story_txt:
Help us raise $15,000 towards FM World Charities initiatives.
FM World Charities, a registered 501(c)(3) not-for-profit organization devoted to promoting public health and improving the quality of life in underserved communities throughout the world, is seeking to raise the remaining $15,000 of a $50,000 initiative so it can provide its legendary free skin cancer screening and awareness at this year's Gathering of the Vibes Music Festival in July 2013. FM has already broken records worldwide for mobile skin cancer screenings in North America and Europe, successfully screening over 10,000 concert attendees, in which over 1,500 needed follow-up. Help us continue to save lives in this much needed healthcare concern.
At FM we believe that part of providing adequate healthcare is to help screen for common illnesses before they become life threatening. One concept that we developed is to provide skin cancer screening sessions and awareness during concerts and other public events. Since FM is a music-based charity, having roots in an established record label, it is uniquely able to reach the youth demographic, mainly 16-25 year olds, who attend music concerts and festivals. This group is important to reach because they are at increasingly greater risk of skin cancer. In 2008 FM went on the Vans Warped Tour, the nation's longest running concert festival touring series, and conducted the largest mobile screening ever in 46 cities throughout the U.S. and Canada, screening over 6,500 concert attendees, in which over 700 needed follow-up. FM handed out 10,000 UV protective products and skin cancer awareness literature.

Following up on that success, FM has since provided these screenings at the 2009 Surf Expo, conducted a cancer awareness initiative and seminar at the 2009 Boston Music Conference, performed screenings at the 2010 UC MusicFest (Clark, NJ), and screened over 2200 concert attendees in France on the FM/NRJ/FDJ Music Tour in the summer of 2010. FM also ran successful screenings at the legendary Gathering of the Vibes Music Festival in 2011 and 2012.  
World Skin Cancer
In the US in 2008 alone, 59,695 people were diagnosed with melanoma, and 8,623 people died from it. In some parts of the world, such as Australia, people are four times more likely to develop skin cancer than any other form of cancer. Approximately 2 out of 3 Australians will be diagnosed with skin cancer before the age of 70. Melanoma has also become the most common cancer in women between the ages of 25 and 29. However, if detected early, the survival rate for patients with skin cancer is about 99%.
FM’s screenings at music concerts and festivals are crucial in that they not only increase the number of individuals being screened for these conditions but, given the age of the people usually attending these events, they introduce the idea of preventative health care to a young audience. For example, the incidence of skin cancers is increasing rapidly throughout the world. A small lesion that develops when a person is 20 years of age will often be ignored for years before it becomes symptomatic and life threatening. Early diagnosis and treatment is the key to avoiding these problems.
According to Eric Gast, CEO of FM World Charities, “The Warped Tour not only gave us an increase in the number of individuals being screened for these conditions, but given the age demographic of this US country wide and Canada tour, it introduced the idea of preventative health care to a young audience. Our hope is to increase awareness and provide rudimentary screenings particularly to this young age group, who seldom are concerned with health issues. This program is somewhat revolutionary for a charity to be administering an initiative across a tour of this magnitude.” 
How We Do It
The portable screening stations that FM uses in its mobile screenings utilize SIAscopy technology. SIAscopy makes use of the way light interacts with skin – the way it scatters or bounces and the amount absorbed by cells and other structures. These small handheld machines are becoming popular to evaluate questionable lesions and will make it easier to screen larger numbers of people. Photographs of the lesions are taken and later re-evaluated. If there is anything suspicious about the lesion, the patient will be contacted by mail or phone and directed to the appropriate medical facility for confirming diagnosis and follow up treatment.

The Gathering of the Vibes
The Gathering of the Vibes (GOTV) is one of the world's longest running music festivals going. GOTV is an annual four-day music, camping and arts festival that showcases a very diverse variety of music. In both 2011 and 2012 FM brought cancer awareness and ran successful screenings reaching thousands of festival attendees.
Help FM this year make a real difference in our public's health and awareness. If you or a loved one have been affected by cancer, we urge you to help us prevent and bring awareness to one of the most preventable cancers around the world. Check out below what we need and what we can offer to you.

Other FM Initiatives:  
Legacy of Hope: the Nelson Mandela Children's Hospital Concerts
In 2012, FM World Charities embarked on its "Legacy of Hope" initiative: an international multimedia concert in partnership with the Nelson Mandela Children's Hospital Trust (NMCH), in cooperation with Operation of Hope. Through this partnership, FM World Charities will produce a multi-media concert featuring major artists performing on two continents simultaneously. The goal of this event is to raise awareness and funds towards the establishment of the Nelson Mandela Children's Hospital in Johannesburg, South Africa. Unique and revolutionary to this event will be the delivery of a documentary, broken down into short vignettes, interspersed between artists' performances. This documentary will celebrate the life and living legacy of Nelson Mandela . This year long "Legacy of Hope" initiative will be an educational push through music, culminating in this momentous simulcast concert.
Nelson Mandela said "A dedicated children's hospital will be a credible demonstration of the commitment of African leaders to place the rights of children at the forefront. Nothing less would be enough."
 
Our Goal:  
What We Need & What You Get
FM needs to reach its goal of $15k towards its free skin cancer screenings at the Gathering of the Vibes Music Festival in July 2013. Funds will go towards such expenses as the SIAscopy equipment, cameras and laptops, food and lodging, printing for educational materials, medical scrubs, branded materials and give-aways (e.g., sunscreen) and production costs. Additional funds will also go towards all FM initiatives. 
For your kind support, FM is offering these wonderful benefits (more to be added):
Thank You 
$10 - We can't thank you enough for helping us out and saving lives. There are wonderful benefits below, but everything counts and smaller donations will add up to a huge difference. For your kind donation you will receive our humblest appreciation and gratitude on the FM website and Facebook page in the form of an official "Thank You" next to your name.
Friends of FM 
$20 - An FM awarenesss bracelet or an FM “Legacy of Hope” bracelet – our unique awareness band commemorating our Legacy of Hope initiative in support of the Nelson Mandela Children’s Hospital, and a "Thank you" on the FM website and Facebook page.

VIP
$50 - All of the above, PLUS an FM guitar pick necklace, an FM magnet featuring the FM medical logo, AND an FM sticker featuring the FM Tour Bus logo.

All Access VIP
$100 - FM scrubs! Own your very own pair of our unique and stylish, black rock-n-roll FM medical scrubs, made specifically for our screening initiatives. Very comfortable and very cool. PLUS all of the above, an FM awareness bracelet or an FM “Legacy of Hope” bracelet, an FM guitar pick necklace, an FM magnet featuring the FM medical logo, AND an FM sticker featuring the FM Tour Bus logo. 

 
FM Honoree
$100 - "In Memory" Board. At our screening we will display the name of a loved one you lost to cancer on our Memoriam Sponsorship Board. A great way to honor a loved one and saying this screening was made possible thanks to you. You will also receive an original, signed certificate honoring your donation and sponsorship for your loved one. Included in your sponsorship is all of the FM special items listed above, and the name of your loved one will be featured on the screening event page on our FM website.

FM Rock Star Supporter
$200 - A copy of Guns N' Roses’ latest CD “Chinese Democracy” personally autographed by Axel Rose, and the band, along with a picture of the CD being signed. Plus an FM “Legacy of Hope” commemorative bracelet, and an FM sticker featuring the FM Tour Bus logo. (*** Limited 5)

FM Rock Star Supporter 
$225 - An autographed copy of “The Road to Woodstock”, the best selling book by legendary music concert icon and creator of the Woodstock Music Festival, Michael Lang – signed personally by Michael Lang, co-producer of the Legacy of Hope Concerts in support of the Nelson Mandela Children's Hospital. Plus an FM “Legacy of Hope” commemorative bracelet, and an FM sticker featuring the FM Tour Bus logo. (*** Limited 5)

FM Rock Star Supporter
$400 - Own a unique and stylish OnePiece® jumpsuit, personally autographed by all of the Avett Brothers! The award winning, Grammy nominated Avett Brothers have been described as having the "heavy sadness of Townes Van Zandt, the light pop concision of Buddy Holly, the tuneful jangle of the Beatles, the raw energy of the Ramones." Watch them here. Included is an FM “Legacy of Hope” commemorative bracelet, and an FM sticker featuring the FM Tour Bus logo. (*** Limit 3)


 
FM Director - 3 Pack Supporter 
$500 - An extra special 3-pack of items - own all three! 
(1) An autographed copy of the DVD "The Grateful Dead Movie", the definitive Grateful Dead documentary, complete with animation sequences and classic concert clips, signed personally by Academy Award winning director Leon Gast. (see trailer) 
(2) An autographed copy of the DVD "When We Were Kings", winner of the Academy Award for Best Documentary Feature, signed by the director himself, Leon Gast. This amazing documentary chronicles the famous "Rumble in the Jungle" heavyweight championship match between Muhammad Ali and George Foreman. (see trailer) 
(3) An autographed copy of the DVD "Smash His Camera", winner of the "Directing Award Documentary" at the 2010 Sundance Film Festival, signed personally by Academy Award winning director Leon Gast. Smash His Camera is about about the life and career of infamous paparazzi photographer Ron Galella. (see trailer)  
All of the above, plus an FM “Legacy of Hope” commemorative bracelet, and an FM sticker featuring the FM Tour Bus logo. (*** Limited 5)


FM Rock Star Musician Supporter
$1,200 - Two rock star items signed by Guns N' Roses! 
(1) a copy of Guns N' Roses’ latest CD “Chinese Democracy” personally autographed by Axel Rose, and the band, along with a picture of the CD being signed; and
(2) an authentic Gibson Guitar, personally autographed by Axel Rose, and Guns N' Roses, along with a picture of the guitar being signed.
Included FM “Legacy of Hope” commemorative bracelet, and an FM sticker featuring the FM Tour Bus logo. (*** Limit 1)


FM VIP Tour Supporter
$1,500 - Attend the Gathering of the Vibes Music Festival and get to hang with the FM team on FM’s legendary tour bus, along with noted producer and FM CEO Eric Gast, as he interviews bands appearing at G.O.T.V. 2013. Includes two (2) weekend-pass tickets to the G.O.T.V., in Bridgeport, Conn., with camping passes, July 25-28. (travel and camping gear not included). Includes lunch and beverages on our tour bus. Plus, pictures of you and some of the bands interviewed with Eric Gast. ***
PLUS, also includes our unique and stylish, black rock-n-roll FM medical scrubs, made specifically for our screening initiatives. Very comfortable and very cool.
Includes an FM guitar pick necklace, an FM magnet featuring the FM medical logo, and an FM sticker featuring the FM Tour Bus logo. (*** Limited 6)



FM Gold Supporter
$8,000 –- An autographed chainsaw signed by the legendary Joe Walsh (the Eagles) and music super mogul/manager Irving Azoff, in commemoration of their legendary rock star antics of wrecking hotel rooms while on tour. Displayed in lighted plexi-case. A rock-n-roll must have collector's item. (*** Limit 1)

story:
A Little Bit About Les Petits Nouveaux

  • We are a gypsy-jazz group based in Toronto – Andy Mac (guitar), Mikko Hilden (guitar) and Aline Homzy (violin)
  • We are trying to raise the funds to release our debut  album. The album needs to be completed promptly since our dear guitarist Mikko is moving back to Sweden come August. We are planning some more performances as an international trio (pending on getting the album finished).
  • With your contributions, it will allow us to pay for printing and designing costs of our album package. With the funding, it will allow YOU to take us home!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need a minimum of $500 to accomplish what we need to do to get our C.D. out to the public.
  • We have many unique perks to offer you as a thank-you! We have everything from digital album downloads to personalized concerts and recordings!
  • If we do not reach our minimum goal of $500 we will still be able to print few copies of the album. It will mean that we will continue to self-fund through our own gigs (for every gig we play, we take a portion of our earnings and put it towards our recording fund!) We are doing everything we can ourselves to fund but we need a little bit of help.

The Impact

  • With the C,D, released, we will be able to shop it to international music festivals and be able to have a product available to radio-stations, blogs, podcasts and merchandise.
  • Throughout the few years we have been playing together, people have requested our music! They ask us if we have a C.D. and we can now finally say that it is on its way!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We understand that sometimes, it is impossible to make a contribution. We appreciate your support none-the-less and would be pleased to see you spreading the word about this campaign!
  • You can share this video many different ways using Indiegogo’s easy share-tabs, Facebook and email!

We cannot thank you enough for your continued support.

Xoxo,

Les Petits Nouveaux

story:
From performing in Branson, MO as a child to his independent exploits in the band "Tune In Tomorrow", Dillon Spears has always had a life that involves music. Jamboree is simply the next step. The word "Jamboree" is synonymous with celebration. This project is meant to be a celebration of life, love, God, success and failure. The music is quirky and fun as Dillon brings in influences from his past and mixes them with more current ones, but the lyrics come from a very focused place. A place where we all live sometimes. The parts of life where you are certain beyond a shadow of a doubt of some things but terrified and unsure of others. A place where we celebrate the things we know but continue to hide from the things we are afraid to meet. This is Jamboree.

On May 14th, Jamboree will release their debut album entitled "So Much".  We've teamed up with Indiegogo to make this release available for pre-order!  There are many different packages available with many different perks.  From a simple digital download to a complete package including a vinyl pressing, a collectors cassette, a CD, and an exclusive T-Shirt.  There's something here for everyone.

All I've ever wanted to do was make music.  I'm very proud of what I've done with this project and I can't wait for you to hear it.  All funds will go towards releasing and marketing the album.

story:
Hey everyone, we are Athel. We are getting ready to release our 2nd full length album and need your support to make this happen.

 

What We Need & What You Get

In total for the album and tour it will cost us $10,000 to make happen but we obviously don't expect you to have to help us out with all of.

Some examples of cost are : Recording the album, getting a producer, mixing the album and mastering it. That alone will be about $8k. We also have all of the travel expencenses. Everytime we practice Shane has to fly from Toronto Canada to Chicago, IL. We all as a band need to travel to Southern California to make this record.

What you get is exclusive content that no one else will ever recieve. Instead of thinking of it as a donation it's more of a pre order so we can cover the cost of everything.

If you have any questions please email us at comronathel@gmail.com

story:
The NHC MUSIC team has been working hard this past year and a half, supporting and promoting unsigned and independent bands and musicians both online and off. It is now time to put our big NHC plan into operation, the NHC MUSIC HUB. 

The HUB will run primarily as a book/music cafe in the centre of Glasgow, with the emphasis on nurturing the wealth of talent on the unsigned and independent music scene, both local and national. Not only will the HUB have music from only unsigned and independent bands playing instore from morning til night, there will also be recorded and live shows, including an open mic stage and a couple of pick up and play acoustic guitars lying around for folk to play. We will also sell merchandise, music and tickets for musicians... and here is the clinker, we will do it absolutely free of charge. That's right, every penny we make from a band's own albums, singles, tickets and merchandise goes right back to them to help fund what they do best, making music.

We at NHC MUSIC believe a place like this can not only be an excellent meeting place for bands and musicians, but can also be hugely beneficial to the local music scene and beyond. We want to take music back from the big labels and money men and turn it into a bustling local scene to be proud of and one where bands and artists can make their own money while getting the promotion and help they need to bring their music to a wider audience. We want people to pop in for a coffee and a root through the books and music covering the walls and hopefully they will hear something new to love! You can help make this awesome place happen and with contributions starting at only 3 bucks you can help us out without breaking the bank. Every penny we can get really will make a difference.

 

What we need and what you get:

We need a minimum of £600 to get the shop kitted out once we move in. This will buy us a lot of the simple, yet necessary things that we need to open the doors to the public. Things such as paint, a small stage, a till, chairs and tables etc. We have a lot of things already purchased and donated including a book and vinyl stock of our own (over 3000 items so far and growing weekly) as well as cups, t-spoons, glasses, amps, and microphones for the stage, but there is still a long way to go. We have a great selection of perks for musicians and bands (and also us normal folk!) to get you involved and give you something back for your donation, so please take a look at the side bar and see what we are offering, from specially printed mugs of your band to be used instore (for that extra promotional mug) to free coffee for a year and even full promotional photoshoots!

If we get over the target then we will just add more things to the shop for musicians to use, such as small amps and breakables that they can borrow for gigs free of charge, or we will go wild and get a bigger premises with a bigger stage so that we can squeeze more music and bands in! There is always more that we can do and as we always have done at NHC MUSIC, we promise that every penny of profit we get from the HUB (including coffee and book sales of our own) goes right back into the local music scene. We truly do believe that what we are planting the seeds for just now, will revolutionise the independent music scene forever.

 

More about the campaign:

We believe that bands have it hard enough without having to pay out more and more money every day and we don't want to add to that ever building budget! Our plan was always simple from the start, help bands to help themselves by making things easier for them. Give them a place that sells their stuff (without paying for the privilege) and plays their music, gives away their badges and flyers and puts on 'fair for all' non pay to play gigs for them. A place where they can go and chill out with a coffee or tea with other local musicians and possibly do some networking, with an open mic and a stage that they can practice on at select times together with with guitars sitting around wanting to be played. There will also be gig listings, and listings for local, excellently priced recording studios, van hire businesses that won't rip you off, venues and promoters that play fair and everything else they may need help with in store for them to look through. The NHC MUSIC HUB is that very place. It's not just an idea, it's the start of a better way of doing things!

 

Other ways to help:

We know that a lot of folk are skint these days, that is one of the reasons that we are opening the HUB, but if you don't have any cash to give then please just share our idea and this campaign around to family and friends. People talking about what we are starting here in Glasgow helps us just as much as cash does, promotion is a necessity and there's no better publicity than people power and word of mouth, so if you know of a band or musician that this could benefit, from anywhere in the world, then please do tell them to visit the page here and on Facebook. Every little helps, even if that help is word of mouth!

A place where they can go and chill out with a coffee or tea with other local musicians and possibly do some networking, with an open mic and a stage that they can practice on at select times together with with guitars sitting around wanting to be played. There will also be gig listings, and listings for local, excellently priced recording studios, van hire businesses that won't rip you off, venues and promoters that play fair and everything else they may need help with in store for them to look through. The NHC MUSIC HUB is that very place. It's not just an idea, it's the start of a better way of doing things!
 
Other ways to help:
We know that a lot of folk are skint these days, that is one of the reasons that we are opening the HUB, but if you don't have any cash to give then please just share our idea and this campaign around to family and friends. People talking about what we are starting here in Glasgow helps us just as much as cash does, promotion is a necessity and there's no better publicity than people power and word of mouth, so if you know of a band or musician that this could benefit, from anywhere in the world, then please do tell them to visit the page here and on Facebook. Every little helps, even if that help is word of mouth!

story:
My name is Sandy Gemmill. I live in Milton, Ontario, and I am a stay-at-home mom of two boys.
 
About ten years ago, I saw a report by Peter Mansbridge, of CBC's The National, on the suicide of a bullied teen. That report changed my life forever.
 
I turned off the television, and with great sadness for the young teen, I sat at my piano and composed my first song on bullying, titled, "Far Across the Playground".
 
Shortly after, I took a recording of my song to a local school in my neighbourhood and asked if I could share my song with the students, in effort to teach them about the hurtful effects of bullying.
 
A few weeks later, the music teacher contacted me and requested my permission to use "Far Across the Playground" in a school concert. I attended the concert and was deeply moved by the performance. I immediately realized the impact my song had on the children and the audience. That special evening marked the beginning of my mission...to write music that helps make a positive difference for children.
 
I created a character by the name of Nelson the Giant in a unique story-song titled, "The Story of Nelson the Giant: A Heart as Big as his THUMP!" along with a companion Activity Book.
 
Nelson the Giant is the basis for a gentle approach to bullying awareness and prevention, through imagination, music, and art.
 
When children are introduced to Nelson the Giant, they only see a drawing of his legs. The dramatic story-song sparks imagination and inspires children to create their own complete image of the gentle giant. Individual experiences, physical attributes, and cultural backgrounds, guide children as they bridge a very special and personal connection to Nelson.
 
My goal is to reach the hearts and minds of children to help them understand the harmful effects of prejudging and bullying, while reminding them about the importance of acceptance, respect, and friendship.
 
Nelson the Giant has already proved to be a great success with children. Kids immediately feel empathy for Nelson as they listen to the story-song. Their immediate reaction is to befriend Nelson, so he never feels sad or lonely again. Children reflect on how Nelson's story affects them and are prone to be kinder to their peers.
 
I believe that my concept can be applied easily in other countries. Children can imagine what Nelson looks like based on their own cultures, and can relate to the gentle giant and learn his meaningful and important message.
 
I am hoping to raise $20,000 to help with my immediate costs associated with marketing, advertising, and printing of books and CDs. I am also eager to record a series of songs that are yet to be professionally produced.
 
Please consider making a contribution to help make a positive difference for the children in your community.
 
If you cannot contribute financially, please help spread the word about my bullying prevention initiative, by connecting with Nelson the Giant on Facebook and joining me in my effort to THUMP! Out Bullying.
 
A GIANT and sincere thanks for your support!
 
Sandy

story:
I'm looking for help with raising money for a new set of drums! With an intense year of gigging ahead of me with three different bands, my drums are greatly in need of replacement. Recent car troubles have hindered such fundraising to the point where I am back to halfway there. Big shows are in the schedule and approaching quickly, any help at all is appreciated! Be sure to check out the rewards!

I am a twenty five year old musician from the small town of Upton, Massachusetts, pursuing my passion of drums. A graduate of the music department at Westfield State University with a Bachelor's Degree in Jazz Studies. In the summer of 2010, I studied drums abroad in Ghana, Africa through This World Music in partnership with University of Massachusetts. Currently, I drum for three groups that are highly recognized all around New England and beyond. Barefoot Truth, a roots rock band from various places around the Northeast. Jamie Kent and the Options, a hip-funky folk group based out of Northampton, Massachusetts. The Raft, a six piece groove machine based out of Westfield, Massachusetts.

If you choose to donate to the cause I can assure that your money will not go waste. This new set of tubs will be playing all around the country just within the next few months. There are an assortment of unique perks for different levels of donations, including some offers that you can not get anywhere else!
 
If you are not able to contribute please help spread the word by sharing this campaign with your friends!

story:
Hello everyone,
I first want to thank you for checking out my post and taking an interest in me, my music and my ministry. I’m here asking for your help to continue to spread his word. I have a record release coming up and I have reached a few bumps in the road. I’m hoping by reaching out to fans of the gospel that we can come together to help me smooth out the road. I’m will appreciate what it is that you can give, every bit helps.
In God’s name thank you in advance!


JG


P.S. here is a little look at me:


From being born unwanted to being taken in and given a lasting identity. He has gone from dancing on the side of the devil to singing with angels. Justin Goss has transformed himself from a lost soul to a Jesus Geek.
After been given up for adoption in only took two days for God to find him a family. The first part of his life was spent trying the find his place in the world. These struggles lead him to an early life of turning to the streets. At the age of 12 he had deal with the heart breaking loose of his adoptive mother Myrtle Goss. This was the point in his that had turn away from God because he had felt God had turned away from him. After years of blindly wondering the empty streets he found himself back home at the alter giving his life to God.

story:
Short Summary

Hey Guys, I'm Rick and it has been a dream to record a Worship CD Live. I've been leading worship for about 15 years and have had the awesome priviledge to lead thousands into the presence of God. With this Live CD Worship recording, the message of Jesus will be shared with thousands more. We can not do this without your support. By donating, you will help make a life long dream become a reality.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The total budget for the project is $15,000. Sounds like a lot right? Well here is where the funds will be going: Venue/Location, Sound/lighting/media/tech crew, singers and musicians, recording rig, overdubs, mixing, mastering, and of course duplication.

For dontating, you will also receving some pretty cool perks. Depending on your contritubition amount, you could receive anything from advanced downloads of CD, Autographed CD, VIP seating, dinner with my team and I, and even a personalize concert.

Due to the short amount of time, we need to raise these funds ASAP. I knows its a lot, but I believe that God will ALWAYS finance HIS Will. If we do not reach our designated goal amount, any amounts that we have raised will be distributed amongst the project in the most cost effective ways.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that we are amongst some of the most financial hardships and some of you just can not afford to contribute financally.  Here are some other ways that you can contribute.

Pray that we reach out goal and that people will give generously towards this project

Pray that souls will be saved and lives will be forever changed

Pray for the entire team. Live Recordings can be very stressful.

SPREAD THE WORD. Tell all your friends, neighbors, co-workers, etc.

MEET US AT Fellowship Bible Church in Dallas TX on May 3 to Worship the King of Kings and the Lord of Lords.

story:
My name is Rahela Nayebzadah. I am an author and a loving sister. My youngest brother, Rasool, was in a motor vehicle accident at the age of five, leaving him brain-damaged and partially paralyzed. He cannot pursue an education or a career. He is now twenty-three years old. I am extremely grateful and blessed to have my brother in my life. As an individual with special needs, Rasool is subject to bullying. On March 22, 2011, I created a YouTube video called "Stop Bullying Now" in which I addressed and silenced Rasool's bullies. However, what started off as a bullying project took a different turn. I looked at life differently and promised to live every moment of it trying to make my brother happy. So, on Saturday, July 23, 2011, I created a Facebook group page called "Help a Disabled Fan Meet Justin Bieber." Rasool's biggest dream in his life is to meet Justin Bieber, and as his sister, I will do everything I possibly can to fulfill his dream. So far, there are 9,000 group members who are supporting Rasool's campaign. 

Rasool's group page has gained media attention, being published in City TV, The Daily Metro, Burnaby NewsLeader, and Asian Journal. 

Furthermore, my love for my brother has given me the strength to publish my first book, titled, Jeegareh Ma, an autobiographical novel based on my family's journey to Canada from Afghanistan and on Rasool's life story. The book is published by The Key Publishing House Inc. and can be purchased on Amazon.

As his sister, I have been doing everything in my power to help my brother. I have contacted Justin's management team. I have been writing to Ellen Degeneres and Scooter Braun everyday for the past year. I have created petitions, contacted disability organizations, and wish foundations. I even took Rasool to the Warner Brother's studio in the hopes of gaining Ellen Degeneres's attention, but sadly, that too failed. There are several YouTube videos regarding this cause (please search "Help a Disabled Fan Meet Justin Bieber" on YouTube).

Nonetheless, while I realize that getting Justin Bieber to meet my brother may be an impossible task, creating a community of support is not impossible. Therefore, I have created this campaign in the hopes of taking my brother on his dream vacation because he deserves it. Please share my campaign and help my video, Rasool, go viral.

And, as for getting my brother to meet Beiber, I will continue to fight and one day, Rasool will meet Justin. However, this will only be possible if we spread the message.

Please join and visit Rasool's group page on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/136485876437288/members/

Thank you

Much Love,

Rahela and Rasool.
