story:
Every day our government and political leaders are writing new laws and destructive regulations that strip away our constitutional rights. They're stripping away the very rights that they have swore an oath to uphold!

These leaders are made of two political parties:

1) Left-Winged Democratic Leaders   (the Reds)

2) Right-Winged Republican Leaders (the Blues)

Most people claim to one of these two parties, but do you know why it's always one of these two parties that wins the majority of the peoples attention in ALL of America's presidential elections?

Is it because we believe and buy into their false promises for "HOPE" and "CHANGE"?

Is it because our friends or our family have a history of being for or against 1 of the 2?

Or maybe it's because, for decades the Democratic and Republican leaders were the only two parties that were brainwashed and pushed into our society as the only two options who have the answers to fix America's catastrophies of terrorism, economics and "handcuffed" medical care.

Do the Democratic and Republican leaders have the answers?

Has their been any real change for the better in your life or America over the past four decades?

Not talking about personal changes and growth! Of course, your life has been changed, however...

The question you may want to ask yourself is...

Has the standard/cost of living increased or decreased since America's Recession?

Have the gas priceses gone down? What can you buy with $1 in today's economy?

What Does Real CHANGE Look and Feel Like in America?

Things are changing, but the Standard of Living in America is still greatly deminishing. 

Everything seems worse now in 2012 than it was before Mr. Obama took term in 2008!

Why isn't this "change" with all of the millions of laws, regulations, destructive litigration to so call protect and benefit us Americans actually helping ordinary citizens such as me and you?

What's really changed in America in the past four years?

Why is our Standard of Living going down instead of rising up?

NO SHIT NO MORE is not speaking out against President Obama, for he may have genuinely wanted things to "change", but what has really changed for the better in our American society?

It doesn't matter which side -- Democratic or Republican -- gets your vote because they both have been given the same exact job description, which is to NOT serve the people and instead they're instructed to carry hidden agendas of the leaders who pulled the strings to get them in office.

Pay attention and WAKE UP!

It's the same Political Party!

Just different color that's all

What would it look like if the majority of we the people voted for neither of these two political parties this year and instead we voted for a new party that's entirely different political party in this election?

Would the veil of American politics be drawn if we witness them still choose and select their own candidate regardless of what we the people choose just like they did in 2004 presidential elections?

NO SHIT NO MORE is about our voice -- the voice of we the people -- not being heard
and definitely not being represented by political leaders who are supposed to serve us!

This campaign is dedicated to We The People and awakening the general public to realize that our consistitutional rights are being purposely ignored, stripped away and violated by American politics!

YES, We Can Do It!

How Can We Do It?

We can get this message out before the presidential elections by getting sensational superstar MOHANNA BEY onto as many mainstream stages in front of the audience of the major celebrities. 

We Can Get Mohanna on Stage With ANY Popular Mainstream Artists 

We will continue to carry the message of "NO SHIT NO MORE" onto as many stages as possible, even after the presidential elections, so long as you -- the people -- support and fund it.

Thank you for having a voice and choosing to take NO SHIT NO MORE from any person or group.

story:
HELLO !

  • Hi there, I'm Kristian Sensini, a film composer from Italy, my full bio is at www.scorekomposer.com. I've recently composed the soundtrack for the Horror Movie "Hyde's Secret Nightmare" by Domiziano Cristopharo and I tought it could be a cool idea to share the production process with people using Indiegogo.

  • The campaign is for the release of the Soundtrack on Cd; when you work on a film project, the soundtrack you actually hear in the movie doesn't often see a realease on Cd. The campaign will cover the cd production process (music has been composed and recorded).

  • The film follows the tradition of Italian horror movies and directors like Dario Argento, Lucio Fulci,Mario Bava and also Federico Fellini.

  • The music inspiration comes from great composers such as Alex North, Ennio Morricone, Fabio Frizzi, The Goblin, Claudio Simonetti, Pino Donaggio, Bernard Hermann. The soundtrack (more than an hour of music) explores lots of different genres, from classical Orchestra and Chamber Music, to Minimal and Progressive Rock Music from the seventies. I've tried to stay away from the clichès of modern horror music, looking for a sort of vintage sound.

  • I've also composed the trailer music for the movie. Last year, this trailer received a nomination in the "Music for Promotion" category at the International Film Music Awards "Jerry Goldsmith". Here you can listen to the music from the trailer (this track is included in the Cd)

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qdqI9VUNL6w

 

  • The Movie “Hyde's Secret Nightmare” is a horror reactionary reinterpretation of Robert Louis Stevenson's book “The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde”. Domiziano Cristopharo, an independent director from Rome, was the first Italian director to try and recover the erotic/horror genre almost 4 years ago, gaining an enormous success of audience and critics and 6 international awards. He has always been compared to a perfect mix between Fellini and Dario Argento: his touch has a vintage taste, his style is extreme, shocking and classic at a time.

What We Need & What You Get

      • What We Need

The soundtrack has been recorded, so what I need is the founding to produce the cd and deliver it to the fans.

Here's the extimated cost:

  1. Cd Mastering done by a professional recording studio (350$)

  2. Cd Cover Graphics and Jewel Case done by a professional artist (200$)

  3. Shipment and Handling to you (about 300$ for 100 copies)

  4. Most important: Cd Print. I will use the service offered by CDBABY http://duplication.cdbaby.com/ (150 CD-Rs w/content & label print, Full Color On-disc Printing, Poly Wrap, Printed Digipak - UV Gloss Coating, UPC Bar Code) 661.80 $

  5. Taxes (yes, making a project like this requires taxes to pay)

      • What You Get

Basically the Soundtrack on cd but I've added some interesting options.

  1. CD SOUNDTRACK

  2. Mp3 SOUNDTRACK (Download Link)

Here are a couple of ideas for Indipendent Film Directors, Studios, Film Students, Low Budget Movie Projects: if you contribute to the campaign, you will have the following options:

  1. HAVE THE TRACKS ON THE CD LICENSED FOR YOUR PROJECT (several cues are good for Horror Movies (of course...), Thriller and even Drama Ones.

  2. HAVE A PROFESSIONAL COMPOSER (me...) to write the music for your next Short Movie or Feature Film.

So you've several options, depending on your budget.

I thought this is a cool idea to share creativity and to contribute to the Indipendent Movie Market. As you can see the prices are really fair if you think that the average price for a professional licensed track is about 200$, not talking about the price for a full Soundtrack Custom made for you.

 

THE CD : here's the tracklist

  1. Bad Dream
  2. Hyde's Secret Nightmare
  3. Bed of Horrors
  4. Body Language
  5. Vintage Tension
  6. Truth or Dare
  7. Transformation
  8. Sad-Uction 
  9. Death Lover
  10. Bad Memories
  11. Mother
  12. Elektro Dark
  13. Twinge of Love
  14. Love You Madly
  15. Beyond The Mirror
  16. Serial Kill Her
  17. Love Bites
  18. Original Sin
  19. Revelation
  20. End Titles

Bonus Content

Hyde's Secret Nightmare 2nd Trailer

+ two songs from the soundtracks of the Horror Movie P.O.E. : Poetry of Eerie

TOTAL LENGHT: 1:04:14

 

The Impact & PAQ (Probably Asked Questions)

  • "Why can’t you find a Publisher or a Label that could publish the CD?" That's a good question... I actually work with several labels which can print and publish my works. The point is that when you give your music to a publisher, you usually have to sign an agreement, and at this point the composer isn't really free to use HIS music in the way he wants. For example, if my Music is published for "XYXWZ record" and I want to license one of my songs to a film-maker, I can't freely choose to give him the track, and he should ask the publisher for a license (and it could be really expensive). If the fans who buy the cd and want to support the campaign help to cover the expenses, actually WE can be the publisher: this can give me the freedom to make a cd and then make the use I want of my music (even let film-makers use it for FREE... if I decide that way). Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart did something like this... when he stopped serving the court, he became one of the first "indie" musicians in history. In 1781 he decided to become a freelancer musician and to do a series of subscription concerts... the public paid him in advance, to write and organize the concerts. Now... I'm not Mozart but the idea is pretty much the same... fans, music lovers and horror movie nerds like me can preorder the cd and contribute in this way to the production of the soundtrack.

  • "What if you don't raise the money goal?" First of all I’ll cry... a lot. Then I will pay for the mastering myself, I’ll do the graphics myself, I’ll print the CDs myself.... did I already say myself?

  • "What happens if you receive more money than expected?" Basically I’ll print and send more cds, this if the perks of 12$ are the main source of the found raised. If the bigger perks will be hit, I will use the extra money to print my next cd "Darkness & Beauty", an acoustic soundtrack project for Piano. The ones that donate more than 100$ will receive a digital download of this new album as soon as it will be ready.

  • "Will you become rich thanks to this campaign and Indiegogo?" Mmm I’d like to, but I don’t think so. As you can see from the description of the project, all the money raised will be used just to print and ship the Cds.

  • "Why do you do it?" First of all because I love Music and my Work... secondly because I honestly think that I wrote a good soundtrack and I like the idea of people listening to it on cd and at same time participating in the very project.

Other Ways You Can Help

I've added an option for just 1$ donation, it's a fair price for downloading some music samples. If you don't want to spend any money you can still help this campaign... how?

  1. Share this campaign with your friends, horror movie fans and film music lovers. Use Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr and so on.

  2. If you're a graphic artist and feel like contributing to the campaign for the design of the Cd Art you are welcome!

  3. If you are a website or a magazine about Horror Movies, Sci-Fi, Film News, Soundtracks, you can help me spread the word and publish a review of the Soundtrack.

  4. If you are a film-maker you can help me making a short video, a trailer for the soundtrack, or a promotion video of this campaign!
story_txt:
HELLO !


Hi there, I'm Kristian Sensini, a film composer from Italy, my full bio is at www.scorekomposer.com. I've recently composed the soundtrack for the Horror Movie "Hyde's Secret Nightmare" by Domiziano Cristopharo and I tought it could be a cool idea to share the production process with people using Indiegogo.


The campaign is for the release of the Soundtrack on Cd; when you work on a film project, the soundtrack you actually hear in the movie doesn't often see a realease on Cd. The campaign will cover the cd production process (music has been composed and recorded). 


The film follows the tradition of Italian horror movies and directors like Dario Argento, Lucio Fulci,Mario Bava and also Federico Fellini.


The music inspiration comes from great composers such as Alex North, Ennio Morricone, Fabio Frizzi, The Goblin, Claudio Simonetti, Pino Donaggio, Bernard Hermann. The soundtrack (more than an hour of music) explores lots of different genres, from classical Orchestra and Chamber Music, to Minimal and Progressive Rock Music from the seventies. I've tried to stay away from the clichès of modern horror music, looking for a sort of vintage sound.


I've also composed the trailer music for the movie. Last year, this trailer received a nomination in the "Music for Promotion" category at the International Film Music Awards "Jerry Goldsmith". Here you can listen to the music from the trailer (this track is included in the Cd)

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qdqI9VUNL6w
 


The Movie “Hyde's Secret Nightmare” is a horror reactionary reinterpretation of Robert Louis Stevenson's book “The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde”. Domiziano Cristopharo, an independent director from Rome, was the first Italian director to try and recover the erotic/horror genre almost 4 years ago, gaining an enormous success of audience and critics and 6 international awards. He has always been compared to a perfect mix between Fellini and Dario Argento: his touch has a vintage taste, his style is extreme, shocking and classic at a time.

What We Need & What You Get


What We Need

The soundtrack has been recorded, so what I need is the founding to produce the cd and deliver it to the fans.
Here's the extimated cost:


Cd Mastering done by a professional recording studio (350$)


Cd Cover Graphics and Jewel Case done by a professional artist (200$)


Shipment and Handling to you (about 300$ for 100 copies)


Most important: Cd Print. I will use the service offered by CDBABY http://duplication.cdbaby.com/ (150 CD-Rs w/content & label print, Full Color On-disc Printing, Poly Wrap, Printed Digipak - UV Gloss Coating, UPC Bar Code) 661.80 $


Taxes (yes, making a project like this requires taxes to pay)



What You Get

Basically the Soundtrack on cd but I've added some interesting options.


CD SOUNDTRACK


Mp3 SOUNDTRACK (Download Link)

Here are a couple of ideas for Indipendent Film Directors, Studios, Film Students, Low Budget Movie Projects: if you contribute to the campaign, you will have the following options:


HAVE THE TRACKS ON THE CD LICENSED FOR YOUR PROJECT (several cues are good for Horror Movies (of course...), Thriller and even Drama Ones.


HAVE A PROFESSIONAL COMPOSER (me...) to write the music for your next Short Movie or Feature Film.

So you've several options, depending on your budget.
I thought this is a cool idea to share creativity and to contribute to the Indipendent Movie Market. As you can see the prices are really fair if you think that the average price for a professional licensed track is about 200$, not talking about the price for a full Soundtrack Custom made for you.
 
THE CD : here's the tracklist

Bad Dream
Hyde's Secret Nightmare
Bed of Horrors
Body Language
Vintage Tension
Truth or Dare
Transformation
Sad-Uction 
Death Lover
Bad Memories
Mother
Elektro Dark
Twinge of Love
Love You Madly
Beyond The Mirror
Serial Kill Her
Love Bites
Original Sin
Revelation
End Titles
Bonus Content
Hyde's Secret Nightmare 2nd Trailer
+ two songs from the soundtracks of the Horror Movie P.O.E. : Poetry of Eerie
TOTAL LENGHT: 1:04:14

story:
Our Story

Poaching of wildlife has increased throughout southern Africa dramatically over the last 4 years. Rhino poaching particularly is on the rise, with poachers using ever more sophisticated methods of hunting - including the use of the veterinary drug, M99. The year 2011 has had the highest level of rhino poaching with more than 400 killed  - that's one every 20 or so hours, with more incidents reported daily. 

The National Parks have anti-poaching units, and all are learning on a daily basis as the threat increases and their own lives are put in danger. Each park has its own challenges and requirements as the wildlife and topography change. 

There is a lot of importance placed on protecting wildlife from poachers, but very little filters down to the people on the ground actually fighting a war, often in very difficult conditions. 


The idea is to create a book of photography on Anti-Poaching Units around South Africa, and possibly other African countries if enough money is raised. Profits from the book will go towards equipment for rangers in an effort to make their lives that little bit easier, and give them the recognition they deserve. While rhino poaching is the biggest threat in the news at the moment, helping rangers will ultimately help all wildlife in these reserves. This book will not only cover rhino poaching but other forms as well. Anti Poaching Units play an essential role whether they're dealing with rhinos, abalone poaching on the coast, eliminating snares which often catch wild dogs and other animals, trafficking of animals such as parrots or those that hunt rare oribi antelope with dogs. 



Who we are

Vanessa Stephen is a photographer, writer and ecologist. She has spent years working in the bush and has seen first hand the destruction and devastation that poaching can cause, as well as the extreme determination and passion of the people involved in preventing this. She worked with wildlife documentary makers Earth-Touch for a number of years, providing scientific input, taking numerous stills in many different places and filming for them for documentaries sold to National Geographic and Smithsonian. 


Most of the photographs for this book will be done by Vanessa but other photographers have agreed to contribute work relating to this project. They include: 

 

David Goldblatt needs little introduction. One of South Africaâ€™s most famous documentary photographers, he is internationally acclaimed for his work. The following is a biography from the Goodman Gallery. "David Goldblatt has been photographing and documenting South African society for over 50 years. Born in Randfontein in 1930 to parents who came to South Africa to escape the persecution of Lithuanian Jews in 1890, he was simultaneously part of privileged white society and a victim of religious persecution and alienation. Motivated by his contradictory position in South African society, Goldblatt began photographing this society, and in 1963 decided to devote all of this time to photography.

Goldblatt focuses on critical explorations of South African society. While he uses photography as a means of accessing and exploring people and societies, David Goldblatt is acutely aware of the ethics of photography, and has used the camera as a way of capturing the complexities and intricacies of the specific conditions and situations that he photographs. His photographs are neither propaganda nor violently provocative, but rather become far more complex, meditative documents that are open to interpretation and that permeate far more deeply, and for longer than the initial shock and violence associated with documentary and news photography."

 

Dave Southwood is a photographer who has concerned himself with many aspects of the medium and how it is consumed.

His photos can be viewed at The South African National Gallery, The Finnish Museum of Photography, The Christoph Merian Stiftung, The Spier Art Collection and private collections in South Africa and abroad. His work made up part of three shows at The South African National Gallery in 2010, two of which were broad surveys of South African art.

In 2003 he was awarded first prize by the Bauhaus for an interdisciplinary project which he co-authored. Three short films he made about some architecture were shown at the Venice Biennale of Architecture in 2010. These two projects are representative of a deep concern for architecture and cities which culminated in a project called citiesincrisis which he co-curated.

He has contributed to, and been featured in, publications like Adbusters, COLORS and Wallpaper, and has edited photo editions of magazines. He has taught at Universities and written for the art press.

Together with some black photographers he set up the first non-profit organisation for â€˜street photographersâ€™ in the Western Cape called Umlilo in 2000. He still works with these freelancers.


What We Need & What You Get

I've put a goal of $12 000 which is perhaps optimistic, but as much as is raised will be put to good use. I've tried to split the donations so that around 50% will go towards equipment for the field and the rest can be put toward travel and petrol to get to the parks, car hire where necessary, process the images and create the book. If I don't meet the target here I will pursue funding from other avenues. But I would like as much funding as possible to come from the public. It helps to create awareness and gives everyone a chance to do something that makes a definite benefit to Anti-Poaching units and to the wildlife they are working to protect. So please claim your perks. They're there to help you do something important.  Having done my first trip to get some material to put together this proposal, I know that the people in the field get a real boost from having a bit of awareness placed on them. 

** Please note that all the prints offered in the perks will be from Vanessa Stephen's photography.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you like this campaign please share it widely with your friends and family and colleagues. The more money we raise, the more we can do and and the more units we can help. Go forth and make a difference!

Share this on Facebook, Twitter, Linkedin and any other means possible. It's amazing in this day and age just how much one individual can do.

story: Hailing from Hagerstown, Maryland From Far Away was formed in July of 2012 by 5 guys with one common goal of getting their music heard. They quickly hit the scene with their debut single "Decisions" and then started working hard on writing an album. After being a band for less then 6 months they have finished writing and are set to record their debut ep "Recover|Repeat" in early January 2013. From Far Away is a band with a unique sound that combines melodic guitar riffs with harsh screams and pop inspired choruses. They will be taking the music scene by storm in 2013 so keep a look out for this up incoming band.

story:
6/4/12 UPDATE: We did it!  Thanks to everyone who contributed.  I can't wait for you guys to hear it.  That said, if you still want to give, you still can!  I can still use extra money for things like better mastering, hiring more musicians, and marketing/promotion.
 
Also, you should still donate if you want to garauntee that you'll get a copy of the FULL cd.  There will ONLY BE 50 MADE, and after those are gone, I'm only going to have cd's in sleeves and downloads.

NOW WHAT?

People have been asking me if they can contribute, so I wanted to address that here: YES!!!!!  Also, here is the breakdown of what I can/will use the money for so you can see exactly where your support will be going:
  • Paying a professional drummer: $200-$400 (either 1 or 2 songs)
  • Mastering: $150-300 (depending on who I choose for this)
  • CD Ducplication: $250-??? (depending on how many CD's I need)
  • Marketing/Promotion: $100-??? (depending on...)
The last item I will only use if I have money left over after everything else (which would probably mean if I got over $1,000).  Otherwise, I will probably have to spend a bit of my own for that if I decide to do it.
 
Now that I've reached the minimum, don't feel like you have to contribute (unless you want to make sure you get a CD).  But if you still want to it is greatly appreciated!!
 
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
There's nothing quite like buying a new album from your favorite artist, right?
 
As much as you enjoy the anticipation, and finally, the first listen of their new music, typically you are left in the dark about the entire process until you have the finished product in your hands.  Not anymore!
 
Nowadays, artists like myself are letting friends and fans go behind the scenes and not just watch the process, but even be a part of it!  So if you've ever wondered what goes on and why it takes so long, here's your chance to find out.

Why now?

After 10 years of working on getting this done, I'm finally realizing I need help!  I would love to hire a drummer to record some professional drum tracks for me and have someone else do the post production (aka "mastering") to make it sound AWESOME.
 
Most importantly, I want your help not just in financial support but in helping me make some decisions!  This can and will include:
  • song choice/order
  • CD cover art
  • and even the tile of the CD itself!
I would love for you to be involved and that's why I asking for your help.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

Craig Allen

story:
Short Summary

Kevin Venable was one of several victims in a terrible tragedy.  You can read more about it here: http://www.indiegogo.com/Hollywood-Shooting-Victims-Fund?a=498044

To quote Jenny Dann, "Kevin is like family to me.  He's been through a rough, rough time and has lost pretty much everything. :'( We are SO THANKFUL he made it though this whole tragedy, but again - he lost EVERYTHING - including all of his music and music equipment. If you know Kevin, you'll know he pours his heart and soul into his music, his passion. Imagine having that taken away from you. Please help Kevin get his music back!! Read more about it at this link below and please donate if you can to help him rebuild his lost music and music gear - and please share this link with others! Spread the word!!" for Kevin Venable -- help us help him!

  • I am Catalyst Echo.  I believe life is about more than merely surviving a fire.
  • This campaign is important because it will help Kevin get his musical equipment back.  He needs a guitar, some DJ gear and songs.
  • Kevin is faced with a huge problem.  He is homeless, he owns nothing and everything he did own, everything that meant anything to him, was burned in the fire that destroyed his house and hurt several of his friends.  By donating to this fund, you will help Kevin purchase a new guitar and any other musical equipment he needs to live a life filled with his passion, not merely one of survival.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help.  You can spread the word!  Post this link on all your social networking sites and help us get Kevin some musical equipment so he can continue to follow his dreams.

You can use the share tools on this site!
 

Thank you!

story:
Our Mission

Mind The Art Entertainment is proud to develop an original, exciting and new Japanese Opera in New York City. As a majority of Opera houses close their doors to new work, we embrace growth and innovative voices and continue to fight against the norm that is the rapidly dissapearing Opera world. We believe strongly that an art form must continually grow and evolve and for that, new work must be supported, encouraged and developed. It is with great interest and commitment then that we ask you to help us develop this wonderful work with us.


The Opera

Kiyo, an opera in three Acts based on the Japanese legend of Kiyo-hime, was written by Jan and Kayo Albert with the utmost respect for Japanese historical and cultural heritage.

Kiyo presents a story of purity and passion taken to the extreme while realizing the impermanence of all things.

The story of Kiyo begins with a young girl named Kiyo whose painful past follows her to Mrs. Haru's tea house. There she works and meets the young priest Zenshin who lives at Abbott Kukai's temple and is his promising student. In the spring, Kiyo and Zenshin fall hopelessly in love with each other, and Mrs. Haru, for her own reasons, cannot approve.

As time passes through summer and autumn Zenshin begins to question his true calling. He is assured that Buddha’s teaching is what he must follow and his passion for Kiyo grows cold. Kiyo, after losing her entire family and whose future life with Zenshin means everything, cannot accept that and swears revenge. She attains supernatural powers from Kompira, a legendary serpent, by surrendering her own soul. At the opera's climactic scene, taking place during the winter, Kiyo turns herself into a serpent. She chases Zenshin who hides inside the temple bell.  In a moment of passion she climbs the bell and melts it, killing herself and Zenshin.  

Both Japanese and western audiences will appreciate Kiyo’s universal themes. Kiyo includes wonderful Japanese traditional and cultural themes such as the stories of Jizo and Kaguya, O’Bon and Tea Making Ceremony, Stone Garden and Ikebana, Susuki Ballet and Buddhist Chants.  Opera Kiyo first and foremost inspires to reveal a true human story in a thoughtful and entertaining way.

Kiyo’s melodic musical score closely describes its character’s emotions and dramatic situations.        

  

The Funding

100% of your contributions will be used to support the workshops to develop and expose this new work to the world. Your contributions help us pay for rehearsal spaces and to print marketing materials. No part of this money is going into the pockets of a producer. No we believe that artists need the right space to create, the proper materials to explore and the appropiate exposure to succed. This is where your money goes. To develop a piece of work properly so it can flourish and stand the test of time.

 

Questions? Concerns?

You can read more about us and our projects at www.mindtheartentertainment.com or you can email our Executive Producer at President@mindtheartentertainment.com We have an open door policy and believe in transparency so ask us and we shall answer :-)
story_txt:
Our Mission
Mind The Art Entertainment is proud to develop an original, exciting and new Japanese Opera in New York City. As a majority of Opera houses close their doors to new work, we embrace growth and innovative voices and continue to fight against the norm that is the rapidly dissapearing Opera world. We believe strongly that an art form must continually grow and evolve and for that, new work must be supported, encouraged and developed. It is with great interest and commitment then that we ask you to help us develop this wonderful work with us.

story:
WHO ARE SAFER WITH THE WOLVES 

We are a 5 piece band from the future on a mission to make an album that will save the world. 
Here is what we made in the past.
Cat - Koro Vacui / Snout Cassette / Ghost Cat
Arkhea - Screaming Bikini / Bonney Read
Jak - TheArt / Snout Cassette
Pat - Torch Le Monde
Penny - Ghost Cat / Bubble Vicious

we are here to save you...

WHY SHOULD YOU CONTRIBUTE 

The primitive tools at our disposal have brought us this far.

www.saferwiththewolves.bandcamp.com

Listen to these rough sketches..if you like what you hear please contribute to help us record a studio album.

 

We need to raise at least $5000 to cover studio costs and the purchasing of necessary equipment.

There are a number of perks available for contributors ranging from copies of the album to a private acoustic show..

"In a world full of cliched quotes, we wanted to write our own" - safer with the wolves 2015

Remember to share this with everyone you know...

story:
Our Story

Ariel and Tom have no greater love and joy in life other than performing, studying, and composing jazz music.

They are a voice and guitar duo, as well as a couple (loving girlfriend and boyfriend) who were brought together by a common and overwhelming passion for jazz music. Audiences have commented that they are unusually talented and many have noticed their commitment to creating opportunities to share jazz music with all-age audiences in their small hometowns and nearby towns of Westminster, Upperco, and Detour, Maryland.

Since Ariel and Tom met and began playing together over three years ago, they have been performing monthly as well as weekly at local coffeshops, farmer's markets, and art galleries in their local, small town communities. In short, they have helped create live opportunities to hear and learn about the great American artform of jazz music, where there was no chance to hear it locally before. As both are professional musicians, all of their income stems from their music. While money has never been and never will be the reason they devote their lives to music, financial support is necessary to help them meet all the nearly-crippling expenses associated with getting to the gig and back as well as making ends meet as highly active and devoted creative musicians.

 

A note from Ariel and Tom:

Thanks for reading about us above. Now here is how you can help us keep our music in the ears of communities. These small, sleepy working-town environments need creative stimulation and opportunities to see live music, but  ... Nearly All of our most beloved gigs do not pay anything in terms of money and so we have been having great difficulty in covering expenses for doing these performances. But we truly cherish the chance to touch peoples' lives with our music. Our expenses are mainly things like travel (gas and vehicle) and parking fees but we are also under pressure to repay college loans and help meet basic needs such as food for our stomach, decent clothing, and proper equipment for our performances. For example, Ariel has been borrowing a undendable P.A. system for our performances and Tom's guitar amp has stopped working properly. Simply put, we are facing large expenses that are necessary to help keep us performing for our beloved audiences at places like Birdie's Cafe in Westminster, MD. Since we have almost no income from our concerts, we are not sure where we will find the money to fund our creative passions and help us keep the musical giving coming.

 

The Impact

The great thing about our campaign is that we are already out there giving it our best effort and our cause is already being felt by jazz lovers in our area. Our audiences cannot get enough of our music and we do not want to disappoint them by not being able to: pay for gas to get to the gig, park, have a decent amp and sound equipment, and get back home safely that evening. We don't ever want to stop sharing music because it becomes too financially burdensome to do so. Our job is to make music-it doesn't bother us that we don't get paid for it..but we just want to keep doing our job. You never know who is listening and may fall in love with music, too.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 The dream right now is just being able to cover the expenses we have incurred by making the music we do. Every Little bit Counts right now. We just want to keep on the highly creative and productive path we have been pursuing un-funded for over the past three great years. We don't want to lose momentum now!

 

One day we would love to begin work on a CD or recording but perhaps that will the be the topic of another campaign some day. If we do exceed our goals for expenses, however, we will defintely put the extra funds towards our first recording as well as continuing our musical education of jazz in graduate school-which we both fully intend to accomplish someday!

Also, have a look at our perks! We hope you enjoy the chance to be "in the club" of a great jazz master.

As we begin to cover expenses, we will certainly be able offer more material perks in a future campaign, perhaps we will be able to afford a website and offer you our CD recording.

Other Ways You Can Help

If what we are about excites you and inspires you to action, we will be forever grateful. If you'd prefer not to offer any monetary funding remember that you can help immensely by letting others know about us using the share tools here. Put us on your facebook page or text a friend who may be interested, too.

Remember that by helping us, you are also keeping creative music in small-town communities that truly need the enrichment and enjoyment of Live artistic music. Live music performance is becoming a less common occurence but Ariel and Tom are committed to changing that.

story:
What

Jazz trio Paradigm Shift is recording a new album entitled Sounds Like Us. As we explain in the video, Paradigm Shift's mission is to make music that continues to expand the role of the organ, come up with fresh approaches to baselines and rhythms, and (last but certainly not least!) write memorable tunes. The album will feature compositions from all three of our members and feature appearances by very special guests and longtime friends of the band Wycliffe Gordon and Marcus Printup. We strive to make music that is both accessible to the average listener and compelling to the trained ear. We can't wait for you to hear our latest work and get this show on the road.

Why

The goal of this project is to raise $8,000 which will help us offset the cost of high-end recording, mixing, manufacture as well as promotion to achieve the utmost quality in every department. 


Your contribution will go towards ensuring that Paradigm Shift -- a seasoned, highly ambitious, forward-thinking jazz trio -- will be able to make the highest quality album that it possibly can. You contribution will of course help the bank, but on a broader scale will also have an impact on jazz music as a whole because that is what this Paradigm Shift strives to do. Each member of the group has dug deep to come up with compositions that not only work for this album but stand the test of times as TUNES. Melvin Henderson, Gerry Youngman and Sean Jefferson all see the songs they brought in for this album as an attempt to reach the essence of jazz, songs that work not only in a trio format but in any configuration of instruments. As a band, Henderson, Youngman and Jefferson were all very deliberate about sifting through the tunes and working them into shape in rehearsal and asking themselves "do we have a body of music that honors jazz history while also reaching beyond genre to speak universal truths?"


Other Ways You Can Help


Help us to get the word out. Share this with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, etc. Forward it to your family and colleagues, everyone you know, like (or don't like). Thank you & Dankeschoen.

story:
ABOUT ME AND "HEY TIDE":

I’m writing to ask for your help in pursuing a wonderful musical opportunity.

I am a self-taught singer/songwriter, who has been writing, performing, and recording piano-driven, funky, art-pop music for almost 15 years. I have completely self produced, arranged and financed every CD. I am now about to make my 4th and by far most moving CD, called “Hey Tide”, after going through a personal tragedy. I explore every side of grief: the searing pain, the anger, the acceptance, the fragile newness of hope. As I wrote the album, I began to see that a common thread held the songs together—the image of moon and tide, who were often my guide.

Now, personal tragedy on its own does not make an artist better or a work of art more compelling. But the level of heartbreak, grief, and despair that I went through after losing the love of my life, brought me to a new place as an artist that I had never gone before. For the first time, I had to dig as deeply as possible into my heart and spirit, and write songs that were as vulnerable, direct and translucent as my life called for. The songs had a necessary and healing power that I had never found before with such power or consistency.

More than anything, although this album is about heartbreak, despair, and then recovery and the emergence of hope: it is about the power of music, and the power of art to have transformational power. Art has had this healing power since the beginning of time. Only after writing “Hey Tide” did I understand that power with such completeness, and that the gift I had to bring to others was universal. I had to dig more deeply than ever before as an artist, and dearly want to share this gift of song with you, just as the songs were a gift to me.

"Jennifer’s songs on Hey Tide are ripe, wise, profoundly human and achingly beautiful.  Rough demos of her songs attracted the attention of Mitchell Froom, a world class record producer best known for his work with Suzanne Vega, who urged her to come to Los Angeles to complete the album with him.  Jennifer chose instead to work here in New England, and has attracted to this project world-class musicians who have played with, among others, Tori Amos, Paul McCartney and Elton John.  They are working with Jennifer far below scale because they recognize the power of her material, and her grace as an artist. 

Jennifer, as most artists, lives hand to mouth.  She gives much and yet has had to make do with very limited resources.  Completing Hey Tide is the most important artistic undertaking of her life. Help from her Indiegogo campaign would forward her work in profoundly important ways, by providing much needed financial support, and the sort of affirmation that puts wind behind an artist’s sails."
- Marc Zegans, Artist Consultant

WHAT I NEED AND WHAT YOU GET:

To complete the album I need to do the following:

3 days in the studio at Dimension Sound to record 4 solo songs, harmonies, guitar and violin.
Cost per day: $1,100
equals $3,300.

4 days of mixing the album: $4,400
1 day of mastering the album: $600
equals $5,000.

Photos/graphic design: $500
reproduction of the CD’s: $2,000
Total equals $8,500.


I AM ASKING FOR $2,000, WHICH WILL COMPLETE
ALL OF THE RECORDING COSTS!

Please check out my perks! I give them with love! You will not be disappointed!

MORE ABOUT WHY IT MATTERS:

"Artists who have taken the time to know themselves, and who have developed the discipline to master the grammar and vocabulary of their craft, as Jennifer has, come to a moment when they must author a brave work, one that goes to the core of their being, one that brings forth with unflinching honesty what they find there.  It is the moment when an artist truly becomes self-authoring, and, therefore, in the best sense, emerges.  Hey Tide is that album for Jennifer.  Every song, every verse of each song in the cycle of this album matters: Nothing in it is trivial, and nothing is wasted.  It is story of loss, grief, illumination and healing, rounded in ways that speak quietly and irrevocably to us all."

- Marc Zegans, Artist Consultant


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP THAT DON'T INVOLVE MONEY:

If you are unable to contribute financially, there are other ways to help out! All you have to do is spread the word about what I'm doing, how I'm trying to make "Hey Tide"and tell people who you think might be interested in my music. Just use the Indiegogo "share" tools -- they make it real easy for you! :-)

THANK YOU! I AM SO EXCITED AND GRATEFUL FOR YOUR SUPPORT. Your help makes my heart swell.

story:
Short Summary

Advertisers are always looking for that right song for their product or service, because songs create emotion and it is emotion that sells the products and services:

  • I run a network of talent and clients working together to find and create the right song for the right media placement.
  • I wrote a song that I believe will be a good fit for a number of advertising placements.
  • For the song it to be a success it needs the right sound and feel by hiring the right talent. I am looking for investors that will assist in the money needed to hire the right talent. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need $2000 to hire a producer to produce the song. 
  • If you would like to donate $20 dollars or more as a music supporter, you will get a copy of the song and a video with your name in the credits to show your support!
  • If you would like to donate $100 or more you will receive credits in the video, a copy of the song and video and your own coffee mug with theJINGLEcompany.com logo that say's "It's OK, I'm with the band."
  • For every investment of $200 you will Receive 1% of the net profit of the life of the song up to 10% net profit for the total $2,000 investment. You will also have you or your company's name in the marketing video credits as a supporter of the project and a copy of the finished song and video for your own keeping. You will also receive your own coffee mug with theJINGLEcompany.com logo saying : It's OK...I'm with the band. 

The Impact

 theJINGLEcompany.com  has a purpose of being a working musicians income resource and helping to support poorly funded music programs while making a living doing what I love. 

  • This is one of the projects to assist a small operation become a bigger operation.
  • We have successfully worked with small, local, businesses in multiple states.
  • We are raising the bar to be an asset to national clients as well.

Risks & Challenges

The music placement industry is a very competitive industry with every one from major artists to unsigned artist (like myself) working to have the right song clients will be looking for, so there are no guarantees for results, but with past experience and the right talent. it puts the odds into a much more favorable means along with:

  • Learning from successful individuals that have had previous success.
  •  Researching what has worked in the past and what is currently popular.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you know of a business that can use a custom musical Jingle to brand their businesses advertising.
  • If you know of a musician, singer or producer that can add value to the quality of production.

Thanks for being a support!

I wrote a song that I believe will be a good fit for a number of advertising placements.
For the song it to be a success it needs the right sound and feel by hiring the right talent. I am looking for investors that will assist in the money needed to hire the right talent. 


What We Need & What You Get

I need $2000 to hire a producer to produce the song. 
If you would like to donate $20 dollars or more as a music supporter, you will get a copy of the song and a video with your name in the credits to show your support!
If you would like to donate $100 or more you will receive credits in the video, a copy of the song and video and your own coffee mug with theJINGLEcompany.com logo that say's "It's OK, I'm with the band."
For every investment of $200 you will Receive 1% of the net profit of the life of the song up to 10% net profit for the total $2,000 investment. You will also have you or your company's name in the marketing video credits as a supporter of the project and a copy of the finished song and video for your own keeping. You will also receive your own coffee mug with theJINGLEcompany.com logo saying : It's OK...I'm with the band. 


The Impact
 theJINGLEcompany.com  has a purpose of being a working musicians income resource and helping to support poorly funded music programs while making a living doing what I love. 

This is one of the projects to assist a small operation become a bigger operation.
We have successfully worked with small, local, businesses in multiple states.
We are raising the bar to be an asset to national clients as well.


Risks & Challenges
The music placement industry is a very competitive industry with every one from major artists to unsigned artist (like myself) working to have the right song clients will be looking for, so there are no guarantees for results, but with past experience and the right talent. it puts the odds into a much more favorable means along with:

Learning from successful individuals that have had previous success.
 Researching what has worked in the past and what is currently popular.


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

If you know of a business that can use a custom musical Jingle to brand their businesses advertising.
If you know of a musician, singer or producer that can add value to the quality of production.

Thanks for being a support!

story:
About Thankless Art:

I'm Ashlee Paradis!  I have studied music for as long as I can remember starting with piano lessons at the age of 4, and I have been a performing musician for 10 years now.  Although I spend a lot of my time performing renditions of other artist's songs,  I have also written a lot of my own material that has been kept hush hush for some time now.  I am ready to expose my own music and create an album that truly represents me.  And, I have met some incredible musicians on my journey that I will be working with to bring this album to life.

This campaign is important to me because I want my friends and fans to feel that they can be involved with this process.  I want to make this an interactive process, where you are receiving a step by step update on the album and helping create (from creating the album cover art, to coming in and being in group vocals in the recording studio).

Where is the money going?

This album is a relatively low cost project, as this is the first time that I will be going into a recording studio.  The money will be going directly toward:

  • Studio time
  • Session musicians
  • Mixing and mastering
  • Duplication
  • Distribution
  • Promotion

What do you get?

There are a number of ways that I would like to thank you based on your donation!  You can gain access to an early release of the album, or you can get your very own house concert!
 

What if I can't contribute money?

TELL EVERYONE.  Share this project, follow me on Facebook "Ashlee Paradis - 1 Girl, 1 Guitar", Instagram, InstaSnap, MyFace... something like that.

story:
Alan has been playing to audiences large and small, in countries as diverse as England, Germany (Oktoberfest is amazing!), France, Sweden, Portugal, Greenland (yes, really, Greenland  - ask him about it if you ever meet!) and half a dozen more that time and space don't allow me to list, for longer than he can remember. 

In 2015 Alan was awarded a grant to support his music from the Svenska Kulturfonden (The Swedish Cultural Foundation in Finland) which was the catalyst that started him on the road to this project. Five songs - which you can listen to and  download for free HERE - recorded in the UK and mixed and mastered in Finland was the result - and as Alan says, "it was fascinating to watch them develop, from the first acoustic versions recorded on my smartphone, through the adding of drums, bass, and guitar until finally - rock 'n' roll!"

That thrilling experience set him off on a frenzy of song writing which resulted in another 12 tracks that are just crying out to be recorded - hence The Alan Parry Project.

The cost of recording an album is split about 60/40 between recording (studio hire, session musicians fees & travel) and production (editing, mixing, mastering). The grant covered 30% of the costs of producing the original five songs, costs being $6,000 - but there are twelve more waiting to join them.

The plan is to have an album launch party next August in Finland  but it is going to take a lot of hard work (and money) between now and then to get this done. 

The estimated cost of producing this album is $15,000 - and this is where you come in: 
if you are kind enough to donate to this project, as well as earning the perks listed, and Alan's eternal gratitude, every last pfennig of your financial support will go towards the following:

  • session musicians, studio hire & travel
  • recording, mixing, and mastering 12 completely original songs
  • publicity & promotional material for the album & its release
  • manufacturing, printing & delivery of the CD

Heartfelt thanks ahead of time for your support, and a big shout out to those who have already helped get this project off the ground - especially Dan Cox, Producer; Jon Cox, rhythm section; Svante at Chartmakers.fi - mix and mastering; and of course to the many family members and friends who are helping Alan realise his dream - THANK YOU!

Flexible funding simply means that if the target is not met the funds will still be put to use reaching Alan's goal - this album will be made!!

And if you can't support us financially, please  spread the good word and help us reach as many people as possible - with your help we will  get this done!


















  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
IMPORTANT UPDATE:

The campaign is over but The 8-bit Time Paradox is still available at www.t8btp.com with exclusive tracks and new exclusive merchandise. Also find it in your favorite digital media store!

 

We are so proud to have been picked up by record label Enjoy The Ride for a vinyl release of our album in April 2018. And do you know what is the best part? We are including pre-orders in the perks section and an exclusive crowd-funding color (that you can see above) only available during the campaign! Coming soon...

Check out the awesome color options here (the animation will play automatically once loaded):

 

Be part of this amazing edition, select a perk containing the "your name in vinyl insert" item or the "your name on vinyl cover" item and let everyone know you supported our album! Here is a render of how they will look (the animation will play automatically once loaded):

Our vinyls are also available at wholesale prices in boxes of 30, 35, 40, 45 or 50. Write us a line and we'll get in contact in no time.

How cool would it be if we created a limited cassette tape edition of the album? Well... we did! Check it out here in all its glory (available in 2 color variants):

 

The 8-bit Time Paradox features music from 8 beloved games of different eras. Each one of the artists has a very unique style and instrumentation. Here is the complete tracklist and artist line-up:

  1. Metroid - Title Theme - SamiaAntha
  2. The Legend of Zelda: Breath of The Wild - Main Theme - Salome Scheiddeger
  3. Final Fantasy VII - Anxiety - Harry Murrell
  4. The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time - Gerudo Valley - Greg Pattillo & Eric Stephenson
  5. Mega Man - Medley - Meine Meinung
  6. Titanfall 2 - Medley - Live Voices
  7. Shovel Knight - Medley - CarboHydroM
  8. Battlefield 1 - Battlefield One - Giovanni Rotondo
  9. The Battle of Mon Chi Bill - All the above artists together

You can hear excerpts from the various tracks and see a glimpse of the artists in this video:

 
All the available perks include a digital download of one of the album's tracks right away. Which track? The following video by SamiaAntha will answer this question:
 
 
 
Our beautiful cover was designed by talented artist Jeff Langevin. It is truly awesome, isn't it? His use of negative space is haunting and beautiful and allows the album to tell a story even with its cover alone. Here is how some of the mock-ups led to the final version (the animation will play automatically once loaded):
 
Check the perk section to see a render of Jeff's beautiful artwork printed in poster format! 
 
 
 
In 2014 The 8-bit Time Machine was released after a successful crowdfunding campaign. The album featured modern game music in the style of 8-bit games. The 8-bit Time Paradox marks the second entry in the series and it continues the story outlined in the first album (as musically described in the album's two original tracks):
 
Paso, the 8-bit Time Traveler, invents a device that allows its bearer to travel through game eras. During a trip in the 8-bit era Paso is ambushed by Yolao, a dark lord, who steals the 8-bit time machine and uses it for his obscure plans.
 
In The 8-bit Time Paradox the story unfolds further: Yolao, the 8-bit Lord of Time, has completed many travels through game eras making changes as he willed in order to create a distorted/altenative timeline in which he is the sole ruler of the game world. Paso's only chance to beat Yolao is by recruiting 8 champions, 8 heroes from 8 games that are familiar but different, changed by the 8-bit time paradox.
The album's original will describe in music the final battle between the 8 champions and the 8-bit Lord of Time.
 
 
 
In the Perks section on the right you can find many different rewards.
 
At the 8-bit Time Headquarters it's beginning to look a lot like christmas... Stay tuned on our social media for daily announcements! Starting today with every perk you'll receive our lovely printable greeting card/piggy bank. Did we mention it is shaped like an old school arcade? Take a look (the animation will play automatically once loaded):
 
Did you know that you don't have to wait to get your hands on a digital copy of The 8-bit Time Paradox? Select one of the perks that feature the "instantaneous album download" item and start listening right away!
 
Many of our perks include a t-shirt, you can select Men or Women fits in many sizes. Take a look at how cool these are:
 
Have you ever dreamt of becoming Executive Producer of a professional recording? Now you can! Select the EXECUTIVE PRODUCER bundle and get credited on the vinyl record jacket. Here is a list of items included (the animation will play automatically once loaded):
 
Here is a render of our beautiful poster, included in some of the available perks:
 
When you choose a perk containing a vinyl record you will be able to select one of 2 amazing color variants:
 
As the campaign unfolds we will add new perks regularly. Do you have a neat idea for the perfect perk? Send us a suggestion and you might find it in the list!
 
When you purchase one of our awesome perks you will receive a download link in your email within a few hours. Here is a brief animation explaining where to click to start downloading right away and to send the files to your Dropbox:

 

Your support in this campaign will impact the album in 3 ways:

  1. If the goal is reached we'll be able to record a full symphonic orchestra for track 9!
  2. You will help us to cover the costs of licensing and distribution. 
  3. The campaign pre-orders will give the album a healthy boost at launch.

By contributing to the success of this campaign your could transform The 8-bit Time Machine even further. After the main goal is reached, incremental stretch goals will grant every supporter extra perks!

 

 

GIOVANNI ROTONDO: Album Producer & Campaign Manager

"Aside from putting together and co-ordinating the team of artists bringing you The 8-bit Time Paradox I arranged and created track 8 and composed the original piece in track 9. Now I will make sure you'll have a constant flow of new interesting content about the album in this crowd-funding campaign."

 

FEDERICA SAVARESE: Marketing Manager

"I am coordinating the promotion of the campaign and the album on all the main digital channels and social networks making sure everybody knows about this legendary musical adventure."

 

NATALIYA TKACHENKO: Customer Engagement Manager

"I am responsible for reaching out to our audience and increase their engagement with our campaign and products."

 

FRANCESCA TURSI: Legal & Licensing

"I am overseeing all the legal aspects of licensing the cover songs and distributing the album in the major digital media stores worldwide."

 

ALICE DE MAIO: Press Officer

"I am in charge of communication with all the major media outlet and blogs specialised in video games and music to get a strong coverage of the campaign."

 

LUCA CESARINI: Social Media Manager

"I am posting engaging content on all your favourite social networks, follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and of course YouTube!"

 

Do you have questions/suggestions about this album or the campaign? Drop us a line at the8bittimeparadox [at] gmail [dot] com and we'll reply promptly!

 

Help us spread the word. Share this page with all your friends and family!

story:
Portrait Maker Makes a Record

In April, I will be bringing a 12 piece version of Portrait Maker to Fantasy Studios in Berkeley. The record we will make there will be a culmination of my work as a composer, bandleader, and musician during the last six years since I graduated college and before I leave the bay area to enter grad school. Please consider pre-ordering the record here to help me raise funds to pay for the professional quality recording (at least one of your favorite multi-platinum records was recorded at Fantasy), and the giant band (full of Grammy award winning musicians*). Additionally, you can get access to the video we made of our The World of Dogs multi-disciplinary and multi-media storytelling concert experience, or commission a drawing or painting (get it? Portrait Maker), or choose from a number of other special "perks."

*they really are all good musicians but none of us have Grammys**
**yet

Portrait Maker will include (but may not be limited to):

Roger Kim: acoustic guitar, banjo
Ryan Pate: acoustic guitar
Andrea Wang: voice
Marica Petrey: voice
Debbie Gold: flute
Michelle Lee: alto flute
Steven Lugerner: alto flute, Bb clarinet
Jason Gillenwater: Bb clarinet
Kyle Beard: bass clarinet
Zachary Hazen: violin
Mia Nardi-Huffman: violin
Evan Buttemer: viola
Misha Khalikulov: cello

PERKS

The EP full length record

All contributions above $10 will come with an advanced download of the EP. All perks $50 and above will also come with a physical CD copy of the record.

The World of Dogs

The World of Dogs is Portrait Maker's multi-disciplinary multi-media storytelling event featuring music, video, dance, and live narration. Over the course of one night 10 musicians, 3 dancers and 2 narrators tell an allegorical tale about the secret underground economy run by dogs, how it relates to the gentrifying bay area, and how finding solution that seems too easy, too simple, and too good to be true may lead to disastrous consequences. If you are only now just learning about The World of Dogs, it's too late, we've already performed it last December and you missed it.

Not to worry! because you now have a second chance to see the whole thing in 1080p glory. You now have the option to contribute $25 to download video of the entire show, or $50 to get the DVD. All contributions $100 and over will include the DVD (or download - your choice).

Animal Animal Animal Animal Animal Portraits and Custom Drawings

It is a little known fact that the "Portrait Maker" in Portrait Maker is me, and that I have a soon to be viral website that displays my portraits of people with very appropriate animals. For a very low price you can have your own animal portrait (delivered by mail and be immortalized on the web). Unfortunately you cannot choose your own animal, the process for selecting animals is a closely guarded secret. If you want to have a animal portrait with a specific animal, you have to choose the custom drawing option. If you do this, be sure to let me know you want an animal portrait with a specific animal. Custom drawings can be anything, but be advised that I am not a professional drawer, so be realistic about what you ask for. All drawings will likely be in pencil, charcoal, acrylic paint, and/or sharpie marker on paper.

     

Kick it with Roger

Kick it with me for a few hours. Be creative, because there are ton of nerdly things we can do together including but not limited to: music lesson, film developing, web developing, private concert/serenade, art party, pizza party, karate pawty, 20 mile long run, composition workshop - you name it!

Analog Film Photoshoot

This perk includes:

  1. photo shoot, with pretty much unlimited film through my old school nikon fe and fe2, and (if you swing that way) my trusty medium format HOLGA, and (if you are hardcore) my retrofitted disposable film cameras. You may choose color OR black and white.
  2. Hi resolution film scans + color correction and level balancing.

Not included: travel expenses + handmade (black and white only) or digital (black and white, and color) prints.

This is super cheap for what it is, in fact I heard some pro photographers already put a price on my head because they don't like me undercutting them so. Hurry up and claim this perk before my time runs out! (view more photos here, here, and here)

   

Paintings

Go ahead. Cover up that bare spot on the wall.

Stone Buddha (22"x28") $200

Joshua Tree (42"x42") $300

Custom Painting (42"x40") $500​

Self Portrait (4 42"x40" panels) $1000
story_txt:
Portrait Maker Makes a Record
In April, I will be bringing a 12 piece version of Portrait Maker to Fantasy Studios in Berkeley. The record we will make there will be a culmination of my work as a composer, bandleader, and musician during the last six years since I graduated college and before I leave the bay area to enter grad school. Please consider pre-ordering the record here to help me raise funds to pay for the professional quality recording (at least one of your favorite multi-platinum records was recorded at Fantasy), and the giant band (full of Grammy award winning musicians*). Additionally, you can get access to the video we made of our The World of Dogs multi-disciplinary and multi-media storytelling concert experience, or commission a drawing or painting (get it? Portrait Maker), or choose from a number of other special "perks."
*they really are all good musicians but none of us have Grammys****yet
Portrait Maker will include (but may not be limited to):
Roger Kim: acoustic guitar, banjoRyan Pate: acoustic guitarAndrea Wang: voiceMarica Petrey: voiceDebbie Gold: fluteMichelle Lee: alto fluteSteven Lugerner: alto flute, Bb clarinetJason Gillenwater: Bb clarinetKyle Beard: bass clarinetZachary Hazen: violinMia Nardi-Huffman: violinEvan Buttemer: violaMisha Khalikulov: cello
PERKS

The EP full length record
All contributions above $10 will come with an advanced download of the EP. All perks $50 and above will also come with a physical CD copy of the record.
The World of Dogs
The World of Dogs is Portrait Maker's multi-disciplinary multi-media storytelling event featuring music, video, dance, and live narration. Over the course of one night 10 musicians, 3 dancers and 2 narrators tell an allegorical tale about the secret underground economy run by dogs, how it relates to the gentrifying bay area, and how finding solution that seems too easy, too simple, and too good to be true may lead to disastrous consequences. If you are only now just learning about The World of Dogs, it's too late, we've already performed it last December and you missed it.
Not to worry! because you now have a second chance to see the whole thing in 1080p glory. You now have the option to contribute $25 to download video of the entire show, or $50 to get the DVD. All contributions $100 and over will include the DVD (or download - your choice).
Animal Animal Animal Animal Animal Portraits and Custom Drawings
It is a little known fact that the "Portrait Maker" in Portrait Maker is me, and that I have a soon to be viral website that displays my portraits of people with very appropriate animals. For a very low price you can have your own animal portrait (delivered by mail and be immortalized on the web). Unfortunately you cannot choose your own animal, the process for selecting animals is a closely guarded secret. If you want to have a animal portrait with a specific animal, you have to choose the custom drawing option. If you do this, be sure to let me know you want an animal portrait with a specific animal. Custom drawings can be anything, but be advised that I am not a professional drawer, so be realistic about what you ask for. All drawings will likely be in pencil, charcoal, acrylic paint, and/or sharpie marker on paper.
     
Kick it with Roger
Kick it with me for a few hours. Be creative, because there are ton of nerdly things we can do together including but not limited to: music lesson, film developing, web developing, private concert/serenade, art party, pizza party, karate pawty, 20 mile long run, composition workshop - you name it!
Analog Film Photoshoot
This perk includes:

photo shoot, with pretty much unlimited film through my old school nikon fe and fe2, and (if you swing that way) my trusty medium format HOLGA, and (if you are hardcore) my retrofitted disposable film cameras. You may choose color OR black and white.
Hi resolution film scans + color correction and level balancing.

Not included: travel expenses + handmade (black and white only) or digital (black and white, and color) prints.
This is super cheap for what it is, in fact I heard some pro photographers already put a price on my head because they don't like me undercutting them so. Hurry up and claim this perk before my time runs out! (view more photos here, here, and here)
   
Paintings
Go ahead. Cover up that bare spot on the wall.
Stone Buddha (22"x28") $200

Joshua Tree (42"x42") $300

Custom Painting (42"x40") $500​
Self Portrait (4 42"x40" panels) $1000

story:
About my project: 

Hi!!! I am Jiji (Jiyeon Kim), a Korean Classical guitarist based in Brooklyn, NY. I am in the midst of working on my debut EP, focusing on works that I perform regularly in 2017-18 season. 

This EP consists works from the Baroque to contemporary, I love bringing unusual repertoire to my audience-- in my recitals, I will perform pieces on the classical guitar then the next piece would be on the electric guitar! I love all different types of music and I think it's important for me to share that love and passion with the audience.

About me:

Applauded by the Calgary Herald as “…talented, sensitive…brilliant,” Jiji is an adventurous artist on both acoustic and electric guitar, playing an extensive range of music from traditional and contemporary classical music to free improvisation. Her impeccable musicianship combined with compelling stage presence and fascinating repertoire earned the Korean guitarist First Prize at the 2016 Concert Artists Guild International Competition.

Following recent performances at the 92 nd Street ‘Y’ Guitar Fest and at Festival Napa Valley, Jiji has a busy 2017-18 season, featuring her New York recital debut at Weill Recital Hall on the CAG series, along with recitals for the Krannert Center for the Performing Arts in Illinois, Lincoln Center in New York, Purdue Convocations in Indiana, and the Virginia Arts Festival(co-presented by the Tidewater Classical Guitar Society).

The Kansas City Star described Jiji as “A graceful and nuanced player,” adding that “…she presented an intimate, captivating performance” in its review of her recent appearance as guest soloist with Kansas City Symphony and conductor Carlos Miguel Prieto. Upcoming concerto appearances include the Great Falls Symphony (MT), Roswell Symphony (NM), and the Southwest Michigan Symphony.

Currently sponsored by D'Addario Strings. Jiji’s performances have been featured on PBS (On Stage at Curtis series), NPR’s From the Top, WHYY-TV, FOX 4-TV, Munchies (the Vice Channel), The Not So Late Show (Channel 6, Kansas), and Hong Kong broadcast station RTHK’s The Works.

A passionate advocate of new music, Jiji has premiered a duo piece Talking Guitars by renowned
composer, Paul Lansky, and her subsequent studio recording of that work (with young Chinese guitarist Hao Yang) will be released on Bridge Records in the 2017-18 season. As a recipient of the 2017 BMI commissioning award resulting from the CAG Competition. Jiji has commissioned Nina C. Young to write a new guitar piece scheduled for premiere in early 2018. She has premiered works by numerous emerging composers, including Gabriella Smith, Riho Maimets, Krists Auznieks, Gulli Björnsson, Andrew McIntosh, and Farnood HaghaniPour.  

to read more...http://jijiguitar.com/bio/

The breakdowns:

  • Recording (the audio engineer/recording) Elm City Records
  • Post Production (mixing/editing/mastering) Elm City Records
  • manufacturing costs
  • shipping
  • album design costs (Graphic designer Moon Sick Gang)

It will cost about $2000 to produce this EP. Every little help would mean so much to me. 

I have 35 days to raise the full amount of my goal. If I don't reach my goal, it'll go to directly to the personnel who has already put in so much efforts into the project. It'll slow down the process of producing this album so that is why it's crucial for your support!

TOUR DATES:

exciting part is that I'll be going on a tour in Mid January and I'll be making my Carnegie hall debut on Feb 13th! Hopefully, I can produce my album then so I can share it all with you!

dates: http://jijiguitar.com/concerts/

Other Ways to Help:

Those who are unable to assist financially can still help this project come to fruition simply by spreading the word and sharing my campaign with as many people as possible. 

Ways you can help: 

 -Sharing this link on instagram, facebook, and twitter!!!

- Emailing link to your friends and family!

social media links:

website: https://jijiguitar.com

fb: https://www.facebook.com/jijiguitarist/

instagram: https://www.instagram.com/jiji_guitar/

story:
Summary

Storytelling is at the heart of my music and the content I create. Many of you know me as a composer, bandleader and pianist/vocalist. Now, I'm taking my art further with addition of visual content - hence, a music video.

This video is my way of trying to use my music as a vehicle of social change and expression. To awaken what's hidden, to say what we are thinking, using music as a barrier-breaker.

Who Can Relate tells a story of human isolation and connection told through the lens of two strangers who pass on the sidewalk. We learn how compassion and an intentional disconnect from our technology has great rewards.

With your support, we hope to acquire the equipment and resources needed to produce a professional and commercially-viable product that is marketable to a national audience through social media platforms, YouTube, festivals and competitions. 

What We Need & What You Get

Get a holler for your dollar. Let's break it down:

Become a Bronze Sponsor!

$10

A shout-out on all our social media platforms, thanking you for your generosity!

Listed under “Thanks” in the end credits of the film.

 

Become a Silver Sponsor!

$50

A handwritten thank-you note from our directors, Hannah and Harrison.

A shout-out on all our social media platforms, thanking you for your generosity!

Listed under “Special Thanks” in the end credits of the film.

You have the option to be a part of the film! If you are interested, we will include you as an extra during the shoot.

 

Become a Gold Guru Sponsor!

$100

A free download of Who Can Relate song + music video

A handwritten thank-you note from our directors, Hannah and Harrison.

A shout-out on all our social media platforms, thanking you for your generosity!

“Partner” title in the end credits of the film.

You have the option to be a part of the film! If you are interested, we will include you as an extra during the shoot.

 

Become a Platinum Powerhouse Sponsor!

$300

Baker’s dozen of your choice of Hannah’s home-baked treats including lemon bars, Italian meringue cookies, or brownies.

A free download of Who Can Relate song + music video

A handwritten thank-you note from our directors, Hannah and Harrison.

A shout-out on all our social media platforms, thanking you for your generosity!

“Associate Producer” title in the end credits of the film.

You have the option to be a part of the film! If you are interested, we will include you as an extra during the shoot.

 

The Ultimate Sponsor!

$500 +

Making the biggest impact

A free hour long concert performed by yours truly, a copy of Hannah’s CD, and the first to hear her new single release.

Contact Hannah for details.

A free download of Who Can Relate song + music video

Baker’s dozen of your choice of Hannah’s home-baked treats including lemon bars, Italian meringue cookies, or brownies.

A handwritten thank-you note from our directors, Hannah and Harrison.

A shout-out on all our social media platforms, thanking you for your generosity!

“Executive Producer” title in the end credits of the film.

You have the option to be a part of the film! If you are interested, we will include you as an extra during the shoot.

 

The Impact

Where does all of this money go? Your contribution will help the video in every step of the process, from preparations to the finishing touches. Some areas that your donation will go towards are below:

-Crew and Cast

-Permitting and Location Fees

-Equipment Costs

-Food and Lodging

-Film Editing and Sound Mixing

-Distribution and Festival Fees

Making a music video for an unsigned artist is a major challenge. Your contribution not only supports this project, but supports my music and creative vision. Thank you so very much. Every bit counts.

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, sometimes you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't still help:

  • Please ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign!
  • Share across social media, drop a shoutout in a podcast, YouTube vid, dinner party, on the radio, in print or across other media channels.
  • Ask me to do an interview or PSA
  • Share our IndieGogo post on your page
