story:
Ground control to Major Tom...

I'm a singer, songwriter, and multi-instrumentalist who performs with Beth Kinderman & the Player Characters, a geeky progressive rock band. Since 2009, my bandmates, my friends, my husband, and I have operated Space Oddity Music Club & Brew Pub, a room party at the annual MarsCon science fiction convention in Bloomington, MN, taking place this year from March 4-6, 2016. On both nights of the con, Space Oddity opens its doors to feature several varieties of geeky entertainment with a focus on concerts and music circles. Our main goal is to give convention attendees the chance to join a circle with a diverse group of musicians (from beginners to professionals) and perform for an appreciative crowd.

To learn more about Space Oddity's history and philosophy, check out our successful IndieGoGo funding campaigns from 2013, 2014, and 2015. The geek community has always supported our party through its generosity of time, money, and spirit, and we were thrilled to exceed our crowdfunding goal the past three years running.

Commencing countdown, engines on

We try to bring more than just music to our community. In addition to Space Oddity's music circles, guests at our party can play board and card games from our personal libraries, snack on a variety of foods including delicious cheeses and fresh home-baked cookies, or sample beverages including Wall's End English brown ale from our favorite local brewery, Northgate Brewing.

As many of you are also aware, David Bowie, whose music gave our party its name, recently passed away. We can't let this year's celebration pass without honoring him, so on Friday night of the party we'll also be hosting a sing-along and tribute and serving a specialty cocktail inspired by one of his songs.

The money in our goal amount will be used as follows:

  • $300 to reserve a hotel room for both nights of MarsCon and to leave a generous tip for the hard-working people who kindly clean up after us.

  • $200 for our keg of Northgate Brewing Wall's End beer and for ingredients for our David Bowie tribute cocktail.

  • $150 for food - cheese, crackers, meats, chocolate, and cookie baking supplies.

  • $200 for IndieGoGo fees, perks, and other incidental expenses incurred in the course of throwing the party (sign printing, masking tape, ice, that thing we forgot at home that we realize we really need at 6:30 p.m. Friday...).

This year, in honor of David Bowie, any funds raised in excess of our costs will be donated to charity. Half will go to one of our namesake's preferred charities, Keep a Child Alive, and the other half will go to cancer research.


Take your protein pills and put your helmet on

Of course, it wouldn't be a crowdfunding campaign without great perks to encourage you to donate! You'll see that this year, many of our perks share a common theme. Here are a few of them:

  • Badge ribbons: Customized ribbons that affix to your membership badge are a tradition at many Midwestern SF cons. A $5 donation gets you a ribbon emblazoned with the words "There's a Starman waiting in the sky - Space Oddity 2016."
  • Custom engraved pint glasses: Donate $25 or more and receive a new and unique Space Oddity pint glass, beautifully engraved with some of the lyrics from the song that gave us our name.
  • Musical rewards: Once again, the bands and artists of TropeStorm Records have kindly agreed to perform for your amusement, whether that takes the form of CDs or of cover songs or originals recorded by your request.
  • New this year - You call it!: If you'll be attending MarsCon this year, contributing at the $175 level earns you the right to request a beverage for us to stock in our bar, for you and perhaps a few of your friends.
  • Space Oddity in your house!: At the top donation tier, Space Oddity will host an event for you and your guests. Donate $250 or more and we'll bring the party to you, providing food, drink, games, and musical entertainment.

Check out the sidebar for more details!


Planet Earth is blue and there's something you can do

Can't contribute cash right now, but still want to help make Space Oddity happen? Here are a few other ways you can help us:

  • If you'll be at MarsCon, we are always in need of volunteers who can replenish snacks, check IDs, serve beer, and otherwise keep Space Oddity running smoothly to give its hosts an occasional break. We also always need people to help us set up the party on Friday morning/afternoon and take it down on Sunday morning. Just contact us before or at the con and we'll put you to work!
  • Do you have surplus snacks or drinks (unopened and unexpired, of course) that need a good home in someone's stomach? If so, Space Oddity might be interested in taking them off your hands. Contact us before the con and let us know what you have to offer.
  • Of course, we always have tip jars out while the party is running, and welcome donations in any amount at that time as well. Your spare change is delicious to us, and every dollar helps!
  • Spread the word about our IndieGoGo campaign on your social networks - Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr, whatever new thing is out there that we're not young enough to know about yet, it's all good!

(Space Oddity photos by the incomparable Baron Dave Romm.)

story:
I am a singer songwriter from the heart of the welsh valleys.

“Growing up I had a passion for music. Singing was something I loved doing and I really enjoyed writing songs and singing.

For ages I was really shy and didn’t want to let anyone else hear me sing.  I was then offered a chance to go into the clandest recording studio in London, it was the best experience I ever had. I realised at that point that this is what I wanted to do and music is now my life.”

I hope with the help of my fans I can fund the music video to my latest single.

Your kind donations will go 100% towards the costs of filming and recording as well as editing and production of the complete video.

Thanks to everyone for their support, Alisha.
story_txt: I am a singer songwriter from the heart of the welsh valleys.“Growing up I had a passion for music. Singing was something I loved doing and I really enjoyed writing songs and singing.For ages I was really shy and didn’t want to let anyone else hear me sing.  I was then offered a chance to go into the clandest recording studio in London, it was the best experience I ever had. I realised at that point that this is what I wanted to do and music is now my life.”I hope with the help of my fans I can fund the music video to my latest single.Your kind donations will go 100% towards the costs of filming and recording as well as editing and production of the complete video.Thanks to everyone for their support, Alisha.

story:
La petite histoire de Gen & Marcus

Geneviève et Marcus se sont rencontrés lors de leur parcours en jazz à la Faculté de musique de l’Université de Montréal. Ils ont vite eu un coup de foudre musical lors de leurs premiers jams ensemble.  Passionnés l’un autant que l’autre par le jazz et la musique folklorique, l’idée était toute naturelle de continuer à jouer ensemble et d’en faire un projet plus sérieux, ce qu’ils ont entrepris l’hiver dernier.  

Ils ont alors décidé de combiner leurs talents d’arrangement et de composition afin de constituer un nouveau répertoire original, tissé d’influences musicales variées.  Et cela, toujours dans un esprit de présenter une musique accessible, mais qui révèle une véritable recherche au niveau des mélodies, arrangements, structures et du son en général.  Depuis, leur duo violon-guitare résonne avec une poésie acoustique naturelle.  

La prochaine étape est de concrétiser ce projet sous forme d’enregistrement de qualité professionnelle.

 

Le projet de EP

L’objectif de cette campagne est de produire notre premier EP, soit un album de 6 titres.  Nous avons déjà plusieurs compositions qui ont été travaillées et retravaillées, et celles-ci seront bientôt prêtes à être enregistrées.  Le produit final permettra de diffuser notre musique au grand public et servira de carte de visite pour faire avancer le groupe.

Notre mission artistique est claire : faire vivre à notre auditoire (vous!) un instant de simplicité, de poésie, de moment présent et d’authenticité.  Cela s’incarne par la recherche d’une fraîcheur musicale, d’un folklore modernisé, d’une musique qui se distingue par ses mélodies touchantes, ses arrangements bien ficelés, savamment orchestrés, et par une complicité naturelle.  

Nos compositions proposent une version modernisée de la tradition folklorique en lui donnant de nouveaux accents, ce qui permet de rejoindre aussi bien les férus de jazz que les inconditionnels du folklore et les fans de folk et de bluegrass.

L’enregistrement du EP se fera au Studio du Chemin 4, bien reconnu dans la sphère trad.

 

La campagne

Les fonds recueillis serviront à couvrir divers aspects de la démarche de production : enregistrement, mixage, matriçage, réalisation d’une pochette, séance de photos, promotion, etc.  C’est grâce à vous que nous pourrons atteindre notre objectif et concrétiser le projet. Chaque don compte !

En même temps, vous avez la possibilité de réserver d’avance votre copie du EP, d’obtenir un macaron ou un bandeau tricoté à la main, de dîner avec le duo, et même de participer à une agréable soirée d’écoute en primeur !  Tout cela pour souligner l’immense reconnaissance que nous aurons pour votre appui.

 

D’autres façons de nous aider

Partagez !  Faites circuler le mot, faites écouter notre musique, parlez de notre campagne de sociofinancement autour de vous !  Nous vous en serons bien reconnaissants.

Nous vous remercions du fond du coeur pour votre aide et votre appui !  On vous garde très près de nous dans cette belle aventure.

story:
Introduction 

 

We are Rotten Halo, a thrash-, death metal band, founded 2020 in Vienna, Austria. 

So far we have released four singles and played our debut concert at the iconic “Escape Metal Corner” in Vienna. 

We plan to record our very first studio album "Devoured Hope" early 2021, and we would like to have YOUR support! 

Help us to make Metal heavy again!

 

Who are we and what do we want to do?

Rotten Halo is an Austrian metal band, that creates Thrash Metal with many different influences from Bands like Slayer, Testament, Bring me the Horizon, Behemoth, Eluveitie, Suicide Silence and more!! But the best way to find out what kind of Metal we love and live for is to check our music out if you haven´t already!

Our Band consists of four members:

- Raphi our vocalist and bassist 

- Chris our drummer

- Reini our rhythm guitarist 

- Tim our lead guitarist 

Each one of us influenced by other bands and that is why we have so much fun creating music together. All of our songs have a specific character and can’t really be put into mainstream categories.

Enough story telling! 

We want to record our first studio album “Devoured Hope”! The whole album has a story telling perspective and a greater meaning. There are tales about mad men, creatures, not from this world, psychopaths and the deepest and darkest desires of human beings. 

We put all heart, soul and effort in this album and we sweat blood and tears to create something you all will love! Devoured Hope is the best thing we all four have ever created and this is why we need YOUR SUPPORT to share it with the world!

What We Need & What You Get 

Our production costs contains:

Artwork

Recording

Studioproduction

Merchandise

Video Production

----------------------------------

We are asking for your contribution to reach our goal of 4.000 EUR as a support to cover these costs. 

 

You will get:

- Our debút album, that has everything to offer, from brutal deathmetal over crushing thrash metal to bone chilling deathcore

- New Merchandise and exclusive products 

- You will be part of our bands history by having your name mentioned in the booklet of our album

- Exclusive Bonus Tracks 

 

 

What comes next?

 

As soon as our album is finished and released we hope to get on tour and play concerts! We want to share all of our Passion and Love with YOU, our Supporters and FAMILY!
Rotten Halo shall become a band where everyone is welcome and everyone is part of OUR Family! All of you are a part of our band as well and that is why we can´t wait to meet you all at our concerts and share some drinks with you afterwards!

 

With YOUR help and YOUR contribution, we will make a metal album the world has never seen before!

 

Thank you,

The boys from Rotten Halo

story:
Short Summary

 

Luthia are a music trio based in Glasgow, Scotland, consisting of Martyn McKenzie, Scott Jack Glanville and Jamie Wilson. Together we have been writing and playing music as a group for over a year, aspiring to make music that pushes boundaries and connects with a diverse audience. As a band inspired by a multitude of ideas and approaches to music and art, we want to make our first release something more intimate and unique for people to experience.

This project will involve working closely with film-maker Lewis Landini and Black Bay Studios where we will work on the live music recording, alongside the filming of our music. Out of the studio with Lewis we will also explore and capture the landscape around the studio, with the vision of making a film that creates a relationship with the ever changing light and atmosphere of the landscape with the mood and dynamics of our music. 

We intend for this project to produce a high quality document of our music as a live performance trio, offering people a way of connecting with us in a deeper way.

At the end of this project we will have created and released both; a 30 minute film, and a 15-20 minute Live EP consisting of tracks featured in the film.

Recently, we worked with Lewis Landini to produce a live music film of our song 'Roslyn' which you can check out below. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our project requires a minimum of £2,500 to fully create and complete. 

Where The Funding Goes:

 

Studio: The studio, Black Bay Studios, is an essential element to our vision and ability to create this project due to the unique and specific qualities it has and what it allows us to capture in performance as well as the surrounding environmental setting. Funding raised will pay for our hiring of the studio and engineering costs. https://www.blackbaystudio.com

 

Film-Maker: Our collaborator on this project is Lewis Landini,  an exceptionally talented, young and diverse film-maker with a distinct and dynamic approach to cinematography that is ideal for our project. The funding raised will pay for his involvement as both cinematographer, editor and co-creator of the overall film. https://cargocollective.com/lewislandini/About

 

Travel: It is essential to us that we have the ability to create this project in the special landscape of the Isle of Lewis. The studio allows us to capture film of the landscape from the recording space itself, and to incorporate the qualities of the natural light into the filmed performances. Funding raised will pay for car hire, ferry travel and any unforeseen costs relative to this.

As a final statement: no money raised will go towards paying ourselves (Luthia) as participants. This project is purely about creating work we are deeply invested in and have desire to share with others. Any money raised beyond minimum project costs will be reinvested into costs of creating and delivering our incentive ideas, a cost we are alternatively happy to bear ourselves. 

 

What We Want To Give To You In Return:

We have created a variety of incentives for you to choose from if you decide to help fund our project. They vary in price and content, with something hopefully for many different budgets. We are excited with the creative approaches we have taken - part of the desire to offer incentives that would give those who help us an extra insight and depth into the project. 

See below for a list of what we have to offer - all available to purchase on right of this page.

• £10 - Digital EP and Film Bundle (unlimited)  • £20 - Unique Polaroid Photograph - x 10 • £20 - Original Film Poster Print - x 10 • £35 - Hand Bound Booklet - x 20  • £50 - Hardback Self Published Book - x20 • £75 - Nature Box - x 4 • £100 - Original Oil on Panel Painting - x 6 • £200 - Luthia Home Concert - x 2 

(The Digital EP and Film Bundle is also included with any of the other incentives)

 

The Impact

As an ambitious emerging group, we wish to connect to and discover our audience with a bold and inviting statement. We believe our project benefits the creative and cultural dialogue present in Scotland, with our work adding a distinctive and individual voice to contemporary creative practices. 

The creation of this project will enhance our presence when contacting promoters, venues, events and festivals. This will in turn increase chance of securing performance opportunities having developed an audience through various online and physical platforms and with the film providing better insight into our band’s work. The success of this project will also aid us in securing other development opportunities in the future.

 

Risks & Challenges

If we do not reach our minimum target of £2,500, all the money will be put aside and used as the basis from which to apply for co-funding from an arts organisation for the rest of the projects financial requirements, and will not be used in any other way in the interim.

All collaborators have been creating and following their chosen paths in creative areas for the best part of a decade with various achievements and a diversity of projects undertaken in that time. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you so much for any interest in this project. If finances are just beyond your ability to help, please know you can still help us achieve something special by sharing our project...

Indiegogo has its own share tools found on this page, or you can also share and follow our Facebook or Instagram posts - https://www.facebook.com/luthiamusic/ 

Thank you from Luthia: Scott, Martyn and Jamie.

story:
I am a normal person trying to connect with people and make them feel something through the songs I have written from emotions and experiences I have had in my life.

 

People have always seemed to be able to connect with my music, which to me is an honor. I always struggled when I was younger with being afraid of performing in front of people, especially songs I had written. But once I finally took that first step, I became addicted; this is my life and what I want to do with it.

 

I have never recorded a release that is just me.

 

I have recorded with bands before but this project is my own. I can take it anywhere and do with it what I choose. These are my songs, my stories.

 

As a musician that is still "starting off" I have little money to make this recording happen. But I want to put out the best quality release that I can.

 


That's why I am doing this funding project. I hate asking people for money. But for the people that believe in my music and wish to support it in monetary form, I have made this available. Rest assured it will be put to good use. Whether it is a small amount or a big one, I appreciate it so much!

 

Thank you for helping this release happen.

 

- Gabe Reasoner/Hunter Dumped Us Here

story:
Kendall Perry is a passionate musician, composer, director, and interdisciplinary artist based out of Boulder, Colorado.  She is currently working on her next performance production, "DESTIN∆T∆", to be premiered in September as part of the 2015 Boulder International Fringe Festival. 

Like smelling lilac in spring & glimpsing the reflection of moonlight in water. This is what falling in love sounds like: vibrations that envelop you in beauty—beyond time & words, where shadows meet the light.  When arid logic fails to capture fully the ever-changing story of the heart, there is music to give it voice:  A story of tenderness. Of impermanence. Of surrender in the face of the irresistible simplicity and infinite expanse of each moment.  This is DESTIN∆T∆. 

Building on the success of last year’s interdisciplinary production, “unravel”, the artist Kendall Perry and her band reveal this story through her musical score, giving voice to the ineffable and communicating the extraordinary through music.  DESTIN∆T∆ combines acoustic and visual idioms by incorporating the naturalistic vocabulary of the artist’s photography. This performance uses the language of the senses to approach the numinous wildernesses of the heart—the mysterious DESTIN∆T∆ inside us all.

THE ENSEMBLE :

Kendall Perry : composer / photographer / guitarist
Elana Brody : piano
Todd Bilsborough : drumset
Brendan Haskins : synthesizer 
Daniel Herman : live sound / recording engineer 
Nina Contrada : poster design 

PUTTING ON THE SHOW :

In order to meet the minimum costs to put on this show, we'll need to raise at least $3,000. Here's the breakdown of where the money will be going :: 

$ 790 : Fringe Listing And Production Fees 
$ 1500 : To Pay Musicians & Live Sound/Recording Engineer 
$ 300 : Photography Printing (for photography show) 
$ 300 : Promotional & Marketing Costs
$ 100 : Zine Printing 

If you are able to help out, check out the fabulous perks to contributing!  You can come to the show, get a photography print, get an album, VIP pass, etc! 

Understandably not everyone is equipped with the funds to share, and as such there are other ways you can help! You can spread the word (maybe someone you know can help?), you can come to the show (yes! good idea!), and you can listen to Kendall's previous work here : https://kendallperrymusic.bandcamp.com/releases

story:
Hey everyone, my name's Austin Jones and i'm a musician from Chicago, IL. I'm currently on tour, and 2 nights ago someone broke into our tour van. Woke up to find one of the windows busted, and most of our tour merchandise and crates stolen from the vehicle. Luckily no one was hurt, but with tour just starting and with all the investments we've put into this, it's going to leave me pretty close to being broke at the start of this tour. This is a very difficult and stressful situation for me. Touring and bringing music to people is such a positive thing, it's a shame that this happens.

Any donation and or perk purchase will go towards recouping what was lost and damages involved. If you could help me out, I would greatly appreciate it. If not, don't worry.

Thank you guys so much for supporting me. It won't be easy, but I know we'll get through this. I love you guys with all of my heart.

- Austin
story_txt: Hey everyone, my name's Austin Jones and i'm a musician from Chicago, IL. I'm currently on tour, and 2 nights ago someone broke into our tour van. Woke up to find one of the windows busted, and most of our tour merchandise and crates stolen from the vehicle. Luckily no one was hurt, but with tour just starting and with all the investments we've put into this, it's going to leave me pretty close to being broke at the start of this tour. This is a very difficult and stressful situation for me. Touring and bringing music to people is such a positive thing, it's a shame that this happens. Any donation and or perk purchase will go towards recouping what was lost and damages involved. If you could help me out, I would greatly appreciate it. If not, don't worry.Thank you guys so much for supporting me. It won't be easy, but I know we'll get through this. I love you guys with all of my heart.- Austin

story:
HEY, YOU! I need YOUR help!

Hi! I'm a proud, 18-year-old Barada/Barna woman from Central Queensland. I am currently finishing Year 12 VCE. I'm passionate about Indigenous rights and want to work to better the lives of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples in whatever ways I can when I finish school. I have been heavily involved in activist circles these past few months and I believe the UN Youth Aotearoa Leadership Tour 2015 is another important stage of my activist work.

Last year in November, I traveled from my home in Geelong to Brisbane to protest the G20. I traveled independently and protested with hundreds of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples from across the continent to make the international community aware of the oppression and injustices that Indigenous peoples continue to experience. Spending that weekend in Brisbane was and still is a very important experience to me. I made many friends there and I spoke with elders and I learned about the struggles that my people face on an everyday basis. I gained a greater insight and valuable knowledge into Aboriginal sovereignty and real land rights by speaking with community leaders and grassroots activists. 

I also hold the position of Year 12 FIRE Carrier at my school (Friends Igniting Reconciliation through Education) along with another young Aboriginal woman in Year 12. In this leadership role, I organize cultural activities and events for the Indigenous students at my school and in my personal role, I have aimed to raise greater awareness on the struggles that Indigenous peoples face today.

I was involved in National Youth Week 2015 and a 2 x 2 m poster of my face was displayed on an iconic Geelong landmark. You can read about my poster here; http://streetface4.geelong.social/about/sample-page/315-streetface/

It would mean the world to me if I could reach my fundraising goal. Should you be in a position to donate, however small or big, I look forward to expressing my appreciation for your support. 

What is the tour about and where will the funds go?

The UN Youth Australia Aotearoa Leadership Tour 2015 (29th June - 11 July) is about learning about indigenous rights and culture in Australia and New Zealand through a two-week tour of the North Island of New Zealand. Throughout the tour, delegates will; "...meet and engage with a range of stakeholders in Australia and New Zealand involved in indigenous affairs including as academics, politicians, public servants and nongovernment organisations."
The tour aims to educate delegates about the post and pre-colonial histories of Australia and New Zealand, as well as enabling delegates to

 compare and contrast the broad 

cultural similarities and differences between 

Indigenous Australians and Maori New 

Zealanders. On the tour, the other 15 delegates and myself will also develop an 

understanding of the social, cultural, economic and political and legal issues that affect the indigenous peoples of Australia and New Zealand with a particular emphasis on land rights, recognition in the law and governmental programs to address disadvantage in both countries. 

All of the funds will go towards to the $2300 registration fee for this tour which includes:

  • All flights
  • All breakfasts and dinners
  • All accommodation 
  • All ground transport
  • All scheduled activities 
A portion of the funds will also go towards purchasing warm clothing for winter in New Zealand as well as business attire for New Zealand Model United Nations (NZMUN).
Even if I do not reach my fundraising goal, all the raised funds will still go towards all of the above

The impact your contribution will have

Whatever contribution you make, it will help me get one step closer to raising funds for the tour. My family isn't rich and so we often find it hard to pay for big trips like this. 
Apart from the financial side of things, me going on this tour will help me gain valuable knowledge from Māori community leaders.
The Māori people have a treaty, unlike the indigenous peoples of Australia. I am interested to find out from Māori community leaders if this has improve their lives and status in New Zealand. 
 How can we preserve indigenous cultures? How can we ensure that indigenous peoples are still able to exist as cultured peoples, whilst still being able to be included, supported and given independence by the state? How will constitutional recognition benefit Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples? How has New Zealand addressed indigenous disadvantage and land rights? It's question like this that I aim to answer and delve into whilst on the tour.
I will bring back valuable knowledge and insight back to my community and use it to further my activism and broaden my understanding of Indigenous rights and justice.
However, I can only do this if I have the funds - that's where your contribution comes in!

What happens if I don't reach my fundraising goal?

There's a big possibility that I won't be able to reach my goal in time, but I have devised ways around this. I will be applying for grants, applying for sponsorship and selling chocolates at my school as a back up plan in case my IndieGoGo project falls short. 
I'm resilient, open minded and optimistic. Not reaching my full goal won't bring me down. 

Other ways you can help...

If you're not in a position to donate, you can certainly help me in other ways. 
You can share the link to this fundraising page. Copy and paste it from here for the not-so-computer-savvy; http://igg.me/at/nWwSEuEopFU/x/10765530
Please tell your friends and family, and anyone who you think might be interested in donating any amount of money. 
In whatever way you choose to help, I will be extremely grateful.
Thank-you. :)

story:
NOTE: TO PURCHASE A PERK, CLICK THE BOX OF THE ONE YOU WOULD LIKE! It's that easy and fun!

If you purchase a perk, which start at $25, that guarantees you a copy of the album! 

WHO IS THIS BROAD?
Hello world! I’m Catherine Alcorn, a Sydney based performing artist. This June I'll be stepping into the studio to record my first album - a selection of beautifully rearranged songs I perform in my live stage shows.

I quit my job in television a few years ago to pursue my career as performer. At the time I was a total unknown in the Aussie theatre scene, so I produced my first cabaret show which went on to tour all over the county. Since then I have conceptualised, produced and starred in three critically acclaimed stage shows, played every major cabaret festival in Australia and have even to toured Hong Kong, New York, Tasmania and New Zealand. Fancy! 

Yet after every show, without fail, audience members ask me where they can buy my album...and I never have any to sell them. I know, right! So here we are...


AIN'T SHOWBIZ GRAND!
Dreams cost money. We need to raise $10,000 to make this album everything we want it to be.  This will cover our production costs for the album: Studio Rental, Producer fee, Mixing Engineer, Mastering Engineer, additional musicians and pressing. 

EVERY LITTLE BIT HELPS
Seriously. If you can donate just $1 that gets us that little bit closer to making it all happy and getting those puppies PRESSED!


WHAT WE ARE MAKING
Constantly touring more than one show means I have a LOT of material, so I wanted to create a record that will give audiences something to take away with them from what they just watched. The album will be a compilation that will feature three songs from each stage show I have produced - THE DIVINE MISS BETTE, GO YOUR OWN WAY:The Story of Christine McVie and NOTHING BUT A SONG.

My team features some of the most incredible Australian musicians (who also happen to be some of the best in the world) and we are going to produce something beautiful, exciting, surprising and meaningful. I can’t wait for you to hear it!


WHAT ARE PERKS?
Perks are a really fun way for me to give YOU something back for the money you have contributed. I've created packages starting from as little as $25. Check them out! There is so much on offer including:

- Backstage tours + meet and greet experiences
- A visit to the recording studio on the day we lay down the magic
- Show tickets
- Masterclass workshops
- Exclusive performance at your next event
- Bloody great karma!

AND  you can even be an executive producer on the album. You ROCKSTAR!


DO I NEED TO BUY A PERK?
Nope! You can simply make a contribution of whatever you can afford. 


WHAT YOU GET
You get rewarded for every dollar you donate. Awesome! I’ve had so much fun designing these perks for you. My work is generally a live experience so I’ve endeavoured to put together packages that give you a little glimpse into life in showbiz. 


THE TEAM
I've got the best team in the world! Here, meet them...

Isaac Hayward - Musical Director and Pianist
Jamie Castrisos - Drums
Daniel Maher - Guitar
Tina Harris - Bass
Jane Cho - Violin
Clare Khan - Cello

Recorded at Blackfoot Sound Sydney
Marty Hailey - Mixing Engineer
Chelsea Knight - Graphic Design
Wes Nell - Photography


WHITE RIBBON FOUNDATION
The White Ribbon foundation is an Australian organisation that works to prevent male violence against women. $1 from each album sale will be donated to the Foundation. This is how I can help and, to be honest, it's 2015. Enough is enough. 

Find out more about WHITE RIBBON here.


THANK YOU
Without you, this simply wouldn’t happen. Thank you.

story:
For Such A Time As This . . . 

We are Michael & Sally O'Connor, founders of Improbable People Ministries, a non-profit ministry of music and healing and reconciliation for over 26 years. In 2015 the Lord began to lay on Sally's heart the need to record a live concert DVD.  As we had never before captured one of Sally's concerts in a professional video, we believed it was time to record a concert to help extend the reach of Sally's ministry. We live in an audio/visual age and the visual has become as important as the audio—probably more so. Sally's unique expression of our original songs has always been the most compelling in person. Our hope was to capture that compelling quality on DVD for friends to share with friends.

                                  

So on Friday December 30, 2016 we  recorded Sally live in an intimate 49-seat venue with state-of-the-art equipment, singing the songs we have written through the years, along with the stories of how these songs were born.

We're happy to report the evening was a smashing success. Sally's fellow musicians were supportive and professional which buoyed her to minister and perform at a very high level despite the fact she was fighting a strong bout with pneumonia. 

We are now in the post-production phase dealing with mixing sound levels, mastering, editing, etc. We believe we've captured something beautiful and lasting. Now it's time to bring the video down the home stretch and across the finish line.

Many in the live concert audience commented their favorite song (and story) was a little-known tune which has seldom been played in concert by Sally. We've realized this tune captures much of the spirit the 25 plus years of Improbable People has come to embody. We hope you enjoy this taste of the evening with the DVD's title song   I Want to Make History With You.

 

 

How You Can Help

Although this is not a high budget project by industry standards this DVD is more than we can afford. Here are some of the expenses we are facing:

           

  • Venue/Studio Rental
  • Musicians
  • Video Editing & Mastering
  • Audio Mastering
  • Creation of DVD Package
  • DVD Duplication
  • Shipping

Keeping costs as low as possible while maintaining quality, we figure the bill for this project comes in around $3,000—or perhaps a bit more. If you are able to get involved we have some terrific incentives to help make your participation both fun and rewarding. While these are described in the right hand column in more detail these perks include:

                               

  • SKO CDs & Digital Downloads                                  
  • Sally's New Book
  • Copies of the Live Concert DVD
  • Bundles Galore
  • Sally Gives a Concert in Your Living Room!

             ​        

​These perks will be sent out at varying points of 2017 as they become available. We will keep in touch and let you know more details as we have them. Each perk listed on the right of this page has an approximate delivery time.

 

And Finally . . . 

We thank you for taking the time to read this far. As you can see, if God moves on your heart there are many ways to participate in this project. May God bless and keep you.

 

.

story:
The Story

In 2010 I found myself in a new city with no job and lots of extra time. I spent hours at my keyboard in our one bedroom apartment trying to process life and before I knew it, I had a notebook full of songs.  In 2016, I felt God ask me to take them out of the notebook and record them. This was something I never expected or dreamed about doing, but I couldn't get away from it.  So I  began the process of editing, polishing and narrowing down songs that I had never meant for anyone else to hear. And now I'm ready to record!  

The Album

If we are successful with fundraising, I plan to record and release a worship EP by Summer 2017; this will likely include 3 songs.  Funds raised will be used for the album production, equipment, instrumentation and studio time.  Only a digital release is planned at this time, however, if we exceed our goal by enough, we will offer actual CD's (for those of you that are into that). :)         

The love
I know that those contributing to this project are friends, family, and friends that feel like family. Thank you for believing in me, what's in my heart, and the power of following the Lord, even if it takes you somewhere unexpected!

xx
Sara

story:
Versiones abajo en espagnol y frances. 
Il y a l'explication en bas en francais et espagnol.
 
ENGLISH / INGLES / ANGLAIS 
Hi , My name is Michel Vermeulen.  I am living in Barcelona and I am passionate about live music and have been organising events for more than 2 years. Check out my Facebook page also: 

https://www.facebook.com/madclubbarcelona/

Now in Barcelona I do not find a good guide to all that has to do with live music. It is hard to find jam sessions , open mics , little alternative concerts and believe me there are many. When you google live music barcelona allways you get sites that talk about where you can eat , sleep , and maybe they talk about 5 bars that do live music.  Musicians have a hard time finding gigs to play , and bar owners have a hard time to reach clients. We all loose hours to find information and in the end we give up. This is a shame , with todays technology we should have this info within 5 min. 

To create more opportunities for artists in Barcelona and make it easier for local people and tourists to find all these alternative places I want to create a platform about live music in Barcelona. I call it a platform because I want to include : 

1. Calender of events going on big and small
2. List of venues - bars that organise live music 
3. List of Local Artists . 
4. List of Music Schools, workshops, etc
5. List of Music shops 
6. List of Recording studios. 
7. Information on street performing , where, laws,..
8. Newsletters, interviews with local bands 
9. Create a mobile app to find live music. 
10. And many more ideas and information. 

Now to make this come true I need funding. I need money for programming / Constructing website and mobile app. All that has to do with the website like SEO optimization and so on.. 
This platform should be in different languages. 

Venue owners and artists should be able to make a profile and upload their events , music , pictures,.. 

Setting all this up and connecting everything is a really big job. And to make a website that functions well and is userfriendly is not an easy job.  

I truly believe this will help artists and organisers to create more opportunities so we all can experience the fine art of music of all sorts in this city.  
I organise live music events every saturday and constantly people ask me where to go because there is no easy way of finding all these nice places Barcelona has to offer. 

We need a platform only dedicated to Live Music in Barcelona and with your support we will soon have that. I already started building with the little means I have as u can check on www.madclubmusic.com 

Venue owners can already make a profile and upload their events. Rest of the site is not working yet and clearly the site is still under construction. But have a look to get an idea of what we are up too. I already thank the people who are currently helping me with this. 

I really dream of doing what I love and dedicate my time completely to my passion which is live music. I will be so gratefull if you can help me make this dream come true. And in this way help me to help all the talented artists in and around Barcelona.

If you share the same opinion than I then please share this project with all your friends thrue facebook, twitter , email ,...  Have a musical day!

ESPAGNOL / SPANISH 

Hola, Mi nombre es Michel Vermeulen. Yo vivo en Barcelona y soy un apasionado de la música en directo y estoy organisando eventos desde hace 2 anos como puedes ver en mi pagina faccebook: https://www.facebook.com/madclubbarcelona/

Ahora en Barcelona no me parece una buena guía para todo lo que tiene que ver con la música en directo. Es difícil encontrar sesiones de improvisación, micrófonos abiertos, pequeños conciertos alternativos y créanme que hay muchos. Cuando Google Music Live Barcelona Allways se obtiene sitios que hablan de donde se puede comer, dormir, y tal vez hablar sobre 5 bares que hacen música en vivo. Los músicos tienen un tiempo difícil encontrar conciertos de jugar, y los dueños de bares tienen dificultades para llegar a los clientes. Nosotros que todas las horas sueltas para encontrar información y, al final, se dan por vencidos. Esto es una vergüenza, con la tecnología de hoy deberíamos tener esta información dentro de 5 minutos.

Para crear más oportunidades para los artistas en Barcelona y que sea más fácil para la gente local y turistas para encontrar todos estos lugares alternativos Quiero crear una plataforma sobre la música en directo en Barcelona. Yo lo llamo una plataforma porque quiero incluir:

1. Calendario de eventos que ocurren grandes y pequeños
2. Lista de lugares - bares que organizan música en vivo
3. Lista de artistas locales.
4. Listado de Escuelas de música, tallers, etc
5. Lista de tiendas de música
6. Lista de los estudios de grabación.
7. Información sobre interpretativas de la calle, donde, leyes, ..
8. boletines, entrevistas con bandas locales
9. Crear una aplicación móvil para encontrar música en vivo.
10. Y muchas más ideas e información.

Ahora para hacer ese sueño en realidad necesito financiación. Necesito dinero para la programación / La construcción de sitio web y aplicación móvil. Todo lo que tiene que ver con el sitio web como la optimización SEO y así sucesivamente ..
Esta plataforma debe estar en diferentes idiomas.

los dueños del lugar y los artistas deberían ser capaces de hacer un perfil y subir sus eventos, música, imágenes, ..

Configuración de todo esto y conexión de todo es un trabajo realmente grande. Y para hacer un sitio web que funciona bien y es fácil de usar, no es un trabajo fácil.

Realmente creo que esto ayudará a los artistas y organizadores para crear más oportunidades para que todos podamos experimentar el arte de la música de todo tipo en esta ciudad.
Organizo eventos de música en vivo todos los sábados y constantemente la gente me pregunta a dónde ir porque no hay una manera fácil de encontrar todos estos lugares agradables que ofrece Barcelona.

Necesitamos una plataforma única dedicada a la música en directo en Barcelona y con su apoyo, pronto tendremos que. Ya empecé a construir con los pocos medios que tengo como u puede comprobar en www.madclubmusic.com

los dueños del lugar ya pueden hacer un perfil y subir sus eventos. Resto del sitio no está funcionando todavía y claramente el sitio se encuentra en construcción. Pero echar un vistazo para tener una idea de lo que somos demasiado. Ya gracias a las personas que me están ayudando actualmente con esto.

Realmente sueño de hacer lo que amo y dedico mi tiempo completo a mi pasión que es la música en vivo. Voy a ser tan agradecido si usted puede ayudarme a hacer realidad este sueño. Y de esta manera me ayudan a ayudar a todos los artistas con talento en Barcelona y alrededores.

Si comparte la misma opinión que yo, por favor compartir este proyecto con todos sus amigos thrue Facebook, Twitter, correo electrónico, ... Tener un día musical!

FRENCH / FRANCAIS  / FRANCES
Salut, Mon nom est Michel Vermeulen. Je vis à Barcelone et je suis passioné de musique live et j'organise déjà depuis plus que 2 ans des événements comme vous pouvez voir sur ma page facebook: https://www.facebook.com/madclubbarcelona/


Maintenant, à Barcelone, je ne trouve pas de bon guide pour tout ce qui touche à la musique live. Il est difficile de trouver des jam sessions, micros ouverts, petits concerts alternatifs et croyez-moi il y en a beaucoup. Lorsque vous demandez à Google "musique live barcelona" vous obtenez souvent une liste interminable d'endroits où manger, dormir, et peut-être 5 bars avec de la musique live. Les musiciens ont du mal à trouver des concerts où jouer, et les propriétaires de bars ont du mal à atteindre les clients. Nous avons tous un peu de temps pour chercher, mais quand les infos ne concordent pas, on finit tôt ou tard par abandonner. C'est une honte, avec la technologie d'aujourd'hui nous devrions avoir cette information à moins de 5 min.

Pour créer plus d'opportunités pour les artistes à Barcelone et de mettre en contact les populations locales et les touristes pour trouver tous ces endroits, je veux créer une plate-forme de musique en direct à Barcelone. Je l'ai appelée plate-forme parce que je veux inclure:

1. Calendrier des événements en cours, petits et grands
2. Liste des lieux - bars qui organisent la musique live
3. Liste des artistes locaux.
4. Liste des écoles de musique, des cours, etc
5. Liste des magasins de musique
6. Liste des studios d'enregistrement.
7. Informations sur les droits du musicien pour jouer dans la rue, sur scène...
8. Lettres d'information, des interviews de groupes locaux...
9. Créer une application mobile pour trouver la musique live.
10. Et bien d'autres idées et d'informations.

Maintenant, pour faire ce qui se réalise que je dois trouver un financement. Je besoin d'apport pour la programmation / site web. Créer l'application mobile. Tout ce qui touche au site comme l'optimisation SEO et ainsi de suite ..
Cette plate-forme devrait être disponible dans toutes les langues.

Les propriétaires de salles et bars musicaux, et les artistes devraient être en mesure de créer un profil et mettre en ligne leurs événements, musique, photos, ..

Régler et mettre en ligne tout celà représente beaucoup de travail. Et créer un site Web qui fonctionne bien et facile d'utilisation, ce n'est pas une tâche facile.

Je crois vraiment que celà va aider les artistes et les organisateurs pour créer plus d'opportunités que nous pouvons tous expérimenter l'art de la musique de toutes sortes dans cette ville.
J'organise des concerts tous les samedis et constamment les gens me demandent où aller parce qu'il n'y a pas jamais de moyen immédiat de trouver tous ces endroits particuliers à Barcelone.

Nous avons besoin d'une plate-forme uniquement dédiée à la musique live à Barcelone et avec votre soutien, nous allons bientôt l'avoir. J'ai déjà commencé à la construire avec de petits moyens, vous pouvez le vérifier www.madclubmusic.com

Les propriétaires de salles et bars musicaux peuvent déjà créer un profil et mettre leurs événements en ligne. Les autres options prévues pour le site ne fonctionnent pas encore, clairement le site est encore en construction. Mais jetez un coup d'oeil pour vous faire une idée. Je remercie déjà les personnes qui ont commencé à m'offrir leur soutien.

Je rêve vraiment de faire ce que je l'aime et consacre mon temps complètement à ma passion qui est la musique live. Je serai donc reconnaissant si vous pouvez m'aider à faire de ce rêve une réalité. Et de cette manière, aidez-moi à aider tous les artistes talentueux à Barcelone et ses alentours.


Si vous partagez la même opinion que moi alors s'il vous plaît partager ce projet avec tous vos amis par le biais de facebook, twitter, email, ... Et poursuivez votre belle journée musicale!
story_txt: Versiones abajo en espagnol y frances. Il y a l'explication en bas en francais et espagnol. ENGLISH / INGLES / ANGLAIS Hi , My name is Michel Vermeulen.  I am living in Barcelona and I am passionate about live music and have been organising events for more than 2 years. Check out my Facebook page also: https://www.facebook.com/madclubbarcelona/Now in Barcelona I do not find a good guide to all that has to do with live music. It is hard to find jam sessions , open mics , little alternative concerts and believe me there are many. When you google live music barcelona allways you get sites that talk about where you can eat , sleep , and maybe they talk about 5 bars that do live music.  Musicians have a hard time finding gigs to play , and bar owners have a hard time to reach clients. We all loose hours to find information and in the end we give up. This is a shame , with todays technology we should have this info within 5 min. To create more opportunities for artists in Barcelona and make it easier for local people and tourists to find all these alternative places I want to create a platform about live music in Barcelona. I call it a platform because I want to include : 1. Calender of events going on big and small2. List of venues - bars that organise live music 3. List of Local Artists . 4. List of Music Schools, workshops, etc5. List of Music shops 6. List of Recording studios. 7. Information on street performing , where, laws,..8. Newsletters, interviews with local bands 9. Create a mobile app to find live music. 10. And many more ideas and information. Now to make this come true I need funding. I need money for programming / Constructing website and mobile app. All that has to do with the website like SEO optimization and so on.. This platform should be in different languages. Venue owners and artists should be able to make a profile and upload their events , music , pictures,.. Setting all this up and connecting everything is a really big job. And to make a website that functions well and is userfriendly is not an easy job.  I truly believe this will help artists and organisers to create more opportunities so we all can experience the fine art of music of all sorts in this city.  I organise live music events every saturday and constantly people ask me where to go because there is no easy way of finding all these nice places Barcelona has to offer. We need a platform only dedicated to Live Music in Barcelona and with your support we will soon have that. I already started building with the little means I have as u can check on www.madclubmusic.com Venue owners can already make a profile and upload their events. Rest of the site is not working yet and clearly the site is still under construction. But have a look to get an idea of what we are up too. I already thank the people who are currently helping me with this. I really dream of doing what I love and dedicate my time completely to my passion which is live music. I will be so gratefull if you can help me make this dream come true. And in this way help me to help all the talented artists in and around Barcelona.If you share the same opinion than I then please share this project with all your friends thrue facebook, twitter , email ,...  Have a musical day!ESPAGNOL / SPANISH Hola, Mi nombre es Michel Vermeulen. story:
MEET THE TYLER RAY BAND:

Tyler Ray (Vocals / Guitar / Songwriting)

 

Petter Ekedahl (Lead Guitar)

 

Ck Corral (Drums)

 

HOW MUCH DO WE NEED AND WHY:

Our goal is to reach $12,000. This will cover everything from studio time, paying our team, gear rentals, perk fulfillment, hired guns, and everything in between. 

 

WHAT DOES THIS MEAN TO THE TEAM?

Tyler Ray has been waiting over 15 years for an opportunity such as this and refuses to let it slip by.

Ck has worked his way up the ladder and put everything he has into showing the world what his long days and longer nights have been spent working toward.

Petter has moved all the way across the world to find his way in this crazy music world and has finally caught his big break with this EP.

 

MEET OUR RECORDING TEAM:

Dave Isaac-

3 time Grammy Award-winning Producer and Mix Engineer Dave Isaac teaches our Music Production course. Dave has worked with such notable artists as Bruno Mars, Prince, The New Power Generation, Michael Jackson, Eric Clapton, Marcus Miller, Whitney Houston, Luther Vandross, Madonna, and Stevie Wonder to name a few. He has worked in the Film & Television industry, on films that include Mel Gibson and Danny Glover, Chris Rock, Bernie Mac, Samuel L. Jackson, Matthew Perry, and The Wayans Brothers (Damon, Marlon, and Keenan-Ivory).

 

Barry Rudolph- 

Barry teaches Project Studio Design. He is a graduate of California State University, Long Beach with a B.S. Industrial Technology (Electronics) and from Santa Ana College with an Associate Arts, Electronics. He is also an Avid Certified Instructor of Pro Tools.

As a recording engineer/mixer, he has worked on over 30 gold and platinum record winners. He has recorded and/or mixed albums by Lynyrd Skynyrd, Hall & Oates, Pat Benatar, Rod Stewart, Keith Moon, Mick Jagger, Waylon Jennings, The Corrs, and also worked with producers Steve Cropper, Oliver Leiber, Tom Dowd, Rick Rubin, Jerry Fuller and many more.

 

 

T.J. Helmrich-

MI instructor TJ Helmerich has worked with some of the biggest names in the business as both a recording engineer and a musician. Behind the console, TJ is Grammy Nominated with credits including “Friday DVD” Stanley Clarke, Dweezil Zappa, the Neville Bro’s, Ron Wood to name a few. His brand of eight-finger guitar playing (showcased on 4 albums along side Dennis Chambers, Gary Willis, Brett Garsed, Scott Kinsey released on Shrapnel records) has brought him international acclaim. T.J is also an exceptional vocalist and has featured his playing and singing skills on tour with fellow alumnus Paul Gilbert (Mr.Big), Zappa plays Zappa, Eddie Jobson (UK) and more. TJ is an “MI Legacy” instructor having 27 years teaching experience under his belt.

 

THE COMPANIES THAT SEE THE VISION:

None of this would be possible without the backbreaking support we've received from the amazing companies that continue to change the game and allow us to be a part of it.

Line 6, Empire Ears, EMG, GHS, Anatomy of Sound, Soultone Cymbals, Techra Drumsticks, Telefunken, Foam Core Print, SKB, PRS, and Warmachine Marketing.

We love and appreciate everyone who has stepped up to the plate and brought this campaign to fruition. It's no secret that a record is like a baby to anyone who pours their heart and soul into it, and as they say, it truly does take a village.

 

The Perks:

We have some truly amazing perks that have been provided by our amazing sponsors (listed above) Please see the perk section to select your favorite perk! Speaking from experience, there's no feeling like supporting the art that lives in the hearts of those around us.

NOTE: We are unable to ship outside the US however, we have created a special perk just for those outside the US.

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you're unable to support this campaign financially, you're not out of luck! There are still many ways you can contribute, that will cost you nothing at all. These simple things are as follows:  

1. SHARE this campaign

2. VERBALLY tell your friends and family

3. WATCH our music videos

4. FOLLOW us on all social media platforms at @TheTylerRayBand

We love Y'all. 

-The Tyler Ray Band

story:
My name is Debbie Danbrook, and I create Everyday Wellness with my Healing Music.

  • My campaign is to raise funds to launch my new community Wellness Website.
  • I have a successful Website called Healingmusic.com and this new Website expands my vision from Music to Everyday Wellness, Meditations, Guest Speakers, Healing Words and Visuals.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the plan:

  • I am looking to raise $3000 Canadian to help with the launch of my new Wellness Website and to work on promotions and marketing with a New York based management company.
  • I have two new recordings of Healing Music and you can be the first to have these recordings. Funds raised will go towards the costs of promoting my new Wellness Website with Facebook Advertising, Search Engine Optimization and Social Media marketing.
  • The new Wellness Website will have lots of visual content with music and guest speakers.
  • I am also offering personalized music, created just for you. We can have a Skype call together and I will play and record my Shakuhachi Flute meditation and send it to you.
  • I can also create a personal Mantra just for you. My personal Mantra is "Breathe in Love, Breathe in Light".
  • You get the opportunity to join a Wellness community of like minded people who want to share beautiful poetry and music and create Everyday Wellness. You also get to choose wonderful perks, some that are only available through this special Indiegogo fundraising campaign.

The Impact:

Your contribution will help me launch a community website built for you with the focus on Music, Meditation, Everyday Wellness, Healing and Spirituality.

  • The world needs Everyday Wellness. We all need a place to refresh and recharge.
  • I have dedicated the last 20+ years to bringing Healing Music into people's lives.
  • Healingmusic.com has produced many of the popular recordings that are played everyday in Spas, Healing Centres, Hospitals, Wellness Retreats, and many other places worldwide.

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Tell your friends about Healingmusic.com and share the music with your friends.

Indiegogo share tools are available right on this website to help share my story.

The new Wellness Website will have lots of visual content with music and guest speakers.
I am also offering personalized music, created just for you. We can have a Skype call together and I will play and record my Shakuhachi Flute meditation and send it to you.
I can also create a personal Mantra just for you. My personal Mantra is "Breathe in Love, Breathe in Light".
You get the opportunity to join a Wellness community of like minded people who want to share beautiful poetry and music and create Everyday Wellness. You also get to choose wonderful perks, some that are only available through this special Indiegogo fundraising campaign.


The Impact:
Your contribution will help me launch a community website built for you with the focus on Music, Meditation, Everyday Wellness, Healing and Spirituality.

The world needs Everyday Wellness. We all need a place to refresh and recharge.
I have dedicated the last 20+ years to bringing Healing Music into people's lives.
Healingmusic.com has produced many of the popular recordings that are played everyday in Spas, Healing Centres, Hospitals, Wellness Retreats, and many other places worldwide.


 
Other Ways You Can Help:

Tell your friends about Healingmusic.com and share the music with your friends.
Indiegogo share tools are available right on this website to help share my story.

story:
Overview

Hi Sub-Radio family,

2019 has been a year of really incredible firsts for us. We started it by flying to Los Angeles to record the collection of songs that would become Dog Years, the EP that we’ve been tirelessly promoting and touring on for the last nine months. It was the first time we’d worked with a producer, the first time we’d gone on a real tour (!), and the first time that we all made the scary, crazy, exhilarating decision to make Sub-Radio our full-time job.

DC9, Washington, D.C., July 2019 (Photo by Kurt Heyde)

We ended the year huddled in a carriage house in rural New Jersey, sequestered for 10 days as we tweaked and refined the songs we’re going to share with you this spring. This EP is going to take us in some new and challenging directions, sonically and lyrically. We can feel the color palette we paint with expanding. And honestly, these songs mean more to us than anything we’ve created so far.

We’re attacking 2020 with a vengeance. We’ll be heading to SXSW in March, touring for most of the year, and investing in PR and marketing to get this music in front of the world. It’s an insane amount of work, and we wouldn’t have it any other way.

Of course, this all comes with a lot of costs. As a truly independent band, there are so many hurdles to success -- and a big one is money. Our community of fans and friends has gotten us this far, and we're asking for your help one last time in 2020.

What We Need & What You Get

Specifically, we need to raise $12,000 to support all our activities this year. That includes a portion of the costs of recording, mixing, and mastering our entire EP (~$9,000); producing a music video for a single off the EP (~$2,000); and paying the incredible people who design our shirts, take our photos, and pitch us to the press. Even if we hit that goal, we'll still be digging into our own pockets throughout the year. The music industry is expensive as hell, y'all.

Needless to say, we can't do this on our own. So your help is absolutely critical to helping us succeed. 

We’ve done a little math — if all the people who came to a Sub-Radio show in 2019 gave just a little bit, we’d never have to ask for money again. We can get there, but only with your help.

To thank you for your support, we'll be sending personalized and signed copies of the EP, custom stickers specifically for our Indiegogo backers, Sub-Radio t-shirts, credits in our liner notes, and a lot of other exciting rewards. Check out the full perks list to see what makes sense for you.

Photo by Kurt Heyde, 2019

Spread the Love!

We know some people can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! You can feel free to donate any amount you like with or without a reward. Just by spreading the word about our campaign, you can help us reach our goal. We believe in the power of community :)

Love,

Sub-Radio

story:
I started playing at a young age, and quickly found a love for playing guitar and singing. Many different styles have influenced me over the years. From Country, Metal, Rock, to Punk, I’ve played it all and still listen to a lot of it to date.

I have always been fond of the old Country music icons like Randy Travis, Conway Twitty, Don Williams, and Johnny Cash. With a resonating tone in my voice that is reminiscent of those giants in music, I carry on that deep Baritone bellowing country vocal sound within the music I play and write.

My original songs have a style that mixes a number of those various influences, capturing the essence of those Country roots. My songs are very personal and there is a lot of emotion that I pour into them. Living through those moments of desperation, loneliness, and heartache, the moments of joy, success, and hope too… We all have our share of both sides of the coin.

I am planning on a full studio recording & production of 11 of my songs. I've always done quick live sessions with an acoustic guitar, and that just does not do these songs justice. I get some amazing feedback from my music, and it always boils down to "I wish there was a studio recording, that would be on my daily playlist for sure..." type of reactions. I have the amazing Engineer and Producer David Ponder ready, once there are funds for the project.

Being able to get these tracks done by a true professional would fulfill a huge goal of mine. I could then reach the masses, via Spotify, Apple Music, Soundcloud, Facebook, etc. I can, more importantly, get more gigs which is hard to do without a good recording of my music.

I will need $10,000.00 to fund the project. That goes toward pre-production, recording, engineering, producing, cover rt,etc. I am hopeful that I can get 1000 CD's made for merch as well.Basically, the whole ShaBang!

  • I have some very perks in mind:
  • hand written thank you notes
  • Professional photos w/ personal note 5x7
  • original hand written lyric sheets for a song(s) of your choice
  • Story telling of the songs origin and meaning
  • Live Recording of a rehearsal session, just me and my dog
  • thank you list in the liner notes of the CD
  • In-Home Concerts(dates and times TBD)

If for some reason I do not meet or exceed the final 10k goal, I will use what funds I do get to make as much of the recordings as I can. Perhaps an EP will come out of it. Perhaps only a couple of singles. It is all up to you all, and me of course to push this as far as I can.

I have been struggling for a long time on my own trying to make this happen.  Old & rickety vehicles break down, Appliances on the fritz, childcare financial needs, you name it. I unfortunately don't make enough between working Full Time and playing gigs, to save and get this done on my own.  This is why I'm asking you to help me make this happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you yourself cannot contribute financially, don't worry. Send this to a friend, or 10 friends, or all of your friends. Chances are one of them will thank you for it. I believe in my music and it's ability to reach in and make you feel what I'm singing about.

Please please please, use the Indiegogo share tools when you share this, so it gets directed to my Campaign page.

story:
It's Happening!!!

Oh God! We've been working on this bad boi for more than a year and we're just about ready to release our debut album "Everybody's Worried About Us." The songs have been written, most of the tracks have been recorded and we are in post-production, mixing and mastering the 10-song record. We can't wait to share it with the world, and will release it officially on March 28 at our album release party at Club Bohemia (8 p.m.) with our pals Linnea's Garden, Happy Little Clouds, Eye Witness and OroborO. 

  • Songs to release include Baptism by Walden Pond, Witchcraft, Colorado River professionally mastered beyond its "On the Radio" EP release, and more!

  • This record will feature Jina Moran on drums, Ben Kotce on atmospheric electronic harmonica and killer bass by Mike Hayden (also of the pop-punk band Allison & Moon).

How You Can Help 

We're starting this campaign two months before the album release to ask our fans for a bit of help by pre-ordering the album now, today. Your funds will go toward helping us with recording and equipment costs, as well as our printing costs for making the actual CD packages. If we raise enough funds, we would also love to make vinyl releases and will offer those at our future shows! 

  • We've set a goal of $1,000 with flexible funding, in the hopes that we will raise more but even if it's less, all funds go toward ensuring this album release is a success.

  • Check out our pre-ordering structure - you can support Tysk Tysk Task directly by pre-ordering and also receiving our personalized art, posters and lyric booklets with designs that have directly inspired our aesthetic and music.

Our Hopes

We are femme-fronted rock, with the hopes that our music empowers and smashes the patriarchy in its small way, while creating relatable songs that inspire others to do the same. Samantha Hartsel and Jina Moran have poured their hearts and souls into this band's formation, and have their bandmates Ben Kotce and Mike Hayden to thank for their continue support and commitment to that mission.

  • We stand for breaking the stigma of mental health issues. Check out the band's tell-all feature in the Lowell Spin on the subject (surrounding the focus of the band's formation): https://lowellspin.com/2019/12/formed-from-rock...                                                        

  • Listen to our music on Spotify, Bandcamp and anywhere else to get a sense of our style and how this album is going to sound! Our single "Yeah, Right" is streaming everywhere, and can also be purchased for download on Bandcamp here: https://tysktysktask.bandcamp.com/album/yeah-right

Risks & Challenges

No matter how much money is raised in this project, the funds will go directly to ensuring TTTs' music gets out there. We are still working on building our sound and following, having just completed our first tour around New England with TIFFY in January 2020. This money will not go into our pockets, or to buy nicer instruments. We are committed to finishing this album by the end of March and getting it into your hands, no matter the challenges. 

  • Equipment: We may have some challenges in our DIY setup, though we've personally invested in microphones and cables and other equipment and editing programs to make our recording studio as solid as possible, for now. Our hope is that from here, we'll have enough of a foundation to effortlessly release future albums and EPs.

story:
Hey there! We're making a Full Length Children's CD!

The Story: Our names are Fariss and Eva Ryan and we have been working with the children of Weaverville, CA for almost three years now. From our kids Sunday School lessons, we and the children have written and recorded 10+ tracks of fantastically catchy songs!
You can listen to a sample of the new music is in the video above. 

We've done this sort of thing before here, but we've discovered how to do more with less. 
You can listen to our last project "Stowaways EP" on iTunes, and Youtube. 

Vision:
Our vision is to release 100+ free hard copy albums to the children in our church community and town. To do this there are financial hoops to jump through like copyrighting, mixing and mastering, production...etc. 
This is where you can partner with us to get the CDs into the hands of the children! 
There are some fantastical perks available to those who donate to the Cartwheels project!
You can check them out on the sidebar.
 

What We Need & What You Get

We have three different goals that we'd like to reach (All prices are close estimates): 

$550 Copyright ($100), (Mastering $200), ($200 CDs), ($50 Indiegogo).
$650 Copyright ($100), (Mastering $200), ($300 CDs +Lyric Packets), ($50 Indiegogo).

$700 Copyright ($100), (Mastering $200), ($300 CDs +Lyric Packets), ($50 Posters) ($50 Indiegogo).

What you get: 
1. The satisfaction of knowing children have a CD in their hands that they helped create.
2. Digital downloads, Physical CDs, and Posters.
We are doing more with less on this project. Although our former project was expensive we're cutting costs especially in the area of rewards. We know that you'll enjoy the music that we've been creating, because there is twice as much as last time! 
 

Risks & Challenges

The only risk that we have is to not raise enough money to cover this project. 
We've recorded the album and it is about to be mixed and mastered. 

This mixing and mastering process could take slightly longer than anticipated, but it shouldn't take long. We've done this before and we have all of our ducks in a row. Let's do this!
 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share the link to this campaign on social media and in emails!
    (Weekly support would be great). Indiegogo has great share tools!
  • Give us a follow on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/FarissandEvaMusic/
  • Monthly Support Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/farissandevaryan.

story:
Saltbox Session at Luthier's Coop coming soon! filmed by Cait Shea

https://oldflame.bandcamp.com/releases

 

Calling community, friends, family, activists, fellow makers, and believers in independent art making! We, Emma Ayres and Sam Perry are in the process of recording our debut 7-track EP as OLD FLAME. We are so excited to share this project with you!

This EP was written during the election of Donald Trump as an active form of protest as an effort to process our anger, sadness and horror. We recognize that having the ability to speak up and actively dissent is a privilege. We don't take this privilege lightly. Our EP is in the final stages of production at Amity Recording Studios under the artistic genius of Chris Kerrigan of Bella's Bartok. We are nearing the finish line and we'll keep you in the loop with photos, videos and little snippets and scraps of our process.

IT TAKES A VALLEY TO RAISE A BAND...

We are so grateful to be making music in the Pioneer Valley, where music seems to pour from every corner like spring sap. Shout out to our fellow musicians in the DIY scene. This is where a profound sense of raw heart lives. We firmly believe in protecting DIY spaces, basements, garages, living rooms, attics etc.

In donating to this campaign, you are supporting a budding band that strives to conscientiously employ our craft as an arsenal of hope, unapologetic objection to fascism in all its forms, and a vehicle for community organizing. In donating to this campaign, you are forever a part of the Old Flame family!

The whole project costs $2,000. As a newborn band we have a lot of costs to get us up and running. We want to be intentional every step of the way. We want to pay our collaborators every step of the way. Your donation covers:

1. Paying Chris Kerrigan for recording and producing our 7 track EP

2. Paying the other visual artists who have helped us

2. Printing hundreds of CDs

3. T-shirt design & printing

4. And....a little summer tour!!!

Perks include, rad t-shirts, posters, your own copy of "The Wolf In The Heather EP," eternal worship, personal house shows...etc. We understand that money is not of the essence. Every little bit counts!

We are eternally grateful for your support of this project. Thank you for believing in us!

Stay tuned  at https://www.facebook.com/officialoldflame/

 

ALL OUR LOVE.

 

Yours Truly,

OLD FLAME

9 of Cups (wishes fulfilled)
