story:
With much excitement, Night Tree has updated our fundraising goal to $16,000 by Oct 1st, an additional $5,000 to the current $11,000 we have raised since April which exceeded our goal by $1,651 (114% of our original goal of $9,450).

 

Why $5,000?  We ask this because people from our community have not had a chance to buy the album yet and we want to keep the online option open through Indiegogo before the actual release.  Before we started fundraising, people were, understandably, unsure if we would be successful in raising the money, make it to the studio to record, and finally get it mastered and printed. However, now we have crossed them all off our list!  We did it!!

 

We are aiming to raise an additional $5,000 because we want YOU to pre-order the album, so we can share it with exponentially more people.  For those who plan on purchasing the album once it's released, we specifically ask you to PRE-ORDER the album so that you can be a part of our fundraiser and help us spread our music far beyond the walls of Facebook, our mailing list, tour locations AND enable us to hire a PR company that will connect us with dozens of networks across the country (again) EXPONENTIALLY spreading and distributing our music.

 

By simply PRE-ORDERING the Night Tree album, you can not only get a beautifully crafted album made by familiar faces, making real music in a live setting -- By pre-ordering the Night Tree album you have automatically contributed and funded the making of this album -- and finally by pre-ordering this album you can without sharing a single Facebook post, forwarding a single email, or even telling a friend, you will help spread our music to national media outlets across the country including radio stations, magazines, blogs, and more.

 

We have been working with Jake Schaefer at Copy Cats Media- a professional quality and an affordable price.  We are working with Kari Estrin from Nashville, TN for PR in the fall.  This is where the majority of the 5k raised will go towards and will allow us to send our music to radio stations across the country, to national media outlets, online media, and more.

 

After having multiple conversations with professionals, producers, PR’s reps, friends, and relatives, we decided it was most cost effective to hire a PR rep for two months in the fall than deal with the costs, rules, and logistics of a record label.  For mastering we used a great professional, John Baker, who did a beautiful job on our final mixes and we are grateful for his work on the album.  Finally, for album design, we decided to use our Night Tree logo made by Mac Talmadge, a generous donation of his time and talent to the band.

 

We are hustling, but we need your help.  Back in the spring,  pre-ordering the Night Tree album meant making it happen.  NOW pre-ordering the Night Tree ALBUM means bringing it to the rest of the world.  Help us spread our joy and love from this music with others.

 

We are grateful to Indiegogo for hosting our ALBUM funding as we have received donations from over 145 backers, giving us a total of 2,761 visits to our page, from 6 different countries around the world including the United States, the United Kingdom, Canada, Sweden, Germany, and Australia.

 

Pre-order Night Tree’s debut ALBUM today! Thank you for your time and generosity in taking this journey with us.

 

With gratitude,

Night Tree

 

ABOUT:

Rooted in original works spanning from the Celtic world, sextet Night Tree creates original music that borrows from the Swedish, Baltic, Jewish and American folk tradition. Interestingly devoid of a chordal instrument such as piano or guitar, Night Tree includes the dark resonance of the cello, baritone saxophone, and cajón meeting with the drones of accordion and intertwining with the soaring melodies of dueling fiddles. Contrast is created with the replacement of the baritone saxophone with the soprano saxophone, adding another fiddle-like melodic instrument to the mix. Drawing from an unusually diverse mix of musical backgrounds, Night Tree has discovered a sound both colorfully and resonantly different while delving into the realm of harmonies and rhythm that range from edgy to inviting, both unheard of and timeless.


Night Tree, named the 2016-2017 Wildcard Honors Ensemble at the New England Conservatory (NEC), first began in a practice room starting with just fiddle, cajon, and accordion. It quickly expanded to include an additional fiddle player, cellist, and baritone saxophone. This creative and spiritually connected band held early rehearsals in complete darkness to have an unobscured focus on developing their musical and aural connection. These rehearsals guided them as they targeted each other’s individual sounds. Duos and trios formed within the ensemble, as well as building and molding the sound of the band. Rehearsals consisted from free improvisations to traditional Irish jig-to-reel sets and everything in between, as can be heard in their arrangement ‘Ships’, which surrounds two traditional tunes about actual ocean vessels with improvisational sections that depict a shipwreck.

Night Tree’s six members each bring a unique and varied background to the group. Fiddler Lily Honigberg grew up in a musical family in Washington, D.C, and is currently studying classical violin at NEC with Lucy Chapman. At NEC, she is active in the Contemporary Improvisation department, mentored by Ran Blake and Anthony Coleman, and has spent previous summers playing fiddle throughout Ireland with Irish musicians such as Martin Hayes. Sunniva Brynnel, a native of Gothenburg, Sweden, is a current Jazz Composition major at NEC. After studying Irish/Gaelic singing in Ireland, she received a BA in Jazz Composition with First Class honors from Leeds College of Music. Saxophonist Zach Mayer, currently studying Contemporary Improvisation at NEC, has toured both the US and Europe as a member of Zion80, an 11-piece Jewish Afrobeat band, and is known for his performances with loop pedal, voice, and saxophone. He is also music director of Kahal Braira, a Jewish congregation in Cambridge. Cellist McKinley James grew up performing at contradances across the Northeast with her folk band The Irregulars; she has studied with cello-fiddler Tristan Clarridge and currently studies classical cello with Yeesun Kim at NEC. Fiddler Chris Overholser is a self-taught improviser from Boston and is studying jazz, traditional folk, bluegrass, Brazilian, and experimental music at NEC. Percussionist, multimedia artist, and interdisciplinary collaborator Julian Loida has performed at the Spoleto Music Festival USA, the National Orchestral Institute, and the Chautauqua Music Festival, and also presents his own social-justice oriented works incorporating the Afro-Cuban and Afro-Brazilian traditions.

Though each member of Night Tree originates from a different world, the six members have come together to create something new and unique specifically to their instrumentation and musical voices, attracting new audiences and connecting folk music lovers, café radio junkies, jazz enthusiasts, free-improvisation cliques, and beyond.
story_txt: With much excitement, Night Tree has updated our fundraising goal to $16,000 by Oct 1st, an additional $5,000 to the current $11,000 we have raised since April which exceeded our goal by $1,651 (114% of our original goal of $9,450). Why $5,000?  We ask this because people from our community have not had a chance to buy the album yet and we want to keep the online option open through Indiegogo before the actual release.  Before we started fundraising, people were, understandably, unsure if we would be successful in raising the money, make it to the studio to record, and finally get it mastered and printed. story:
Chantae Cann: #UrBrave is Beautiful :)

Hello good peoples!  As some of you all may know, I have been working diligently on my debut solo album! While that process is yet in progress, I’ve had the immense desire to not only document the artistic side of the journey, but I wanted a chance to share a more personal side of my story.  I was presented with an amazing opportunity that would allow me to film my 1st biographical documentary entitled, "The Beauty of it All”, directed by DeShaun Davis, produced by Jay Mills.  Filming this documentary has been incredibly moving as well as immensely educational. We unveil some pretty tough matters of the heart as well as shed some light on a cause that many may not be aware of.   

Several years ago my mother was diagnosed with Huntington's Disease.  I’ve witnessed firsthand the impact of this gradually progressive disease on my mother as well as several members of her family.  Because there is no current cure for Huntington’s along with the fact that it is genetically inherited, I knew that eventually it would be time for me to get tested.  Though I wasn’t necessarily looking forward to learning that I will more than likely experience onset of HD at some point in my lifetime, I’ve chosen to remain hopeful.  I’m reminded that I have a voice!  Not solely for singing or yelling at the person who cut me off in traffic,  but I have a voice to uplift, encourage and give hope to those that may be facing unthinkable circumstances of their own.   


But how does one face a terminal disease?  My answer to that is quite simple.  Process, feel, cry, get mad, cry some more, eat some Ben & Jerry’s and then BE BRAVE! When you are truly BRAVE in the midst of life’s toughest trenches it will serve as one of the most BEAUTIFUL exchanges you could ever make.  UrBRAVE is truly BEAUTIFUL, and now it’s up to us to let the world know that their BRAVE is BEAUTIFUL too!

Your financial support will allow us to:  

1. Raise awareness about Huntington's Disease, support Huntington's research and donate towards ongoing treatment efforts. 

2. Donate to MusiCares and participate in worldwide health & welfare awareness.

3. Launch a nationwide #UrBrave Tour to encourage those that may possibly be facing a terminal disease or any type of  unforeseen circumstance.  Aid in raising funds for those in need in the cities that are impacted the greatest.

4. Release the documentary, “The Beauty of it All”, to festivals and private screenings to showcase the BEAUTY of true BRAVERY. 

From the bottom of my heart, I truly .::THANK YOU::. 

-ChantaeCann

story:
Through hard work and the support of many believers, the Earlville Opera House has made a wonderful journey in the past 45 years.

The once grand theater, that was on the verge of demolition, has made it all the way back. Today it is a venue that charms national performers to the delight of enthusiastic, appreciative audiences who travel miles for an evening in Earlville.

This campaign will complete our journey into the 21st century by adding heat and air conditioning to our historic theater. With this piece of our 45-year renovation in place, we will be able to expand our concert season to 12 months with heat for the cold months and comfort for our patrons in the heat of summer.

Creating a climate controlled environment will not only enhance our programming, but contribute to our mission to preserve and protect this historic landmark by preventing extreme temperature swings in the grand auditorium.

How You Can Help

Thanks to the John Ben Snow Foundation and the New York State Council on the Arts, the Earlville Opera House has received nearly $23,000 in funding, but we are still approximately $275,000 away from successfully hosting world-class entertainment on its historic stage year 'round. That's the cost to heat the theater in winter and cool it on those sweltering summer nights.

Once again we are reaching out to our friends who value the Earlville Opera House. We are asking you to consider a gift or a pledge to the Four Seasons campaign that will allow us to make our jewel of a theater into a 12-month facility. 

The Benefits

With our current six month auditorium schedule each year, we welcome numerous touring professional performers and the 8,000 patrons they attract from far and wide. By adding heat, thus allowing us to increase programming to 12 months a year, the benefit will be greater attendance numbers while offering more opportunities for talented artists to perform. The benefits to our area will be direct and noticeable resulting in an improved quality of cultural life and a positive economic impact for local business.

In the sweltering summers, the addition of air conditioning will produce a much more comfortable experience for audiences and artists alike. Finally, the lasting benefit to the auditorium of this fine historic landmark will be the protection and preservation from damage due to uncontrolled temperature and humidity.

Earlville Opera House is a non-profit 501(c)3, which makes your gift support tax deductible to the full extent of the law. We're governed by a working board of your friends and neighbors who gladly give their time and money to sustain the arts in our community.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I’m Cathalyn, born of Memphis, Tennessee. I’ve been playing bass guitar for 8 years. When I was around 15 years old, I wrote in my journal that I would explode if I didn’t learn a skill.  I was young and looking for a purpose, and I’d always wanted to be in a band. To my young mind, bands equaled camaraderie.  I began to dream of playing bass.

In 2013,  I spent two invaluable years in North Carolina and it turned out to be the perfect place for me to bloom musically.  In May, I am releasing the Out In The Rough E. P. with Ben Singer, who plays Organ on the EP, and graciously helped us record at his studio, along with Matty Sheets on the drums.  May 22nd, we will be pleased to present what we accomplished with the EP release Show in Greensboro, where Elliot Napier, from Cleveland, will be joining me as well on drums.


Now for the BIG NEWS.
We are astounded to have the opportunity to work with a  producer who has worked with bands that I’ve admired and watched since High School!  Mute Math, Eisley and Switchfoot to name a few. Beyond having an awesome and professional quality record to put out, working with this producer gives me the opportunity to learn even more about the process of recording,  gain much needed guidance, and have the chance to network with who ever we may come across there. We ARE shooting for the stars,  but with your help I think it’s possible.  There are songs that I ache to share with you in this heartfelt blues sound that has developed in me over time.  I’d like for it to be presented at its best and this would give me that chance.

This week is the start of the Cathalyn/The Katy Full Album Fundraiser!

What We Need & What You Get

We need $6,000 for production and distribution costs. This will cover our time in the studio,  working with this producer and everything  needed to get a quality product out to you.  This is a big big dream : )

Donate an amount,  Choose a Reward and Share like crazy with your friends!

Some of the Rewards  to choose from upon Donating:
The digital copy of the Out In The Rough E.P  recorded in Greensboro, North Carolina  with Ben Singer on Organ and Matty Sheets on drums.
 Gloss print copies of  E.P Art by Cathalyn .  Fancy 13x11 watercolor prints of E.P  Art by Cathalyn.  Thank You phone calls.  Special signed Polaroids of past shows and photo shoots. A  Online show with q&a, special lyric book,  even a  Song written just for you by Cathalyn.

The Impact

By donating you are making an investment in me and in music.
This is  a big reach  BUT  with your help,  It’s possible.

Risks & Challenges

We might not get enough word out and therefore not make enough money
If that happens, it  will be a loong time before a full length album comes out.
This fundraiser is quite a risk  but we could succeed with your help.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    It would be a great help to share this link with all your friends!!

    If you have any questions email   Cathalyn.mail@gmail.com

    Thanks for Your Support!!


    Bio:


    Hi, I’m Cathalyn, born of Memphis, Tennessee. I’ve been playing bass guitar for 8 years.

    When I was around 15 years old, I wrote in my journal that I would explode if I didn’t learn a skill. I wanted to be good at something. I was looking for  a purpose, and I’d always wanted to be in a band. But what would I play? I thought guitar was too hard because we’d been given one by a family friend and I hadn’t been able to figure it out. In my 15 year old mind,  I wasn’t learning it fast enough.  I figured that drums would be too much for me to carry around, place to place by myself, and too expensive.  But bass, seemed to fit me. I began to dream of playing bass.

    It was the most noticeable part in all the music that I loved best. I was into  Booker T and the MGs, and obsessed with James Brown at the time. And I’d just started getting into The Clash and was particularly inspired by Joe Strummer’s story. The bass is solid and fun and I could be in the background since I was shy. I didn’t think that I could lead a band. I knew that I needed to play bass.  

    My 4 siblings and I all went to the same high school. While the older ones were there, they were all members of the gospel choir. I was in middle school and my family would go to the concerts. I always intently watched whoever played bass for each song. They were some amazing bassists. Somehow, I got the guts to ask my brother’s friend, who was also the main bassist for the choir, if he could give me lessons.  He saw I really wanted to learn and that was key.  I may not have played without his help. When he left for college. he gave me his bass to keep because I didn’t have one of my own. Over the course of that year,  I practiced constantly, with a goal in mind. Once I was in high school too, I stepped out on a limb and I asked the Gospel Choir director if I could be the new bassist. She agreed.  She gave me a try and it meant lot.


    Bass and Songwriting became my purpose.  It was what I had and so I began to write my own songs on bass and to look for and hope for band members. I wrote guitar ideas and vocals to go along with the beats in my head. Since I didn’t have a band, I ended up trying to figure out a way to express all the parts of my songs on the bass, so that I could try to sing them.  I didn't at all expect to end up playing primarily solo, but I’ve gained so much insight from both playing alone and with a band.  I still prefer to play with friends.  I’m excited going forward to,  now have Elliot Napier as a bandmate on the drums

    It’s been a winding road, but I am thankful for every person who has pushed me on in any way and there are many. Thank you for becoming one of them.

When he left for college. he gave me his bass to keep because I didn’t have one of my own. Over the course of that year,  I practiced constantly, with a goal in mind. Once I was in high school too, I stepped out on a limb and I asked the Gospel Choir director if I could be the new bassist. She agreed.  She gave me a try and it meant lot. Bass and Songwriting became my purpose.  It was what I had and so I began to write my own songs on bass and to look for and hope for band members. I wrote guitar ideas and vocals to go along with the beats in my head. Since I didn’t have a band, I ended up trying to figure out a way to express all the parts of my songs on the bass, so that I could try to sing them.  I didn't at all expect to end up playing primarily solo, but I’ve gained so much insight from both playing alone and with a band.  I still prefer to play with friends.  I’m excited going forward to,  now have Elliot Napier as a bandmate on the drumsIt’s been a winding road, but I am thankful for every person who has pushed me on in any way and there are many. Thank you for becoming one of them.

story:
Pulsar


Hey, I'm Davey Lyon.

Again, the time has come to release a second Pulsar album, but it cannot be done without your help. Reaching my goal will allow me to release a well produced album,  enabling me to share my music with those who are interested in hearing it. 

Being a DIY artist has allowed me to have free range over my music, resulting in an album that is not influenced by the music industry. 

This album will feature Travis Orbin ,recording drums and Wally, who will be recording bass. For this album I've worked really hard to create a unique sound for you-- the listener-- , by using recurring melodies and themes. The album will consist of two parts that will be released separately. 

As great as this all sounds, unfortunately these things come with a price. I'd like to avoid trying to get signed by a record label and would rather do whatever I can to get this album out to you on my own. So what say you? Help me get this album out to you.  

What I Need & What You Get

Let me break it down for ya':

  • I need $3500 to finish this project.  Any money raised will be used to cover the cost of equipment, mixing and mastering the album and the album art work, 
  • Even if I don't reach my goal, all donations will go toward the completion of my album.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Even if you're not able to donate any money, reposting this page any and everywhere will be greatly appreciated.

story:
About Palm Tree Radio

We know there is a whole host of Internet Radio stations available these days so why are we different? Well, there certainly is a load of stations on the 'virtual' dial but in the world of Trop Rock the choice is much more limited.

We are passionate about Tropical music and the feeling it can convey, from sitting on the shoreline to chilling in a hammock with a Pina Colada. We all need to escape the stresses of the world from time to time and that's something we like to offer, 24 hours a day, when you're ready to hit the beach.

Trop Rock itself is still a niche genre of music but we mix unsigned and undiscovered Trop Rock artists alongside some of the biggest names in Country and Reggae for an intoxicating blend of beach magic.

All this is done with our years of experience on radio stations in the 'real world' and we make a professional mix that sounds great piped around your house or sitting at your desk dreaming of the beach.

What We Need & What You Get

So the bottom line is quite simple, we LOVE playing the music for our many listeners but we also like to make sure we do it legally. That means we need funding for ongoing licences. We've got the tunes, we've got the volunteer team, we've got the equipment, this is the final step to ensure we broadcast the best beach mix.

We are completely non-profit, no one who volunteers for Palm Tree Radio makes a cent out of the station. All our merchandise is bought to enable us to spread the word (and wear cool t-shirts!) not to make anyone any money.

Your funding will purely go to getting and then keeping the station on the air, it really is as simple as that.

We know how cool you our listeners are already so we know that the perks we can offer will only make you even cooler! From T-shirts, Travel Mugs, Baseball Hats and Beach Totes.

We're also offering a special perk for listeners to record Christmas Messages to loved ones that we will air through the two week Christmas period at the end of December. We're really excited about that one because it means not only will we be on air at Christmas but we will have your lovely messages in between some fabulous Christmas beach tunes.

Perks For Businesses

We've even got some perks for listeners who may be in the position of owning their own business, or even be in charge of the sponsorship budget at one! The Featured Music Sweep & Headline Sponsor perks are designed with businesses in mind. We feel they represent amazing value and come in three-month packages. Depending on what package you choose this gives you the chance to be aligned with our superb programming and sound quality. We'll even take care of how you sound with our professional voiceover guy!

Our Programming

If you've been a Palm Tree Radio listener before you'll hopefully be aware of our music mix and how much we value making sure we play as much music as possible. To that end we are making sure our programming will remain up to the usual high standards and all you'll hear will be the best mix of Trop Rock, Country and Reggae.

Other Ways You Can Help

We're aware that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help and get involved. Maybe you can help out by getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign. 

Please do share if you have Facebook. Every little helps us towards our ultimate goal of bringing the station back on air.

Thank you for your time, we hope to see you on the beach very soon!

story:
Short Summary

"Ms. Stravelli...unfurled new layers of her remarkable voice. As she dipped and swooped, twirling notes and phrases with a confidence and playfulness that recalled Ella Fitzgerald in her prime, Ms. Stravelli began interpreting lyrics with a ferocity that her vocal pyrotechnics accentuated..."- The New York Times

Hi there! I'm Gabrielle Stravelli, a critically acclaimed New York-based singer and songwriter currently working on producing my first studio album, featuring EIGHT NEW ORIGINAL COMPOSITIONS! (my debut album was released in 2011 and was recorded live because the rent is too damn high). 

I am proud to say that I support myself entirely through making music- I have premiered a new song-cycle with Fred Hersch, toured with the Jazz at Lincoln Center Orchestra, work as a teaching artist at NYC's Kaufman Center and in NYC schools and have performed 2 solo shows, both of which received rave reviews from the New York Times. (woo hoo!) I recently returned from a month-long US State Department-sponsored international tour in which I worked with local musicians in various countries and performed with my own quartet. That experience restored my faith in the power that music has to create connections between people of vastly different backgrounds and to therefore be a force of good in the world. Music is important and I'm ready to make some of my own again. 

You may now find yourself saying "Well Ms. Stravelli, why do you need MY help in producing your CD? You're making it sound like you're awfully fancy..."

To which I can reply: "Thank you! That's very kind of you to say! The fact is, that while I have had some awesome gigs and opportunities, those are career highlights. Many of the regular performing work I do in small clubs pays approximately $50-$100. I don't love this kind of work any less. It's just that being a working musician doesn't exactly= I'm a high roller!"  

Producing a professional studio CD costs around $20,000-$30,000, which is a tremendous amount of money in my world and yet it's essential for a musician to have this. It's been 5 years since I released an album and I must produce a new CD that reflects where I'm at as a vocalist NOW- since releasing that first album I've worked hard to continue honing my craft and happily, I can say that I've grown and improved a lot! My CD acts as my calling card and a new one is imperative to continuing the upward trajectory of my career.

What I Need:

The CD will actually cost $23,500, some of which will just be out-of-pocket for me. Here's the breakdown: 

  1. $5,000 producer
  2. $3,000, studio time
  3. $5,500, musicians (we're creating jobs, y'all!)
  4. $2,000, arrangements
  5. $2,000 mixing/mastering
  6. $1,500 CD pressing and song rights for non-original tunes
  7. $3,000 radio campaign
  8. $1,500 art design and photos 
What You Get
Yes, this will be a mutually beneficial endeavor. I hope. Everyone who contributes will receive my ETERNAL GRATITUDE. You'll also get a social media thank you and copy of the finished CD. Some of you will get a digital download and/or the hard copy version, depending on your contribution. The more you give, the more you get- I'm offering personalized happy birthday greetings or lullabies, private voice lessons, show comps and producer credit in the liner notes. 
If I don't reach my full goal, (but i'm totally GOING TO!) my main priority is paying musicians and my producer. Theoretically, I could attempt to get multiple credit cards, charge tens of thousands of dollars to them and slowly pay everything off over many years until I'm an old woman eating cat food. Do you want to see that happen?!!! 

The Impact

I really do believe, now more than ever, that music is a universal language and that we need music to connect people and reflect our shared human experience. I know that may sound like hyperbole or like something I'm only saying for the sake of my indiegogo campaign, but I've actually experienced this first hand- see the video below from a recent performance in Azerbaijan where I sang a beloved local folk song.

Risks & Challenges

I suppose the only risk/obstacle that I face is that the album may take longer than anticipated to record, requiring more studio time and more money. However, I have a fantastic producer who's worked with the likes of Taylor Swift, Shayna Steele and Marianne Faithful, who knows the recording process inside and out and has an excellent yet realistic plan for the time needed to get the CD done right. I'm very organized so I feel that together, we're on the path to getting this done in a timely fashion and within the bounds of the anticipated budget. I'm a Virgo- I don't mess around when it comes to details and planning! 

Other Ways You Can Help

I completely understand that not everyone is in a position to contribute financially. I've been there myself. Of course, there are other ways to show your support: 

  • Copy the link to the campaign and share away on your social media platform of choice! Someone you're connected to may dig what I do and decide to contribute. 
  • Send me telepathic good wishes for a successful campaign. Any meditations, good vibes and intentions are much appreciated!

story:
Short Summary

Suicide is already known as a project focused on hard & dark drum & bass (such subgenres as darkstep, techstep, hardstep). Viktor & Nikita received serious support in the past: they worked with Technical Itch, DJ G-I-S and Dylan on collaborations and releases and they earned experience and respect from the scene followers. Suicide style is unique mix between industrial heaviness and jungle tempo. You can check their last released tune called "Klon": we released this one together with Indiegogo users in the beginning of the year. More information is here.

Also check (2 tunes from the album are inside) the sound of Suicide - Harder & Louder Podcast 35!

What We Need & What You Get

We have 12 finished tunes by Suicide:

The money we're looking for are needed to pay mastering engineer, cover designer (this time we want to focus on better design), CD printing company and distribution. Everything fits in the sum of 600 euro.

You will receive (depends on perk you choose):

  • Digipak CD + digital version of release.
  • Bonus content: other digital releases of Harder & Louder Recordings.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just share the information on your socials, tell your friends who listen hard/dark drum & bass. It will be enough for us. Thanks!

story:
We're bringing a brass ensemble, timpani and organ to join our chorus at our winter concert at St. Peter’s Church in the Citicorp Building. But hiring the instrumental ensemble is more than our low-budget chorus can afford, so if we’re going to fill that soaring space with great music by Haydn, Handel and Rutter, we need your help.

We are The Glass Menagerie Chorus, a long-established community chorus based in downtown Manhattan. We offer high quality concerts at rock-bottom ticket prices. For our concert at St. Peter’s, we will be joined by a brass octet, timpani and organ in performing the Haydn Te Deum, the stirring Gloria by John Rutter in honor of his 70th birthday, plus more great seasonal music.

The combination of brass, percussion, organ and voice makes for thrilling music, but it’s costly. Dues, grants, and ticket sales cover only a portion of our concert expenses. That’s why we’re asking for your help. We need your generous, tax-deductible donations to make this concert possible. 

Our goal is $4,000, and every contribution will help get us there. We welcome gifts at every level, whether it’s $10 or ten times that amount. Please help meet our goal – and tell your friends! Every little bit counts.

About our concert: 

The Venue: Saint Peter’s Church in the Citicorp Building, Lexington Avenue at 54th Street.

The Date: Saturday, December 12, 2015 at 8:00 PM.  Tickets are $25, and may be purchased at the door or online at Brown Paper Tickets.

The Program: Music for Chorus & Brass, featuring Franz Joseph Haydn's Te Deum in C Major, John Rutter's Gloria, and many more seasonal favorites. 

As always, we’ll close with our popular holiday sing-along.

About our chorus: 

For more than 30 years we have been sharing our joy in music-making through modestly priced concerts at beautiful and welcoming Manhattan venues.

Our Director, Dr. Susan Glass, is a member of NYU’s Music Education Faculty and a noted music educator. She founded The Glass Menagerie Chorus in 1984 with a group of eight parents and teachers from the Little Red School House. From this modest beginning, the chorus has grown in numbers, repertoire, and musical accomplishment. Performances have highlighted masterworks from the past, music from folk and vernacular traditions, as well as the work of living composers, including new pieces commissioned by the Glass Menagerie Chorus.

Our choristers come from throughout the New York metropolitan area and from every walk of life. The chorus welcomes enthusiastic amateurs as well as professional music educators and performers.

No donation is too small. And even if you can’t support us financially, please come to our concert! It’s going to be a joyous evening and we’d love to see you in the audience. Bring your friends and spread the word!

story:
My Story: "Song of the Soprano"....

In any career field, to pursue our dreams we must work tirelessly at our craft and create or seize our own opportunities (or "opera-tunities") as they come as we pursue our dreams.  This is especially true in the world of opera and has been a large part of my story, or the melody in my song as a soprano.


I am Elisa Rose Jordan, a young soprano who is about to graduate with a Bachelor of Arts in Music from Point Loma Nazarene University, a small liberal arts university located in San Diego, California.  When I began my university experience, pursuing a career as an opera singer was definitely not something I had considered as a career.  An interest in music, coupled with scholarship opportunities, led me to major in music, where I quickly fell in love with opera. Performing in Amahl and the Night Visitors and then having a lead in the The Magic Flute cemented this love.


As my sophomore year of college was ending, we learned to our chagrin that the opera program was going to be discontinued, something my friends and I could not bear to lose.  We united to create our own student-led organization, the "Point Loma Opera Theatre" (or PLOT, as we affectionately called it), in which I served as President during my Junior and Senior years.  We resourced and produced our own student-led, operated and performed operas, including works from Puccini, Purcell and Massenet!  Our performances were well received by the greater music community in San Diego and have led to many other "opera-tunities,"  such as being a part of the San Diego Opera Chorus in Madame Butterfly, Nabbuco and Turandot.  My experience as President of PLOT also allowed me to create my own position as the Administrative Intern for the 2010 OperaWorks program. 


Since I began my voice studies in college, I have been given and created opportunities for myself to be featured in operas, oratorios, recitals, choir concerts, numerous solo appearances and have won or placed in  several competitions. Here is a brief summary of what I've been working on this past year:

  • Sang the title role in Massenet's Cendrillon
  • Soprano soloist in Handel's Messiah
  • Won the T. Davis Encouragement Award from the Metropolitan Opera National Council auditions
  • Winner of the Virginia and Susan Hawk Memorial Scholarship in 2010 
  • Winner in the La Jolla Symphony Young Artist Competition for two consecutive years
  • Accepted to the nationally recognized OperaWorks Advanced Artist Program
  • Sang as one the youngest members of San Diego Opera's productions of Nabucco and Turandot
  • Preparing for my senior recital entitled "Faces of Eve" on April 9th


My latest "opera-tunity" came just this past February, when I was chosen as one of only 30 singers from more than 300 applications worldwide to participate in OperaWorks' Advanced Artist Program! (That's a 10% acceptance rate!!) This is a nationally recognized 4-week long program for singers with professional management or demonstrated major career potential. OperaWorks is renown for its innovative holistic approach to training singers, voice teachers, and coaches. Program studies include: 

  • Conducting
  • Music/Dramatic Analysis
  • Performance Techniques
  • Improvisation
  • Acting 
  • Yoga
  • Movement 
  • Alexander Technique
  • Coaching & Diction 
  • Marketing & Career Planning

The program will be held June 27th - July 24th on the campus of California State University Northridge under the direction of renowned opera coach and instructor, Ann Baltz.


Without a doubt, Ann Baltz’s OperaWorks stands above the rest in its unique ability to transform singers into complete artists.  The OperaWorks method is far more creative.  It encourages the individual singer to find and explore his or her own limits and go beyond.”

Gregory Buchalter, Assistant Conductor – The Metropolitan Opera


The Impact...

The OperaWorks program is not only an incredible opportunity for world-class training and professional networking, but I have personally witnessed the incredible personal growth in spirit of those who have attended. Alumni of OperaWorks are currently singing in many of the major opera houses of the world, such as the Metropolitan Opera, and are recognizable by their positive attitude and performance at auditions, competitions, and back stage! With your generous support of any amount, I, too, will be able to participate in this amazing journey of personal and professional growth. 


What I Need & What You Get...

For me to take advantage of this exciting opportunity, I need to raise $2,700 for the program's tuition. As one who will soon be graduating, I need more than my own meager resources to take advantage of this amazing opportunity. Your gift will enable me not only to attend the OperaWorks program, but also work and continue to grow as a performing artist!  I invite you to become a donor or sponsor of my participation in OperaWorks and follow my journey.

The loose change in your couch or car will be appreciated just as much as a check of $10, $25, $50, even $100, or any other amount of your choice. Your donation will go directly to the OperaWorks program and be used for no other purpose. Your gift is TAX-DEDUCTIBLE if made directly to OperaWorks (referencing me, of course!). 

You can use your credit card online today, or a check can be written and mailed directly to OperaWorks (tax-deductible) at:

OperaWorks

11862 Balboa Blvd. PMB #391

Granada Hills, CA 91344


Remember to write "For Elisa Jordan" in the check "Memo" line!


Contact me via email at erjordan18@gmail.com for more information regarding the program or on tax deductible donations, or please contact OperaWorks at (818) 898-9597 or info@operaworks.com. 


Other Ways You Can Help...

I would greatly appreciate your help in spreading the word about my campaign to attend OperaWorks, and being a part of my journey! You can use the easy and accessible sharing tools from Indiegogo.com via Facebook, Twitter, or Blogger.com! 


Thank you for your support and your consideration in helping me make my aspirations a reality! 


Elisa Rose Jordan

Soprano
story_txt:
My Story: "Song of the Soprano"....
In any career field, to pursue our dreams we must work tirelessly at our craft and create or seize our own opportunities (or "opera-tunities") as they come as we pursue our dreams.  This is especially true in the world of opera and has been a large part of my story, or the melody in my song as a soprano.

I am Elisa Rose Jordan, a young soprano who is about to graduate with a Bachelor of Arts in Music from Point Loma Nazarene University, a small liberal arts university located in San Diego, California.  When I began my university experience, pursuing a career as an opera singer was definitely not something I had considered as a career.  An interest in music, coupled with scholarship opportunities, led me to major in music, where I quickly fell in love with opera. Performing in Amahl and the Night Visitors and then having a lead in the The Magic Flute cemented this love.

As my sophomore year of college was ending, we learned to our chagrin that the opera program was going to be discontinued, something my friends and I could not bear to lose.  We united to create our own student-led organization, the "Point Loma Opera Theatre" (or PLOT, as we affectionately called it), in which I served as President during my Junior and Senior years.  We resourced and produced our own student-led, operated and performed operas, including works from Puccini, Purcell and Massenet!  Our performances were well received by the greater music community in San Diego and have led to many other "opera-tunities,"  such as being a part of the San Diego Opera Chorus in Madame Butterfly, Nabbuco and Turandot.  My experience as President of PLOT also allowed me to create my own position as the Administrative Intern for the 2010 OperaWorks program. 

Since I began my voice studies in college, I have been given and created opportunities for myself to be featured in operas, oratorios, recitals, choir concerts, numerous solo appearances and have won or placed in  several competitions. Here is a brief summary of what I've been working on this past year:


Sang the title role in Massenet's Cendrillon

Soprano soloist in Handel's Messiah


Won the T. Davis Encouragement Award from the Metropolitan Opera National Council auditions
Winner of the Virginia and Susan Hawk Memorial Scholarship in 2010 
Winner in the La Jolla Symphony Young Artist Competition for two consecutive years
Accepted to the nationally recognized OperaWorks Advanced Artist Program
Sang as one the youngest members of San Diego Opera's productions of Nabucco and Turandot

Preparing for my senior recital entitled "Faces of Eve" on April 9th




My latest "opera-tunity" came just this past February, when I was chosen as one of only 30 singers from more than 300 applications worldwide to participate in OperaWorks' Advanced Artist Program! (That's a 10% acceptance rate!!) This is a nationally recognized 4-week long program for singers with professional management or demonstrated major career potential. OperaWorks is renown for its innovative holistic approach to training singers, voice teachers, and coaches. Program studies include: 


Conducting
Music/Dramatic Analysis
Performance Techniques
Improvisation
Acting 
Yoga
Movement 
Alexander Technique
Coaching & Diction 
Marketing & Career Planning

The program will be held June 27th - July 24th on the campus of California State University Northridge under the direction of renowned opera coach and instructor, Ann Baltz.


Without a doubt, Ann Baltz’s OperaWorks stands above the rest in its unique ability to transform singers into complete artists.  The OperaWorks method is far more creative.  It encourages the individual singer to find and explore his or her own limits and go beyond.”
Gregory Buchalter, Assistant Conductor – The Metropolitan Opera


The Impact...

The OperaWorks program is not only an incredible opportunity for world-class training and professional networking, but I have personally witnessed the incredible personal growth in spirit of those who have attended. Alumni of OperaWorks are currently singing in many of the major opera houses of the world, such as the Metropolitan Opera, and are recognizable by their positive attitude and performance at auditions, competitions, and back stage! With your generous support of any amount, I, too, will be able to participate in this amazing journey of personal and professional growth. 

What I Need & What You Get...


For me to take advantage of this exciting opportunity, I need to raise $2,700 for the program's tuition. As one who will soon be graduating, I need more than my own meager resources to take advantage of this amazing opportunity. Your gift will enable me not only to attend the OperaWorks program, but also work and continue to grow as a performing artist!  I invite you to become a donor or sponsor of my participation in OperaWorks and follow my journey.

The loose change in your couch or car will be appreciated just as much as a check of $10, $25, $50, even $100, or any other amount of your choice. Your donation will go directly to the OperaWorks program and be used for no other purpose. Your gift is TAX-DEDUCTIBLE if made directly to OperaWorks (referencing me, of course!). 
You can use your credit card online today, or a check can be written and mailed directly to OperaWorks (tax-deductible) at:

OperaWorks
11862 Balboa Blvd. PMB #391
Granada Hills, CA 91344


Remember to write "For Elisa Jordan" in the check "Memo" line!

Contact me via email at erjordan18@gmail.com for more information regarding the program or on tax deductible donations, or please contact OperaWorks at (818) 898-9597 or info@operaworks.com. 

Other Ways You Can Help...

I would greatly appreciate your help in spreading the word about my campaign to attend OperaWorks, and being a part of my journey! You can use the easy and accessible sharing tools from Indiegogo.com via Facebook, Twitter, or Blogger.com! 

Thank you for your support and your consideration in helping me make my aspirations a reality! 

Elisa Rose Jordan
Soprano

story:
The Country Mourns need sweethearts!

Hi!

Have you ever tasted the sweets of new love? C'mon we know that you have! Well, we are Mike and Jody and we have some new love to share with you! The kind of love that you feel when you see a pile of puppies or spend a warm day at the beach or when you get smacked with a bunch of wet kisses. We have 14 songs that are just like those warm fuzzy feelings, and we want to give them to you so that you can visit them over and over again forever.

Okay! before skipping to the end of this for all the sweet kissing and the considered track list, will you please read the next three paragraphs?

We both have been involved in music our entire lives. I suppose we were born blessed with songs in our hearts. But with that blessing comes the Catch 22 that though we have dedicated thousands of hours to learn how to sing and play and write, the art of creating music does not come cheap, we need funds just to be able to share the songs we create. Like a non-profit, we put all that we earn back into creating the music for you to enjoy. And like a non-profit, we need support to be as effective as we know that we can be.

In our many years of performing music in various genres and projects, etc.,  Jody and I have been lucky enough to see this concrete fact: that music and song produce a kind of pleasure which human nature cannot do without. We both are involved in sharing music with infants and young children, with teens and with adults, and we have seen that the love and happiness created out of little but melody, rhythm and lyric is powerful and wonderous.

The muses have given us more than a dozen brand new songs that are made up of the magical stuff that I am talking about. Of the hundreds of songs I have written, a few that have become well known and the majority best forgotten, I believe that these are my very best. The stars further aligned when Jody began to pursue roots and pop music. Her voice is the voice that I have long dreamed would sing my melodies.

BUT THESE MELODIES ARE BUT A FLEETING WIND WITHOUT YOUR HELP!

 

What you are helping us with.....

We debated long and hard about what monetary goal that we should set for this project. In this consideration we looked at what our expenses will be, what we hope to achieve, and what our peers who have run similar projects have required. While the goal we set may seem like a lot of money, it is in reality a little more than half of what we expect to spend to make these songs come to life and spread the joy contained within them to more than only those who we can reach in person.
 
I have been involved in many recording sessions. The expenses include the studio itself, a producer/engineer, the extra musicians that we need to hire to flesh out the songs, and the post production of mastering. We are lucky that we can do our own artwork and do have a network of musical friends who will work at a discounted rate, but it will still require several thousand dollars to make this happen.

A major label, for profit musician like Kanye West or Taylor Swift will have hundreds of thousands spent on recording their music. Smaller acts like Gillian Welch still require several tens of thousands of dollars. We can only expect a budget that is a fraction of these artists. However, the listener expects a relatively similar sonic sound, and that is only achieved through time and gear, which costs money. Most importantly,  we believe strongly that our songs will touch you in the same ways that a big budget song would even if we can not dream of having the same resources that those artists are blessed with.
 

WE ARE IN THIS TOGETHER!

We will forever be in a debt of gratitude to those who contribute to this campaign. But like the small yet viital group who contribute to, for instance, public radio, your contribution will not only be a benefit to The Country Mourns, but also to all of those who potentially will enjoy the songs we have written and the performances that we and our musical friends put onto tape.

Please put us to work! We will stretch every nickel and bend every penny to get these songs ready for you to sing along to in the comfort of your own home, car or headphones!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even the smallest contribution will help and will be greatly appreiciated. But beyond that, we are hoping that you are among our friends who will help spread the word about the campaign.

If you have enjoyed the songs that I have written in the past, or the live shows that our bands have played, please please tell a friend who may not know about us.

Collectively we can spread these songs AROUND THE WORLD!!


AND HERE ARE THE TITLES OF SONGS WE ARE GOING TO TRY AND FIT ON THIS RECORD!!

  1. Her Daddy's Guitar
  2. I'll Be Your Road
  3. Oh So Happy!
  4. Situation Getting Out of Hand
  5. Don't Call Me Darlin'
  6. All Summer Long
  7. But Before You Have To Go
  8. I Wished I'd Kissed You Goodbye
  9. Darlin' I Won't Be Here Waiting
  10. Spring Song
  11. The Rest of The Story
  12. That's The Way It Goes
  13. Holding Pattern
  14. Hello Mr. Heartbreak

story:
Download a flyer and spread the word!

We Made it 80 Miles! Check out Our Video Here.

Our goal is to raise an additional $50,000 more to build a Phase One of the Downingtown Skatepark. This is our attempt to entertain you during our final push to raise this money. Check out our videos and news below these slides to see the timeline progress of this project. We do have the Department of Environmental Protection (DEP) approval to build at our proposed location, so now all we need is your support to break ground in Spring 2013. We are thrilled that this project has come this far along and hopefully we can get the final push we need. This fundraiser will end Jan. 1 2013!

See Our Plan

Videos

  • Video 1
  • Video 2

Progress in the News

  • First Borough Council Meeting
  • First Go Skateboarding Day
  • June 28, 2010 Radio Interview on WCHE 1520 AM
  • Borough Resolution Passed
  • Fundraising Continues
  • Another Step Towards our Location
  • Location Approved!
  • July 13, 2012 Interview on All Action Sports Radio

DOWNINGTOWNSKATEPARK.COM

We will continue to update this campaign as we get closer to our goal. Thanks for all of the support!

Limited Edition Else Wear T-Shirt

(This campaign only!)

story:
We are The Underline, a 5-piece band from Hopewell Junction, NY. We all have experience playing with previous bands, but are moving fast in the music scene. Within nearly 6 months, we have already recorded one single along with finishing up a 5 song EP.

This EP encompasses every emotion we could have put into our music. It is filled with catchy, fast-paced guitar riffed choruses, strong female vocal presence, and a rhythm section that is both intricate and simple. The Underline strives to play music that we love, covering genres from pop-punk to post hardcore to alternative. Influenced by artists such as Paramore, Evanescence, Set Your Goals, Fall Out Boy, Lights, and Green Day. Even with those influences, we are able to create a sound that is unique to us as a band.

We put all the money that 5 students enrolled in college had into this EP, and that is why we come to you to ask for your help. Recording an EP and having it pressed onto CDs is very expensive, and we cannot afford all of the costs on our own. Money that is donated will be used towards recording costs and CD printing, and any additional money will go towards touring costs (gas, food, etc.), band merchandise, and promotion.

Even if you are not able to make a donation, we appreciate the time you took to read this. Please share this with your friends and ask them to donate as well. Any form of publicity and advertising is greatly appreciated!

Last, we would like to thank everyone who has helped us get where we are in such a short period of time. In less than six months we have already written and recorded a five song EP, and continue to play shows at the support of our fans. We can't wait to share this EP with you all of you; thank you for giving us this opportunity.

-The Underline

story:
SUPERSTORM SANDY FORCES CONCERT DATE CHANGE!!!

Greetings everyone! Due to the effects of Superstorm Sandy in our region, we   have pushed the concert date back a week to Sunday, November 11,2012. It is still at the same place and time...The Spiritual Empowerment Center - Baltimore, 5 - 8 pm. Hope to see you there, and PLEASE Donate!

with gratitude - Deletta

I'm Deletta Gillespie, teaching and performing artist/vocalist/songwriter...I wear a lot of hats.

I have twenty-five years in the entertainment industry as a vocalist, actress, dancer, voice over artist, entertainment coordinator and educator. Currently I am on the performing arts faculty at a small university. And while teaching brings me great joy, these days, I find myself wanting to use my talents as a vehicle to help others. As an artist, I am passionate about the arts being a wonderful tool for social change, and all of the work I create, whether it be a play, a song, or some other kind of performance, can be categorized as work that promotes social change and healing. 

For example, in 2006, I wrote and directed a play, "What a Girl Wants" that premiered in Bermuda. With sponsorship of nearly $4000 and shrewd advertising and marketing, my partners and I were able to donate nearly $15,000 to the Women's Resource Center in Bermuda. 

And in 2011, I created a concert event that created awareness about the refugee rape crisis in Haiti. This year via that same concert series, I was able to raise funds and collect clothing for an organization whose focus is reentry for women rebounding from substance abuse. 

I knew that human trafficking is a big problem in other places around the world, but I had no idea how big a problem it is in the US until I heard my minister speak about it in one of her sermons several months ago. Then I saw a documentary on PBS a week later, and knew that I wanted to raise awareness and funds around this issue at my next event. I have been a part of eleven CD's over the years, but have never recorded my own CD...mostly because of lack of funding, and, because my best performances happen in front of a live audience. So, after being nudged one more time, I decided that now was the time. I have merged them together for TRIUMPH, a cd of heartfelt, sometimes quirky songs from several genres of music (reggae, pop, rock, r&b, latin) but all seasoned just a bit with the music my mother played the most...jazz. 

I hope you join me in this venture. You contributions will go to defray the costs of the recording, mastering, and duplication of the CD and DVD. Ten percent will go to organizations such as Samaritan Women, a Baltimore-based organization that helps people who are the equivalent of modern day slaves gain their freedom. Another ten percent will go to my spiritual home, The Spiritual Empowerment Center, that creates and manages educational and outreach programs for children and youth in the region.

Perks include receiving the CD's and DVD's of course, but also getting mentioned on my website, to being able to advertise your product or company on my website for anywhere from 1 - 3 months. Also, if you donate before the Concert date, you will get a mention in the 'Roll Call' of donors during the performance. It will be recorded for posterity! 

There are gift bags and other merchandise being offered as well, but as we are still finalizing those details and will keep everyone as the offers are completed.

If you are not able to donate at this time, YOU CAN STILL HELP by sharing this appeal with others. Also, do some research and see if there are organizations whose focus is also human trafficking.

Thanks so much!

story:
Short Summary:

My name is Scott MacMeeken. I have had a life long passion for music and documentory film. I was first introduced to the music of Albannach approximately three years ago. I have seen very few bands that are as passionate about what they are doing as members of the band Albannach.

This is the first film that I have done of this magnitude. The band Albannach has given me the honor of helping me to pursue my dream as a filmmaker by allowing me to film and produce their newest DVD project. This honor I do not take lightly. I intend to give them, and fans, the most brilliant Albannach DVD to date.

By contributing to this project you will help ensure not only that the popularity of this great band continues to grow, but that people will be able to see Albannach on a grand scale.

What We Need & What You Get:

We are setting a goal of $5,000.00 to get this project started. Anything more then that will only help to futher this endeavor. Albannach has nearly nearly seventeen thousand fans just on facebook alone. If that many fans would donate simply one dollar, this production would be completely financed start to finish. You can also rest assured that 100% of any funds that you donate will be used only toward production costs for this DVD.

We would not ask anyone to give their hard earned money without offering some rewards.

This is what you get,

The Douglas Package: $50.00 and you will receive an autographed copy of the completed DVD.

The MacGregor Package: $75.00 and you will receive the autographed DVD as well as an autographed t-shirt.

The Wallace Package: $100.00 and you will receive the autographed DVD, t-shirt, and an autographed drum head.

Due to touring constraints only one of the final package will be made available.

The Bruce Package: The first person to donate $1,500.00 will receive all previously mentioned rewards, and Albannach will perform a concert at your private engagement! This of course will be negotiated by Albannach around scheduled tour dates and within reasonable traveling distance from concert venues.
story_txt:
Short Summary:
My name is Scott MacMeeken. I have had a life long passion for music and documentory film. I was first introduced to the music of Albannach approximately three years ago. I have seen very few bands that are as passionate about what they are doing as members of the band Albannach.
This is the first film that I have done of this magnitude. The band Albannach has given me the honor of helping me to pursue my dream as a filmmaker by allowing me to film and produce their newest DVD project. This honor I do not take lightly. I intend to give them, and fans, the most brilliant Albannach DVD to date.
By contributing to this project you will help ensure not only that the popularity of this great band continues to grow, but that people will be able to see Albannach on a grand scale.
What We Need & What You Get:
We are setting a goal of $5,000.00 to get this project started. Anything more then that will only help to futher this endeavor. Albannach has nearly nearly seventeen thousand fans just on facebook alone. If that many fans would donate simply one dollar, this production would be completely financed start to finish. You can also rest assured that 100% of any funds that you donate will be used only toward production costs for this DVD.
We would not ask anyone to give their hard earned money without offering some rewards. 
This is what you get,
The Douglas Package: $50.00 and you will receive an autographed copy of the completed DVD.
The MacGregor Package: $75.00 and you will receive the autographed DVD as well as an autographed t-shirt.
The Wallace Package: $100.00 and you will receive the autographed DVD, t-shirt, and an autographed drum head.
Due to touring constraints only one of the final package will be made available.
The Bruce Package: The first person to donate $1,500.00 will receive all previously mentioned rewards, and Albannach will perform a concert at your private engagement! This of course will be negotiated by Albannach around scheduled tour dates and within reasonable traveling distance from concert venues.

story:
To all my friends and family:

Since 2009, I have been working steadily with talented and wonderful people—Michael Wethington and Christopher Hontos, Jason Edmunds and Cole Weiland, Micky Alfano and Joseph Berns, Sarah Burns and Jim Pfeffer—on a project that has vastly transcended our initial modest plan of simply playing music together to generate happiness for ourselves and those around us in the world. To date have already released eight major releases in a span of three years with the help of all the wonderful people at Moon Glyph Records in Minneapolis, Naturebliss Records in Tokyo, Debacle Records in Seattle, and several smaller record labels internationally. This includes cassette tape releases, compact-disc releases, and vinyl record releases, all of which are also available digitally.

For those who have understandably been doing it up in their own little corner of the world and have missed these FP things, a career-length review of our releases is available at http://foodpyramidband.tumblr.com/sound.

That this project has gone as far as it has is due in large part to the people in my life who have supported and encouraged me in artistic pursuits, past and present. I thank you now and forever for allowing me the freedom to ask questions and create new possibilities for sound and life. We have enjoyed a small degree of success in touring nationally, as well as playing locally: some memorable events include playing at Franklin Art Works in Minneapolis with NYC-based artist Conrad Ventur (http://www.conradventur.com/), at Midway Arts in Minneapolis and at the Convent of St. Cecelia in New York City with international artist Raha Raissnia (http://www.obsessionscollective.com/index.php?page=artist&id=14), as well as South by Southwest in Austin and the Square Lake Festival in Minnesota.

As I have devoted countless hours to this project, I have slowly begun to collapse the boundaries between it and my world outside of it to the point where I must be honest and declaim that anything extra I could ever gain monetarily in life would most certainly be funnelled into making this idea, this project, more clearly defined and and all-around better, brighter, faster, and stronger. I believe in what I do and in the people I choose to do it with, and want nothing more than to continue to make this a success.

Money is the simple tool that allows this to continue. This has become an important part of my life that I want to share with anyone who wants to listen. Any hope for holiday or name-day well-wishing in any other fashion than good cheer and mutual happiness has been co-opted by this very real and personal ambition to upgrade the tools of my trade and finance the realization of lasting musical documents with the people I love. You get the idea.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

For the next 60 days, I am aiming to raise $2000, or approximately $50 from approximately 40 people.

Each donation amount has a different perk!

I set this number because I have set my sights on upgrading my music production tools and this is the cost of doing so. A better music production situation will allow me to make and produce a more sophisticated body of work at a higher sound quality - immediately increasing my ability to pitch to higher-profile music licensing and production companies and allowing this project to move closer to self-sustainability. To date this project has already generated over $7,000 in licensing our music to companies such as Vionnet Paris and Outsell.com.

 

The Impact

 

In return:

Think of it like this:

You will help me directly and I will consider your contribution a blessing.

If you are inclined to give gifts at holidays, you won't have to worry about getting me a physical gift for holiday or if I will like said gift.

You will never have to wonder if I secretly returned whatever it is you got me or surrender to indecision and buy a gift card to a store you hope I may like.

You will be helping not only myself, but countless others who have invested their time and energy in this project. 

That's quite a deal!

 

Additionally, you will be participating in a collective effort of support, where, like NPR, $5, $10, or $25 is quite welcome, and everything above that ecstatically encouraged—but never expected. Your contribution pools towards the ultimate goal, which removes a lot of pressure on the material side of things. 

 

Again, I don't expect miracles. The goal is just that: a goal. Anything less or more will still be utilized effectively and greatly appreciated.

 

Your contribution contributes to the success of Food Pyramid as a music project and my life as a fulfilled human being. Our goal is simply to create a listening experience that creates a better world and to support ourselves to a degree that allows us to continue. We do it out of love, and a hope for a brighter future.

 

If for any reason you cannot contribute, please help spread this message! This in itself is also a wonderful gift worthy of my thanks! Share it on facebook with family and friends who know me, or email it, or anything at all!

 

Thank you for reading.

 

Wishing you the best,

Peace and Love,

 

Christopher Farstad

New Orleans, LA

27 September 2012

story:
It's a new season for Jana... And with that new season comes a need for a new sound and new ways to take listeners to a deeper place in the presence of God!  Blind since birth, this urban worship artist embarks on every challenge with a faith that is real... And contagious!  Her heart is to glorify God through her music and to help her listeners to see Him through a different lens.

 

Where will your donation go?  Our initial goal is to raise all funds necessary for recording costs, i.e. studio time, song royalties, etcetera, as well as any travel expenses associated with the recording.  Should we exceed our goal, all funds will go toward securing a budget for Jana Jackson Ministries, so that Jana can move forward into the vision that God has given her to ensure that more visually impaired children and adults have the technology that they need to succeed in their daily lives.

 

We appreciate your interest in this project, and we thank you for your generous contribution!  No gift is too small... In fact, a giver by nature, Jana is giving back to every person who chooses to become a part of this vision.  Be sure to check out all of the special gifts below.  All donations are tax-deductible! 

 

If you can't support this project financially at this time, you can still help Jana to reach and even surpass her goal by spreading the word about her campaign... Start by using Indiegogo's sharing tools.  Thanks, and God bless you!

story:
We have been passionate about music, youth, and traveling and are excited about the prospect of making a difference locally and overseas in our future together. We have been given the opportunity to do all of these things very soon! It's incredibly exciting, but overwhelming to try and do alone. That's why we're asking for your help.

The organization that we are working with is a friendship, education and engagement program that connects children in China with children in America. The program is a 21st century version of the pen pal custom, but with computers and the internet instead of pens, paper and the postal service. Without leaving their own communities, young ambassadors learn about other cultures, develop authentic relationships and share with children thousands of miles away.

We will be a part of a program that travels to schools around China, teaching good values, as well as sharing American culture and music. We want to get the kids excited about having an American penpal.

This was a very recent blessing that was dropped in our laps, and we are so excited to be a part of this team. It's a great way to start off our life together, and preparing us for what is to come! If you can't contribute financially, please share our story with your friends and keep us in your thoughts. If you'd like more information, please email us at kaileyrebekah@gmail.com and we'd love to share more about the trip! Thank you for even considering partnering with us.

story:
First!

Listen to our newest single here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jXlL-v1fZv4

Then please read...

Short Summary

Hi! We're Peace Mercutio from Seattle, WA.  We're a alt. rock four-piece that's been around since 2011. We have two full-time vocalists Andy Lundman and Dan Buckley, a fantastic drummer Taylor Jurgens, and a brand new bass player Nick Emacio (lead singer of The Lookout) Last October we released our first album 'Weather The Storm' it was an exciting time, and though not perfect, we felt it captured who we were as a band.  It also gave us an excuse to tour around the US.  After a two-week tour in August 2011, and a week-long tour March 2012, we realized that if we really wanted to make an impact, we were going to have to be on the road full-time.

Which brings us to now.  You may have heard our newest single "(And That's How) Good Charlotte (Got Famous)" which will be the first track on a new 3-song EP due out in June.  Recording, promoting, and touring to make the most out of new music takes a lot of hard work and effort, and this time around, instead of staying in Seattle, WA (love Russel Wilson, and the Seahawks ok? know that) we want to bring the show to you. We just recently announced huge news that will be on tour with Emery, Wolves At The Gate, and The Seeking Apr 22 - May 13. So we're asking for your help.  Check out the exclusive packages that we've created.  Listen to the single.  If you like what you hear and believe in what we're doing please contribute and join us in making this dream a reality.

Fundraiser Packages

 Thank You for supporting us.

Why Crowd-Sourcing?

We have seen crowd-sourcing being used in great ways to launch bands that people care about.  It's empowering musicians and their fans to work together to create music that would otherwise never be heard.  We hope that we can be a part of this phenomenon and use crowd-sourcing to deliver the music and live performances that our fans deserve.  We've set a high goal using flexible-funding, which means that we will be able to use whatever is raised even if we don't hit our goal.  We have done our best to show exactly how the money will be used, so you can be confident in what you are contributing towards.  We believe our fans care about the music we are making and can work with us to hit our goal.

"Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed people can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has." - Margaret Mead

Other Ways You Can Help

The most important thing you can do for us throughout this campaign is share what we're doing.  Posting about our indie go go campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, or other social networking profile will help us more than you can imagine.  Share our new video, share our indie go go link, use the links above to share the campaign.  Tell your friends and family about that band with the weird Shakespeare reference for a name.  Not everyone will like the music, and not everyone will be able to contribute, but getting the word out will help us reach our goal.

Budget

See below for our projected budget.  We want to be as transparent as possible and if you join us in making this EP and tour a reality this is how we plan to use the funds.  (Based on reaching our goal)

Recording and Tour Budget  
   
Expenses  
Launch Video $260.00
   
Studio Fees  
Studio Time $1,000.00
Producer Fees $3,000.00
Gear Purchase $1,500.00
   
After Recording  
Mastering $600.00
PR Campaign $3,500.00
   
Tour Expenses  
Van $9,400.00
Pollstar Fees $500.00
Top Spin Store Fees $120.00
   
Grand Total $19,880.00
   
Fundraising Goal $25,525.00
Indie GoGo Fees (4%) -$795.00
Credit Card Fees (3%) -$596.00
Adjust Gross $24,134.00
Cost of Goods for Perks (20%) -$4,254.20
   
Fundraising Total $19,880.00

THANK YOU for helping Peace Mercutio take on the world!

Denyelle Long, Rebeccah Thiel, Sarah Kaul, Rose "Mom" Buckley, Amy Eisenhart, Rebecca Jordan, Bailey Jessee, Sean Rosenberg, Trenton Kassedyne, Allison Hoffman, Chris Paxton, Zach "Scum" McCauley, Casey "Rad" Radumus, Todd Sageser, Kate Alabaster, Derek "Taco Cool" Snook, Jeanine Schoessler, Dave Rafferty, Jason Arnold, Brianna Meyer, Kevin Hicks, Micah Oblak, Phil Oblak, Christina Oblak, Jordan and Alex Garfield, Brittany Olivas, Alex Heidtke, Aidan Shapiro-Leighton, Chris Hendrickson, Bree "Bamboo Pen" Gomez, Andrew Kowalski, Dave "10-speed" Jansen, Drew "Headshot" Lingo, Pete Emhoff, Joe Bosslet, Christopher Kim, Erica Laporte, Rebecca Thiel, Adam Rhode, Mark Weber, Scott Struebing, Brian "The One And Only" McNally, David Williamson, Karsen Endl, Brian Farmer, Out Like Pluto, Tom "The Bomb" Desrochers, Mike Fischer

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.
